I'm kind of stubborn like that.
In a culture like ours that determines a woman's worth by the size of her waist, it can be difficult to love yourself and your body.  That's why I do what I do - I help women love who they are, the size that they are, in the shape that they are in.  Whether that be hourglass or pear, we all deserve to feel beautiful.
If you believe as I do, here is how you can help...
 


SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
If you can't donate your money, donate your time by helping to spread the word.  
 
Tell your mom
Tell your dad
Tell your friends
Tell your enemies (they need love too)
 
Got skills? Hit me up on Facebook or Twitter and let me know what you can do to help.

story:
Tranquil Threads - Coming Soon! 

A Little Back Story

Friends, this campaign has just undergone a major revision and for all the right reasons! I started this campaign when I found out that I might not be able to pay off my training fees and become a fully certified teacher. Since this is my second major career (and one I plan on continuing through retirement) this was a freak out moment for me. My options (as I believed at the time) were very few. 1. I could find some very generous person to lend me almost $4000 before May 30th. 2. I could pay an extra $2000 to continue in the program through next school year. 3. I could return to music therapy. 

#1 Just wasn't going to happen.
#2 Sounded like I'd be digging a bigger hole I couldn't get out of. 
#3 Made me want to cry.

So Indiegogo to the rescue! If only I could get people to take a look at my page. Or maybe they are looking and just aren't interested in helping or none of my perks interest them. Or maybe (and this is my choice for the real reason) people don't like it when you beg for money. Ok, I understand that. 

I knew I couldn't rely on this so I kept looking for other options. Turns out, my school didn't have enough teachers to teach summer school but that's after (what I thought was) the deadline. Not going to be soon enough but at least I could get a jump on that extra $2000 if I needed it. Then I put my piano on Craigslist. The idea of selling my piano twisted my gut in ways you can't imagine but I figured sometime down the road (in many, many years probably) I could always buy another. I have two people coming to look at it on Sunday. And then I got a phone call I'd been hoping for: An offer to do work from home in my free time on medical transcriptions. I also found out my fees are not due on May 30th. I have until August 12. Those two people are SOL on my piano (don't worry, I'm sure they'll find others). I'M GOING TO MAKE IT, YALL! I will be able to raise the money in time so what to do with this Indiegogo Campaign?

I could just leave it as is. Who would know, right? Free money! But no, I had a better idea. 

Let's Sew!

My mother taught me to cross stitch when I was a child (I learned the other stitches much later) and taught me to sew when I was a teenager. Or at least, she tried to, I'm not a very good student sometimes. I can get very frustrated pretty quickly and we had some spectacular fights before she gave up on teaching me to sew. Fortunately I had learned enough to teach myself the rest. I continue to be amazed at the things she never got around to teaching me that would have made some of my earlier projects so much easier (and nicer looking). Guess I should be a more patient student. 

Introducing Tranquil Threads

Why Tranquil Threads? Because tranquility is something I continue to strive toward - something that will probably always be a goal of mine. I also use mainly recycled materials.  Though it is impossible with the types of things I do to make them 100% recycled, I get many of my materials recycled and from a wonderful store we have here in Denton, TX called SCRAP. 

http://www.scrapdenton.org/

In fact, my friend Heather has started her own Indiegogo Campaign to fund SCRAP's education project. Go check it out: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/scrap-denton-education-program/x/6776985

Tranquil Threads will specialize in bags of all sizes, guitar straps, and pillows. Many of the items will be hand embroidered and I will take custom orders.

What I Need & What You Get

$3500 was the cost I needed for my certification training fees. Though I'd still love to get that amount, (imagine the things I could make!) I know realistically it probably isn't going to happen. All the money I receive will go toward materials and start up costs for Tranquil Threads. Take a look at some the things I have made. Then, contribute some money and claim your perk. I promise you won't be disappointed. 

 


 

 

 

 

   

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read through my story and if you aren't able to help financially, please help by spreading my story. 
Society was there before you, it is there after you are gone, and you are a member of it. The myths that link you to your social group affirm that you are an organ of the larger organism. 
                                     Joseph Campbell
The Original Story

Continue reading if you're interested in this campaign's original story. 

Nine years ago I finished my master's degree in Music Therapy and began providing services to children with special needs in local schools and in their homes. I enjoyed this job very much. After all, they were paying me to play music with kids. Who wouldn't love that kind of a job? Unfortunately, the way music therapy services are provided in schools (here in Texas) is in groups for an hour each week. After a few years, I began think there was more I could do than only see students for such a small portion of the year. Over the years I kept feeling like I could provide more to kids if I was in the classroom full time so I finally decided to get my teaching certification. 

After researching the different programs in Texas for alternative certification, I decided the one at Region 11's Educational Service Center would be the best. This program, though it takes more time and is a little more expensive, provides soon-to-be teachers with a variety of classes designed not just to get you a job, but to make you a better teacher. I wanted to make sure I had all the tools possible before stepping in the classroom. The other great thing about this program was that the cost of it could be taken out of my paycheck over the course of my first year if I was able to land a job (or so I was told at the time).

Thank goodness I passed the tests! 

WOOOOOOOHOOOOOO! 

 In August I landed a job teaching ESL at wonderful charter school in Euless, TX. Because of our unique location next to Dallas International Airport, approximately a third of our students are from another country. I like to say, "if the language is spoken, someone in our school probably speaks it." There is one downside to this school, however. 

Region 11 has a system in place so this won't happen to people. If you are not able to pay the fees all at once, they will deduct the money from your check every month throughout your first year once you get a teaching job. However, my school doesn't do this and no one told me until December, after I had sent in the form twice. By then the monthly fees were too much for me to catch up with. 

Still, scrimp and save, right? It's possible I could have eaten nothing but beans and rice until May. I was sure I would still figure out a way to make that $3500 in time. I very well might have made it too if it wasn't for this little guy. 

I didn't choose him, Loki found me. He stopped me in the street one day and said, "take me home." So I did and he's been such a wonderful but very expensive addition to my home ever since. Over the last couple of years, Loki has had pancreatitis 4 times, a cyst burst in the middle of his back,  and surgeries to remove 2 other large cysts and some weird skin growth with an odd name. 

When the vet told me he needed another surgery last month, I knew there was no way I was going to make it to May. I love this dog. He's the sweetest, most loyal dog and loves to play. However, I do not recommend Cocker Spaniels to anyone and he will probably be my last. They tend to be very sickly dogs. 

Still, we would do it all again given a second chance.

story:
About Wild at Heart

A company striving to pursue the dreams of those who choose to be apart of it. Our designs come from the mind of our owner, but also from the collaboration effects of those who want to submit designs. Our owner Ryann Kunst decided to research hunger issues across our globe, and when he did, he didn't stop moving until he could do something about it

  • 16,000 children die every day due to hunger issues
  • Every shirt WAH sells will feed a child for 15 days
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 1,000 Dollars to proceed with our mission and our dreams. In return we give the customer the abilitly to provide food for a child who needs it most. Not only in Africa, but also Asia, United States, New Zealand and more. We are a global mission, not just one area, we are in this world to make it better. Our customer also gets an amazing tee or tank or hoodie or what have you to rep and wear and enjoy!

The Impact

The amount of HELP you'd be doing just by sharing our link or purchasing a shirt is UNREAL. Think about it for a second guys and gals, 16,000 children will die today, but with YOUR help we will decrease that number every 15 days by a child, just by buying a shirt that you LOVE. In todays world greed could get the best of us, but let's remember who really puts a smile on our faces, it's when you give something to someone who needs it more than you. Be apart of our mission, chase your dreams and help us chase ours. Be Wild at Heart.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every please SHARE this link through your social media. 
Do what you can, and help us provide children with life saving hunger funds.

Use the INDIEGOGO sharing tools if you feel the need to. We love you, and appreciate you. Video Coming soon.

story:
The most comfortable, versatile, high waisted compression leggings with built-in shape wear that are work appropriate. 

InvisiBelly combines the most advanced performance technology with old world belly reducing tradition to give you a fit that feels and looks good at the gym or at the office.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Inspired by old world belly wrapping tradition (an Ayurvedic postpartum ritual used to create lower chakra balance, assist in reducing swelling while slimming the belly), InvisiBelly are hands down the best leggings that provide shaping at the belly…and one inch up.

Most leggings stop at the bellybutton creating muffin top. InvisiBelly takes the waist up one more inch so that your entire torso - starting at the lower belly - is smooth, toned and held in without skin bunching or spilling over. You’ll get an immediate boost in confidence so you can go to the gym, and run around town in comfort without being self conscious or hiding behind oversized clothes. Im agine looking and feeling your absolute best wearing InvisiBelly leggings whether you’re doing lunches or crunches.

 

 

I’ve addressed one of the biggest problems with most leggings, a waistline that slips. A silicone gel waistband prevents you from having to hitch up your leggings every time you move. It’s comfortable so you won’t experience digging, cutting or rolling at your waistline. Finally, you can be confident your leggings are staying put!

 

 

 

Ever wanted to slip on a new pair of leggings without having to wear a long top or sweater because the rear is too sheer? Me too! That’s why I sourced substantial, durable,100% opaque yarns so that your day-of-the-week panties don’t peek through and you won’t have to cover your bum, unless you want to.

 

 

Made of 90% polyamide and 10% elastane InvisiBelly leggings are durable and give you a medium compression fit for a toned look that eliminates muffin top. 360-degree compression support also means they reduce soreness and improve circulation - cutting down muscle fatigue - while fully supporting your belly area. And yes, they’re safe and comfortable to wear postpartum

 

 

Trends come and go but your InvisiBelly leggings will become a wardrobe staple. Whether you’re a 9-5 professional, a new mum, or grandmother you can dress your leggings up or down. They’ll work with your active lifestyle 365 days of the year, from season to season.

 

 

 



 

 

Built in anti-microbial technology helps fight odor causing bacteria so your leggings stay fresh and clean longer.

 

You’ll feel dry and comfortable all day with moisture wicking, a defense mechanism that draws moisture away from your body.

 

 

 

 

Effortlessly transition between work, indoor or outdoor play like crawling on the floor with your toddler, yoga, cycling, or enjoying a night out with friends. InvisiBelly are your must pack, must wear, must have leggings that adapt to the demands of your busiest days at home or on the go.

 

*Made in Portugal

I created InvisiBelly to revolutionize the leggings market combining the best of athletic technology with shaping details that double as a garment you can wear to work. I also wanted to dispel the myth that leggings can’t be worn outside the gym. InvisiBelly is designed in classic styles you can wear to work or to workout. My in-house stylist, a legend in her field, was so impressed with the details and design she couldn’t help but say yes to joining the team.

 

We believe that when a woman feels beautiful, she feels empowered to make better choices. Choices that help her live an active, healthy and mindful life. Choices that help her redefine beauty as…

rainbow stripes of varied shapes and sizes because covergirl standards are limiting. 

worth measured by the curves of her heart not the shape of her waistline. 

loving her imperfections because beauty is imperfect. 

celebrating every stage of womanhood and every size of woman 24/7, 365. 

At InvisiBelly we want to champion a new standard of beauty that’s low on trends and high on individuality. Our leggings are designed to give women more time and freedom to explore their beautiful edges in comfort and style.

1. Select a PERK on the right side

Select the available perk you want to purchase on the right side of the page, whether it's 1 pair, 2 pairs or 4 pairs.

2. Payment:

Enter your payment information. 

3. Size, Color & Shipping Information:

Don’t worry about that yet! You will be sent a  survey in 10 days to get your colour options and size

 

Check out what you can save when you buy these well-made shoes. There's an old saying "buy cheap, and buy twice" and we know that to be true.

 

You’ll find that the leggings feel better the more you wear them because they mould to your body. When ordering, choose your true size. If you expect your weight to drop, order one size down. If you’re in between sizes, I recommend you size down. If you are not sure to go a size up or down, I would recommend a size down as the fabric stretches and you will get the full effect of the shapewear compression around your stomach and abdomen area.

 

 ***Also each of the waist has a good stretch to it, so for example, the size XS/S stretches to 69cm***

 

 

 

 

 

I'm a busy entrepreneur, wife and mother.

When I had my first child I struggled to lose the baby weight. Healing from my pregnancy was a slow two-year process and throughout, my mum coaxed me to consider the age-old Asian belly wrapping ritual she learned from her mother-in-law, my grandma Leela. I balked! After losing most of my baby weight, the hard way, I became pregnant with my second child. This time, I vowed to take better care of myself and recover more quickly. I remembered what mum said about belly wrapping and began my research.

My aha moment came when I thought, why not merge belly wrapping with the compression technology in athletic wear to create a legging for EVERYDAY USE? I tested what I could find on the market and while the compression mimicked Asian belly wrapping, I knew I could design a better product. And so I created my wish list:

 

 

Risks and challenges

As the former founder of Oscar and Olivia - a childrenswear company - and owner of Poppy Organics, I’m familiar with manufacturing, distribution and on-time delivery processes. I’ve hand selected a manufacturer that is as conscientious and professionally ethical as I am. They excel at using the finest material and technical details. Our UK warehouse is prepared to package and ship orders as efficiently and quickly as possible barring any unpredictable acts of nature. I’ve also tested the product and refined the prototypes to fit, wear and look beautiful on the body. I wear these leggings myself and am confident you will love them as much as I do.

Making sure you order your right, best size is the biggest potential challenge. I’ve tested the sizing on a variety of bodies and worked closely with our in-house stylist to provide the most accurate sizing options. Because this is our first production, we may sell out of your size so please refer to the sizing guide. If you’re unhappy with the size of your leggings, and if we still have your size in stock, I’m happy to arrange for an exchange.

You’ll find that the leggings feel better the more you wear them because they mould to your body. When ordering, choose your true size. If you expect your weight to drop, order one size down. If you’re in between sizes, I recommend you size down.

 

FAQS

 

Q: WILL YOU BE OFFERING MORE COLOURS AND DESIGNS?

Yes,  we will be offering more colours and designs. We currently offer Blue and Black.

Q: WHAT SIZES DO YOU OFFER?

We currently offer sizes ranging from UK 8-24/ US 4-20. We will be expanding the size range soon, and will keep you posted. Sign up here to be notified.

Q: IS THE MATERIAL BREATHABLE?

Yes the material is breathable. 


Q: DOES THE MATERIAL PROVIDE MOISTURE WICKING FEATURES?

Yes it does. 

 

Q: WILL THE LEGGINGS ROLL DOWN?

No, it wont, as we have inserted the latest non slip gel technology around to waist to ensure it stays put. We have tested it on different women and so far, the consensus with the non slip gel around the waist, it stops the leggings from rolling down.

 

Q: DOES IT REDUCE THE APPEARANCE OF THE CAMEL TOE EFFECT?

Yes - during our test phase it certainly passed the" elimination of the camel toe effect"
 

Q: DOES IT PASS THE SQUAT TEST? 

Yes - the material is not see through, so YES it passes the squat test.

 
Q: IS IT DURABLE?

One of the important elements while designing the leggings is to ensure that the leggings were made to last longer. We are BIG on being sustainable and avoiding the fast fashion effect. So the we have had really great feedback on the quality of our fabric.

 

OUR SOCIAL NETWORKS

loving her imperfections because beauty is imperfect. 
celebrating every stage of womanhood and every size of woman 24/7, 365. 
At InvisiBelly we want to champion a new standard of beauty that’s low on trends and high on individuality. Our leggings are designed to give women more time and freedom to explore their beautiful edges in comfort and style.



1. Select a PERK on the right side
Select the available perk you want to purchase on the right side of the page, whether it's 1 pair, 2 pairs or 4 pairs.
2. Payment:
Enter your payment information. 
3. Size, Color & Shipping Information:
Don’t worry about that yet! You will be sent a  survey in 10 days to get your colour options and size
 

Check out what you can save when you buy these well-made shoes. There's an old saying "buy cheap, and buy twice" and we know that to be true.
 

You’ll find that the leggings feel better the more you wear them because they mould to your body. When ordering, choose your true size. If you expect your weight to drop, order one size down. If you’re in between sizes, I recommend you size down. If you are not sure to go a size up or down, I would recommend a size down as the fabric stretches and you will get the full effect of the shapewear compression around your stomach and abdomen area.
 
 ***Also each of the waist has a good stretch to it, so for example, the size XS/S stretches to 69cm***


 


 
 
 


 

I'm a busy entrepreneur, wife and mother.
When I had my first child I struggled to lose the baby weight. Healing from my pregnancy was a slow two-year process and throughout, my mum coaxed me to consider the age-old Asian belly wrapping ritual she learned from her mother-in-law, my grandma Leela. I balked! After losing most of my baby weight, the hard way, I became pregnant with my second child. This time, I vowed to take better care of myself and recover more quickly. I remembered what mum said about belly wrapping and began my research.
My aha moment came when I thought, why not merge belly wrapping with the compression technology in athletic wear to create a legging for EVERYDAY USE? I tested what I could find on the market and while the compression mimicked Asian belly wrapping, I knew I could design a better product. And so I created my wish list:

 

 
Risks and challenges
As the former founder of Oscar and Olivia - a childrenswear company - and owner of Poppy Organics, I’m familiar with manufacturing, distribution and on-time delivery processes. I’ve hand selected a manufacturer that is as conscientious and professionally ethical as I am. They excel at using the finest material and technical details. Our UK warehouse is prepared to package and ship orders as efficiently and quickly as possible barring any unpredictable acts of nature. I’ve also tested the product and refined the prototypes to fit, wear and look beautiful on the body. I wear these leggings myself and am confident you will love them as much as I do.
Making sure you order your right, best size is the biggest potential challenge. I’ve tested the sizing on a variety of bodies and worked closely with our in-house stylist to provide the most accurate sizing options. Because this is our first production, we may sell out of your size so please refer to the sizing guide. If you’re unhappy with the size of your leggings, and if we still have your size in stock, I’m happy to arrange for an exchange.
You’ll find that the leggings feel better the more you wear them because they mould to your body. When ordering, choose your true size. If you expect your weight to drop, order one size down. If you’re in between sizes, I recommend you size down.

 
FAQS
 
Q: WILL YOU BE OFFERING MORE COLOURS AND DESIGNS?
Yes,  we will be offering more colours and designs. We currently offer Blue and Black.
Q: WHAT SIZES DO YOU OFFER?
We currently offer sizes ranging from UK 8-24/ US 4-20. We will be expanding the size range soon, and will keep you posted. Sign up here to be notified.
Q: IS THE MATERIAL BREATHABLE?
Yes the material is breathable. 

Q: DOES THE MATERIAL PROVIDE MOISTURE WICKING FEATURES?
Yes it does. 
 
Q: WILL THE LEGGINGS ROLL DOWN?
No, it wont, as we have inserted the latest non slip gel technology around to waist to ensure it stays put. We have tested it on different women and so far, the consensus with the non slip gel around the waist, it stops the leggings from rolling down.
 
Q: DOES IT REDUCE THE APPEARANCE OF THE CAMEL TOE EFFECT?
Yes - during our test phase it certainly passed the" elimination of the camel toe effect" 
Q: DOES IT PASS THE SQUAT TEST? 
Yes - the material is not see through, so YES it passes the squat test.
 Q: IS IT DURABLE?
One of the important elements while designing the leggings is to ensure that the leggings were made to last longer. We are BIG on being sustainable and avoiding the fast fashion effect. So the we have had really great feedback on the quality of our fabric.
 
OUR SOCIAL NETWORKS

story:
INTRODUCING OUR NEW OUTERWEAR COLLECTION 

Cortèz creates the highest-quality outerwear and sells it straight from the manufacturer to you. This year's collection offers 3-layer shell jackets, full-zip fleece jackets and 3-layer shell pants. 

OUR SHELL JACKETS

 

 

THE CORTÈZ JACKET VS. ARC'TERYX AND NORRONA

A picture is worth a thousand words. Let us show you why we believe the Cortèz jacket can easily compete with the best in the industry.

OUR REVOLUTIONARY FABRIC

Dermizax®EV - The perfect membrane that redefines comfort and protection for high-performance fabrics.

Created with proprietary technology in Japan and designed to protect you in all weather conditions. 

It's a durable and lightweight 3-layer fabric that can be washed like any other textiles. The perfect fabric for our collection of High-Performance jackets.

Besides waterproofness, we highly value the fabric's exceptional breathability.

See below how the Dermizax membrane compares to other high-performance fabrics.

OUR FLEECE JACKETS - Keeps you warm - whenever, wherever.

Especially for the Indiegogo community, all backers receive a beautifully designed full-zip fleece jacket for free (€100 value).

The fleece is perfect for diverse outdoor activities and features with a Hi-Tech polyester fabric which is warm, durable and breathable. Perfect for layering in colder conditions or just as a standalone piece. Available for men and women.  

The perfect match for your jacket. Featured with the same Dermizax 3-layer membrane. Created for skiing, snowboarding and hiking in colder conditions. 

Build with the most premium materials on the market. 

 

THE CORTÈZ PANT VS. ARC'TERYX AND NORRONA

A picture is worth a thousand words. Let us show you why we believe the Cortèz pant can easily compete with the best in the industry.

 

MERINO WOOL BASE LAYER 

Especially for the Indiegogo community, all backers who order the 3-layer shell jacket and pants receive a nice and warm merino wool base layer set for free (€148 value). 

FOR MEN AND WOMEN

Our second collection is available in 5 colors, both for men and women. 

Check the 360° video below or Pre-order for €329 via a Perk on top of this page.

CHILI - Including a Full-zip fleece jacket for free (value €100)

*Pre-order for €329 via a Perk on top of this page.

GOLDEN GLOW - Including a Full-zip fleece jacket for free (value €100) 

*Pre-order for €329 via a Perk on top of this page.

DARK BLUE - Including a Full-zip fleece jacket for free (value €100) 

*Pre-order for €329 via a Perk on top of this page.

FOREST GREEN - Including a Full-zip fleece jacket for free (value €100)

 

REWARDS

Especially for our early backers on Indiegogo, the Cortèz jackets and/or pants will be delivered including a warm full-zip fleece jacket and/or base layer for free. See our packages below to find out everything you need to know.

*NOTE: you'll choose the model, size and color after the campaign has ended. 

 

TIMELINE

After our 1st Kickstarter campaign in 2017, we delivered 1000+ packages to backers living all over the world. We are 100% sure to do so again in 2018 and we will make sure each backer becomes a happy owner of their ordered Cortèz products.  

All production lines have already been reserved which guarantees us output on time, according to the timeline below. 

SIZE CHART

After the campaign we'll contact you to help you select the right size and color.

Nevertheless, below you can find our size chart to already measure your chest, waist and hips. This will help you to choose that one size that fits you best.

This is us, rocking the Cortèz jacket! We are passionate skiers and outdoor enthusiasts with an extensive background in clothing production, fashion and entrepreneurship.

As the founders of Sqetch.co Wiebe and Wouter have helped hundreds of fashion brands and clothing suppliers to grow their business.

Herman has been working in the field of clothing production for 40+ years and is the owner of Vert Company, a true pioneer in sustainable production.

We're on a mission to create lasting outdoor experiences and re-green our planet. That's why we partnered up with Justdiggit and started to cool down the planet. For every jacket sold we re-green 50m2 of land on the foot of the Kilimanjaro (Tanzania) to reduce global warming.

At Cortèz you don't buy to get, you buy to give. 

 

EXCELLENT VALUE: SELLING STRAIGHT FROM THE MANUFACTURER

By using a disruptive direct-to-consumer model, and cutting out the middlemen, we can offer our products for an exceptionally reduced price while maintaining the same high-quality standards as leading industry brands.

As a result, we can offer our high-performance 3-layer jacket + full-zip fleece jacket for €319 (Indiegogo price).

 

OUR DESIGN PROCESS

This is outerwear you are going to love, so we want to make sure it lasts.

Together with the most respected manufacturers in the industry we are ready for our second collection.

Highest quality products, outstanding design and build to last.

 

SPECIAL THANKS 

Our first early supporting backers from our previous campaign of last year :)

Video credits: Matemade - Creative Film Company

Photography credits: Thomas van Schaik - Still Life & Product Photography

Design: Ivan Pashchenko

Cortèz superstar: Ioanna Zygogianni

AND OF COURSE..

We would love to thank our family and friends for their support during the Cortèz journey so far, we couldn't have done it without you!

Let's hope together we can make this a huge success!

After the campaign we'll contact you to help you select the right size and color.
Nevertheless, below you can find our size chart to already measure your chest, waist and hips. This will help you to choose that one size that fits you best.

WHAT OUR CUSTOMERS SAY ABOUT CORTÈZ

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN US?

This is us, rocking the Cortèz jacket! We are passionate skiers and outdoor enthusiasts with an extensive background in clothing production, fashion and entrepreneurship.
As the founders of Sqetch.co Wiebe and Wouter have helped hundreds of fashion brands and clothing suppliers to grow their business.
Herman has been working in the field of clothing production for 40+ years and is the owner of Vert Company, a true pioneer in sustainable production.

story:
Our Campaign Has Ended

Click here to visit www.lalabu.com for the latest updates

This patent-pending invention is the only baby carrier that has been thoughtfully designed into a romper that your baby wears. Simply unzip the stowed straps, pick your baby up, and put them on at any time.  It’s that easy. Wearabu makes babywearing as intuitive as putting on a backpack.

The top safety considerations for all baby carriers are providing a clear path to breathe and preventing falls.  In addition, it is important to properly support your baby's hips.  Wearabu's romper approach fundamentally addresses all three.

1. Maintains a clear path to breathe: A primary concern for traditional carriers and slings is whether the baby will slide down into the pouch and have their face covered by the pouch, preventing a clear pathway to breathe.  Wearabu's design has eliminated the pouch and replaced it with a romper that fits baby's body.  It isn't possible for your baby to slide down too far into the romper and block their breathing.  This ensures that your baby's pathway to breathe is never blocked by the carrier.

2. Prevents falls: Baby carriers are tested to see whether the pouch holes are too big.  The point of the test is to make sure that a baby can't slip through an opening and fall.  Again, the romper approach eliminates "pouch holes" all together in favor of a clothing design with no way to slip through the pant legs.  In addition, Wearabu allows you to secure your baby in the carrier prior to wearing them as opposed to traditional carriers that don't allow you to secure your baby ahead of putting them on.  This lets you make sure they are snug and secure with both hands prior to lifting them up to carry them. 

3. Supports baby's hips: It's important to make sure that your carrier supports your baby's hips and doesn't allow them to dangle straight down.  Wearabu's integrated “hip straps” move your baby’s legs into the proper hip positioning while being worn and release to allow free range of motion while playing in the romper.  How does this work?  The adult straps are internally connected to a support structure that pulls into proper positioning whenever you hold your baby.  When you're not holding your baby, there is extra slack in the stowed straps that allow the legs to have free range of motion.  It's really cool and something that just works without you having to think about it.

The bottom line is that Wearabu was designed from the ground up for safety.

It’s flexible, breathable, and lightweight.  In fact, it is less than half the weight of a traditional soft-structured carrier.  We worked hard to make this something your baby can comfortably wear throughout the day, even while playing.

There’s no extra gear to keep up with when not in use and no bulky straps.  We leveraged principles from the latest in outdoor gear to create a contoured strap that provides comfort without bulk.  This also allows parents to easily wear another pack, purse, or jacket while wearing their baby.

What’s the big deal about babywearing you ask? Well everyone knows babies want to be held all the time and there’s good reason for it. Physical touch is critical to their development, they feel most safe and secure right next mom or dad and it even jump starts their learning as they experience their parent interact with the world. With Wearabu we’ve simplified babywearing so more parents and babies can experience all this goodness.

By backing our campaign you will be the first to own and/or give a Wearabu Babywearing Romper.  Wearabu is intended to be used as soon as babies outgrow our babywearing shirts, between 4-6 months old for most babies.  If your baby is not yet born, you also have the opportunity to bundle one of our existing products with a Wearabu at a large discount from our normal prices.

 

We need to raise $25,000.  All of this money will go towards the down payment of the first order of Babywearing Rompers.  This will enable us to produce Wearabu in one color and will subsidize the total cost of production to a level that we can cover the rest with our current operating budget.  


Your Support Really Makes a Difference

Our founders, Brian and Keri, began working on Lalabu in 2011.  Once per week Brian would go to a coffee shop to work on our first product.  Soon he was waking up early to get 2 hours of Lalabu work done before going to his full-time job.  Keri’s mom sewed the prototypes and they tested the original babywearing shirts on their first child.  Vacations were used to travel to tradeshows and find a production partner. Crowdfunding was new back then and a founder of another campaign Brian had backed online helped us find a US production partner.

In January of 2013 Brian and Keri quit their jobs to launch Lalabu.  They began the business out of a 5x5 ft spare bedroom nook on a $200 Chromebook.  That May five years ago, crowdfunders just like yourselves, helped us to raise $18,000 and fund the downpayment of the first production order of the Soothe Shirt.  To give the business a greater chance of success, Brian and Keri sold their house and moved into a 1-bedroom apartment with their son. They went down to one car, started biking around the city, lived on very little, and worked without pay for the next 2 years.  Steadily our business has grown.

At Lalabu, we account not just for sales dollars, but also for our positive impact on lives throughout the world.  So since the beginning we’ve given 2% of all revenue to help families, even when our business wasn’t profitable and there was no money for salaries.  Thanks to crowdfunders like you, over 40,000 people have started their lives in one of our products now and we’ve been able to loan over $100,000 to mom entrepreneurs in Africa.  Through your support, you’ve also provided adoption assistance, conception assistance, and supported other start-ups doing good.

We’re now a small team of 4 full-time employees and 6 part-time employees that do everything from marketing to fulfillment out of our 2,000 sq ft office in Atlanta.  We view ourselves as a little business with a big vision to change the world, one baby at a time. We aim to impact 100,000 families over the next 3 years. As we’ve grown we’ve reinvested our revenues back into making new innovative products.  We are still a company that is bootstrapped by our founders and genuinely need you to support our campaign so we can bring new products like Wearabu to market.

Wearabu would make a perfect gift for any expecting parent.  If you’re not able to contribute funds, here are a few incredibly helpful things you can do right now for free:

Spread the Word

Please help more people learn about our campaign. It is the single most helpful thing you can do in addition to pledging funds.  An easy and effective way to do so is to use the sharing buttons at the top of this page (on desktop) or lower right (on your phone).  They look like this:

On Instagram Stories?  Us too!  Post a quick video about Wearabu and tag us @lalabubaby to help people find us.

We have an online media kit with images and video you can use to share our story here.

If all else fails, tell someone in person ;)  Thank you!!!

 

For more information, please click here.

Have a question?  Please post it as a comment to the campaign and our team will get you an answer as soon as we can.

 

We ship to The United States, Australia, Brazil, Canada, Europe, Japan, Mexico, New Zealand and The United Kingdom.  When redeeming your perks after the campaign ends, you will be able to specify a shipping address and shipment method. We ship for free via USPS in the US and Canada.  We ship via FedEx International Priority Service outside of the US and Canada; rates vary by location and start around $22. Please be aware that country-specific duties and tariffs may be charged to customers shipping outside of the United States.

Reviews and Press / Customer Reviews

Reviews and Press / Customer Reviews

We ship for free via USPS in the US and Canada.  We ship via FedEx International Priority Service outside of the US and Canada; rates vary by location and start around $22. Please be aware that country-specific duties and tariffs may be charged to customers shipping outside of the United States.Reviews and Press / Customer ReviewsReviews and Press / Customer Reviews

story:
Heath Morrison and Devin Mullen plan to open a fitness apparel clothing line. We are both from small towns in Oklahoma with a passion for fitness. Working out started for us early in our Middle School career, and over the years it has developed into a lifestyle for us. 
We are starting a campaign to obtain start-up costs for an apparel clothing line that is not only form fitting and comfortable to wear in the gym, but stylish enough to wear to a night out on the town. Our products will be high quality products that are not rough and shrink after the first wash. We are adamant about producing apparel that will look great in the gym, at your favorite restaurant, or walking through the grocery store. 
We will be grateful for everyone supporting us to obtain the fee's associated with the website design and optimization. With the website optimization we will able to showcase our products to a great array of customers to be very satisfied with our products. The design/project cost is $3,000 along with an additional $3,500 for optimization. There is also a $1,000 set-up fee associated with the website design. Legal fee's to create the business along with a program to track business expenses will be about $900. For utilization of the artist with their custom artwork we will be spending about $1,200. Set-up fee's with the printing company and acquiring our initial stock will be an additional few thousand dollars.

What We Need & What You Get

You will be supporting us obtain:

  • Website design/project cost - $3,000
  • Website optimization - $3,500
  • Additional website fee's - $1,000
  • Legal fee's - $800
  • Business expense tracking software - $200
  • Custom artwork designs - $1,200
  • Fee's with printing company and initial stock - A few thousand dollars
  • PERKS for supporting our cause!!!!
  • For every donation of $25 we will thank you with our Instagram Account - IG Shout out
  • We will be asking for recommendations on a slogan, if your slogan is selected we will create a shirt with your slogan. We will give you that shirt and another shirt of your liking at no charge. $100 doniation required. 
  • Any donation over $1,000 we will provide you any autographed product you wish. Once you receive this product send us a picture of you wearing our product, we will post on our social media accounts. 
  • Top donation dollar amount will work personally with us in the development of our next design. They will have the final say so approving the design, and will receive a copy of the art-work. 
  • If our goal is not reached, the amount acquired will be used for product/artwork design development. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out to everyone you know to support our cause. Post our link on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Use the hashtag #m2fitness & #msquaredfitness Give us slogan ideas, design ideas, apparel colors. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
A Quick Intro

My industrial design and construction hobby started when I was very small and still playing with Legos. Even then, I had a desire to make cool, sophisticated, and unique products. So I started this business, and I was hooked from the very first time I welded two pieces of metal. I took my passion of metal working and the skills I learned with my business partners and started to create projects I love.

Why We Need Your Help

Over years and years of many successes and failures, I've come to realize that the tools I have can only do so much when it comes to stainless steel. You see, the thicker a metal is, the more powerful cutting device you need in order to get the shapes and pieces you want. This is especially important when making larger, thicker pieces like medicine cabinets, cupboards, and fireplaces. Wherever I could, I would use reclaimed and recycled stainless steel. But there is only so much you can do without actually going out and cutting large pieces on your own. That is why we are asking for your support and help in raising the funds to get a commercially available, industrial shear.

We already have one reserved and all we need now is to meet fundraising goals in order to purchase the shear. We have chosen a robust, simple, yet affective shear that is a real work horse, and it is completely adequate for our needs for the foreseable future.

What Happens If We Surpass Our Goal?

We would love as much support as possible, and there would be no limit to how many pieces of furnishings and fixtures we could produce with a new metal shear.

We will send a reward for every pledge that we receive, outlined in the right side of this page. If we receive more than $6,750, we will use the excess money to purchase our shear and keep making unique and custom products. So please be generous and give what you can; check out the video above for more details, and the rewards to the right and below to see what you'll receive for helping us out!

 

I hope you can help make this project and my dream a reality. If you have any questions, please feel free to look around and ask me. Thank you, danke, gracias, xie xie, arigato for all of your support and interest!

story:
Aural Sects are pleased to announce that the long-promised Aural Sects logo tees are going to be printed. These will be limited to whoever purchases them through this kickstarter project.

All money not put towards making the rewards available will be put towards funding physical releases for the label, so we can finally start putting our artists out onto a physical format.

The t-shirts will be printed on high-quality cotton, and the print itself will of a similarly high quality. One of the managers of AS has been wearing his two tees on rotation practically non-stop for months, and there has been no degradation of print.

Also, as a sillier reward we have the Aural Sects Membership package, where the receiver will get a membership card, a unique membership number, and access to all music and physical purchases a week before anyone else, from now until Aural Sects ceases to be an entity (which we hope is never...). 

Let us know what design and what size you wish to order. We can cater from Small to XXL, just e-mail us!:

auralsects1@gmail.com

Thanks so much for all the love and support we've had so far ♥

Bunny,
Aural Sects

story:
We believe that beautiful things should be made in a beautiful way. That's why we set out a little over a year ago to build a jewelry company that employs women transitioning out of homelessness to make each piece. It's been an incredible year of learning and growth since we launched. We've created a supportive community, sold thousands of pieces of jewelry, and helped two women transition back into housing of their own and a job that can support it.

Now, we are ready to grow. We are committed to expanding our impact by employing and empowering 20 women in 2020 in a way that is thoughtful and sustainable. To do this, we've completely reimagined the jewelry we make and the way we make it, to bring you impactful fine jewelry that's accessibly priced and responsibly crafted.

But to make this possible, we need your help to pre-order our new jewelry or donate to our campaign so that we can buy new equipment, complete our new jewelry line, begin hiring more Makers. With your help, we will continue our rapid growth and create truly transformative employment opportunities that connect and empower both our Makers and our customers. 

 

*All stud earrings come in a pair

 

*All earrings come in a pair

 

 

Choose from any of our jewelry packages to get the perfect assortment of pieces. Have your preferred styles in mind, but don't worry about submitting that at checkout.

 

Not interested in one of our jewelry packages but still want to contribute to our mission? Make a donation instead!

Desktop

Just select the pink "Back it" button at the top of the page and chose your contribution amount. We are tremendously thankful for your support. 

Mobile

To the right of our jewelry packages, you can make a "contribution."

 

From our inception over a year ago, our mission has always been to create employment opportunities for women transitioning out of homelessness. We started by working out of a milk crate on a park bench with a single Maker, helping her make some extra spending money. But from those small beginnings, we have built a jewelry business that has sold thousands of pieces of handcrafted jewelry and employed 5 women. Just this summer, we took a huge step and moved Unlocked into our very own office and industrial space, giving us the room to continue to grow.

We know that our Makers need more than just employment opportunities and wages to sustainably transition back into housing. That's why, alongside our jewelry business, we've built a social program that provides holistic resources like transitional housing, career and life counseling, and mental health counseling. Together, employment at Unlocked and our social program have helped 2 of our Makers, Gwen and Leticia, transition back into employment outside of Unlocked.

--

This is just the beginning. We believe that we have the foundations of something really special, and we have no intention of slowing down now! With your help, we are prepared to grow our business and take our impact to the next level. We are building a comprehensive 6-month transitional program that will provide the work experience, wages, community, and skills development to help every woman we work with get back into housing and employment permanently.

This is a big goal. To create this many employment opportunities, we need to build a truly innovative jewelry business, both for our customers and our Makers. With that in mind, we are launching the next iteration of Unlocked, reimagining what we make and how we make it.

 

 

 

We believe that high quality, thoughtfully designed jewelry should be attainable for every woman. Our Makers will craft every piece entirely in-house, cutting out the middlemen to provide you with high quality jewelry that doesn’t break the bank.

 
 

Innovative Process, Thoughtful Design

To take our jewelry to the next level, we've spent all summer learning an entirely new production process called lost wax casting. Basically, we melt down Sterling Silver and pouring it into our custom molds. This is an advanced process typically reserved for large manufacturing operations, so we are really excited about what it will let us do.

With this process, we can craft almost anything we can design, from minimalist stackers and geometric earrings to ornate pendant necklaces and classic statement rings. And since we do the production ourselves, from metal to final polish, we can ensure the highest level of quality control and craftsmanship, creating beautiful jewelry that's made to last. 

 

Recycled Sterling Silver

All our designs are available in a classic Sterling Silver, a beautiful and durable materials at an accessible price point. We are proud to say that we use 100% recycled and SCS certified sterling silver, meaning that our silver will never come from a mine. 

24k Gold Vermeil

For our gold vermeil pieces, we plate a thick layer of 24k gold onto our recycled sterling silver. Traditional plating puts a thin layer of gold onto base metals like brass and bronze, making the pieces subject to wear and discoloration. Our gold vermeil, however, is over 5x as thick, at 2.5 microns, and always plated onto sterling silver. That means you can wear our Gold Vermeil pieces for years without fear, at prices you can afford.

 

Recycled Materials

We're building a holistic, ethical fashion brand, so we are working harder than ever to make sure our jewelry is made responsibly, both in its environmental and social impact. This starts with using recycled silver in all our casted products, which is certified 100% recycled and refined by our supplier in a way that reduces energy use and eliminates waste water. 

Transparency

Our jewelry will be made in-house at our Nashville studio, from raw, recycled metal to final polish. With total supply chain control, we can be completely transparent with you about our production processes and our impact. We are committed to monitoring, tracking, and improving our performance on metrics like water, energy, and chemical usage. We will publish our first impact report at the end of our Indiegogo fulfillment to set a baseline of performance from which we can improve.

 

This has always been what makes our jewelry so special for us and our customers. Through our packaging, social media, and Maker bios online, we've worked hard to show customers how every piece of Unlocked jewelry creates deeply personal impact.

Engraved Initials

Starting with our new line of jewelry, we will be even more intentional about connecting customers to the story behind each piece. Each piece will be engraved with the initials of the woman who made it, so you can be reminded of your positive impact on someone’s life each time you put it on.

Behind the Scenes

Starting with our Indiegogo campaign, we will also be launching a Behind the Scenes blog, exclusively for our customers. The blog will feature messages from our Makers and staff, exclusive insight into our programming, from financial literacy courses to crafting jewelry, and sneak peaks of upcoming developments at Unlocked. Through this Behind the Scenes blog, we hope to give you a more personal look at the difference you’re making in the lives of our Makers.

 

 

Mission

We employ women to craft gorgeous jewelry at our studio, providing a stable wage, supportive community, and job training experience. 

While employment is a crucial component to self-sufficiency, our Makers face many complex barriers, and a job alone is not enough. That's why we've been building a holistic social program that includes housing and services alongside our jewelry business, providing the support our Makers need to transition sustainably.

Alongside our work with our Makers, we strive to empower our customers through the impact they can create. Sharing our Makers’ messages of hope and strength, we seek to break down the stigma of homelessness and create a more equitable world. 

Using our influence to be kinder to the planet, we will continue to improve our sustainability measures through our recycled materials and water and electricity usage.

 

Story

Unlocked’s founding story is unique, if not downright miraculous. Rooted in genuine relationship, the concept emerged when Alexis, a Nashville native, began befriending people experiencing homelessness while on a medical leave of absence from Vanderbilt. Inspired, Alexis met regularly with Corbin, a friend from Vandy, to explore the idea of a company that would both create wages and address barriers. 

A few months later, one of Alexis’ dear friends, Ray, called to ask Alexis to meet him at the hospital. Ray had been homeless most of his life and was now in his mid-sixties; he and Alexis had met years prior while she was volunteering at a local transitional home. In a conversation that would become one of their last, Ray announced to Alexis that he had a duffle bag of money that he wanted her to have after he passed.

Corbin and Alexis decided to name the company “Unlocked” to symbolize unlocking wages and opportunities for future employees and, of course, unlocking the storage unit. The pair went full-time with Unlocked upon graduation in 2018.  

In the past year, Unlocked has grown considerably. With humble beginnings, we began working on park benches before later upgrading to a storage closet at a partnering nonprofit, Community Care Fellowship. Most recently, we began leasing our own workshop and office near East Nashville. In that time, we’ve worked with five women, sold thousands of pieces of jewelry, and formed partnerships with incredible nonprofits. We can’t say enough about how grateful we are for the ways that the community has wrapped its arms around us, providing encouragement, support, and guidance. 

 

 

Founders

Corbin Hooker 

Corbin is the Co-Founder and Co-President of a Unlocked. He graduated Vanderbilt University in 2018 with a triple major in political science, economics, and history with a minor in corporate strategy. He is committed to the service of others and is focused on leading projects that move us towards a more just society and a more equitable world. In addition to building social enterprises, Corbin plans to eventually expand his capacity to create institutional change through public office.


Alexis Cook

Alexis is a passionate individual with a drive to create a more equitable world through increased opportunity and empowerment. The Co-Founder and Co-President of Unlocked, Alexis was an Ingram Scholar at Vanderbilt University, where she graduated in 2018 with a bachelor’s in Human and Organizational Development and a minor in Economics. Prior to studying at Vanderbilt, Alexis spent a year working at five different non-profit internships in five different countries, learning more about poverty through the eyes of those experiencing it. Alexis is focused on using her leadership to elevate the voices of marginalized people, creating pathways for sustainable change.

 

Vision

Beginning with the women that we hire to fulfill your Indiegogo pre-orders, our Makers will go through a 6-month transitional program that combines employment and holistic resources in a cohesive and streamlined experience. Working with nonprofits, we provide services that help Makers build a stable foundation for their lives, with employment at Unlocked as the center of their transition. 

We recruit Makers through one of our nonprofit partners, Community Care Fellowship (CCF). After officially hiring a woman to work at Unlocked, we work with CCF and other nonprofit partners to help her move into a private transitional housing unit before she begins working at Unlocked, affording her both stability and privacy. Makers can live in their transitional unit until they have moved into their own permanent residence, which they identify with the help of their housing case managers, or they can choose to stay long-term in their transitional unit by transferring the lease into their own name. During their time at Unlocked, Makers contribute to rent in proportion to the wages they earn crafting jewelry, allowing them to scale their responsibility monthly as they stabilize and take on more hours at Unlocked.

Unlocked also has partnerships with mental health counselors and career counselors who have agreed to meet weekly with Makers at our office at no cost to the women, allowing Makers to receive personalized care without transportation or budgeting difficulties. We also provide weekly financial training courses at the office, combining group activities with personal goals and cash prizes incentives each month.

Integrating all the Unlocked’s components, from housing to employment to counseling, our social programming is divided into six “phases” with tangible goals for each, some predetermined and some personal. After completing the goals of each of the six phases, which should each last one month, a Maker will either “graduate” to the next phase or be asked to repeat the phase if she has not completed the goals she set for herself (examples of goals include things like timeliness, savings, and meetings with counselors). In this way, our programming is measurable for both Unlocked Makers and staff, and it is flexible based on the priorities of each Maker and the rate of their personal progression through the programming. For those that “repeat” a phase, they will simply stay with Unlocked programming and employment longer than the 6-month timeline.

 

Community Partners

Our community partners are essential for the holistic support our Makers need. They are the reason we were able to begin building a comprehensive social program so quickly, and they are the key to our success in empowering our Makers beyond employment. We are incredibly grateful for their continued support of this company and mission.

Community Care Fellowship

The CCF serves as a daytime shelter that provides hot meals, warm showers, laundry/hygiene facilities, counseling, and social services referrals for people experiencing homelessness. Beyond providing these core services, they have programs such as career counseling and pre-K education to help break down the cycles of poverty.

Unlocked and CCF have worked together to develop a system that provides Unlocked Makers with access to career counselors, housing specialists, and a transitional housing unit for the duration of their employment at Unlocked.

Urban Housing Solutions (by extension)

Through a “master lease” partnership, Urban Housing Solutions leases affordable housing units to CCF, which they can then sublease or sign over permanently to Unlocked Makers or other participants in their career counseling program.

Laura Edwards, Career Counselor 

Laura Edwards is the volunteer career counselor for Community Care Fellowship’s career counseling program. She serves as our “recruiter” by recommending best-fit candidates to apply and interview with Unlocked, and she offers continued career counseling sessions to Unlocked Makers.  Unlocked currently hires exclusively through CCF’s career counseling program to streamline the recruitment process.

Dr. Rena Hall, Career Counselor

The CEO of Together We Can consultants, Dr. Hall has an impressive background in nonprofits and executive management, fortified by her 27 years of experience in the education sector. She began working with Unlocked as a career counselor to meet weekly with Makers and develop our 6-month curriculum, based on self-image, personal relationships, self-advocacy, and skills like interviewing and resume building. Her talents are of tremendous benefit to Unlocked Makers as they build confidence and professional direction.

Community Financial Resources

Community Financial Resources is a financial services nonprofit that focuses on empowering low-income individuals. To ensure the best fit for our Makers, CFR did a “deep dive” on Unlocked and created a personalized 8-week curriculum of financial training that includes savings, budgeting, and goal-setting. We host the sessions weekly, fostering a sense of support and community in the group-based activities and lessons.

Through a partnership with US Bank, Community Financial Resources also offers Unlocked Makers direct deposit payroll cards called Focus Cards, allowing Makers to receive their wages without going to a bank or paying a cashing fee. With their Focus Cards, each Maker also has a separate personal savings account and can set up automatic savings. Unlocked Makers also use CFR's $goals$ app, which incentivizes productive habits by allowing Makers to “log” their financial actions, and the Maker with the most approved actions at the end of the month wins a cash bonus.

 

 

Funding Goal

This transition to the next iteration of Unlocked is absolutely critical to our ability to employ and empower more women. For months, we have been building up to this to this moment by developing the skills and buying the preliminary equipment needed to make very small batches of these products.

 

Funding Use 

With the funds raised by this campaign, we will buy the equipment necessary to be able to produce this jewelry faster, more reliably, and at scale. 

 

You can make a difference

  • Please pre-order a perk or make a contribution with the pink “back it” button

  • Please share this page with someone you think might love it

 

We will send you frequent updates about the progress of this campaign and of your purchase, so that you'll always be the first to know about new designs, new hires, and expected the delivery date of your products.

With our current machinery, we are already able to make our new jewelry in small batches, so even if we experience unexpected obstacles along the way,  you will be sure to get your purchases.

 

THANK YOU for contributing to this campaign and for sharing our story with your friends and family. We can’t begin to express our gratitude for all those that have supported us up to this point and beyond. We truly believe this is about so much more than jewelry. It’s about what the community- you and me- can do when we come together to make a better world for people and the planet.
