Our Makers will craft every piece entirely in-house, cutting out the middlemen to provide you with high quality jewelry that doesn’t break the bank. 

 
Innovative Process, Thoughtful DesignTo take our jewelry to the next level, we've spent all summer learning an entirely new production process called lost wax casting. Basically, we melt down Sterling Silver and pouring it into our custom molds. This is an advanced process typically reserved for large manufacturing operations, so we are really excited about what it will let us do.With this process, we can craft almost anything we can design, from minimalist stackers and geometric earrings to ornate pendant necklaces and classic statement rings. And since we do the production ourselves, from metal to final polish, we can ensure the highest level of quality control and craftsmanship, creating beautiful jewelry that's made to last.  Recycled Sterling SilverAll our designs are available in a classic Sterling Silver, a beautiful and durable materials at an accessible price point. We are proud to say that we use 100% recycled and SCS certified sterling silver, meaning that our silver will never come from a mine. 24k Gold VermeilFor our gold vermeil pieces, we plate a thick layer of 24k gold onto our recycled sterling silver. Traditional plating puts a thin layer of gold onto base metals like brass and bronze, making the pieces subject to wear and discoloration. Our gold vermeil, however, is over 5x as thick, at 2.5 microns, and always plated onto sterling silver. That means you can wear our Gold Vermeil pieces for years without fear, at prices you can afford. Recycled MaterialsWe're building a holistic, ethical fashion brand, so we are working harder than ever to make sure our jewelry is made responsibly, both in its environmental and social impact. This starts with using recycled silver in all our casted products, which is certified 100% recycled and refined by our supplier in a way that reduces energy use and eliminates waste water. TransparencyOur jewelry will be made in-house at our Nashville studio, from raw, recycled metal to final polish. With total supply chain control, we can be completely transparent with you about our production processes and our impact. We are committed to monitoring, tracking, and improving our performance on metrics like water, energy, and chemical usage. We will publish our first impact report at the end of our Indiegogo fulfillment to set a baseline of performance from which we can improve. This has always been what makes our jewelry so special for us and our customers. Through our packaging, social media, and Maker bios online, we've worked hard to show customers how every piece of Unlocked jewelry creates deeply personal impact.Engraved InitialsStarting with our new line of jewelry, we will be even more intentional about connecting customers to the story behind each piece. Each piece will be engraved with the initials of the woman who made it, so you can be reminded of your positive impact on someone’s life each time you put it on.Behind the ScenesStarting with our Indiegogo campaign, we will also be launching a Behind the Scenes blog, exclusively for our customers. The blog will feature messages from our Makers and staff, exclusive insight into our programming, from financial literacy courses to crafting jewelry, and sneak peaks of upcoming developments at Unlocked. Through this Behind the Scenes blog, we hope to give you a more personal look at the difference you’re making in the lives of our Makers.  MissionWe employ women to craft gorgeous jewelry at our studio, providing a stable wage, supportive community, and job training experience. While employment is a crucial component to self-sufficiency, our Makers face many complex barriers, and a job alone is not enough. That's why we've been building a holistic social program that includes housing and services alongside our jewelry business, providing the support our Makers need to transition sustainably.Alongside our work with our Makers, we strive to empower our customers through the impact they can create. Sharing our Makers’ messages of hope and strength, we seek to break down the stigma of homelessness and create a more equitable world. Using our influence to be kinder to the planet, we will continue to improve our sustainability measures through our recycled materials and water and electricity usage. StoryUnlocked’s founding story is unique, if not downright miraculous. Rooted in genuine relationship, the concept emerged when Alexis, a Nashville native, began befriending people experiencing homelessness while on a medical leave of absence from Vanderbilt. Inspired, Alexis met regularly with Corbin, a friend from Vandy, to explore the idea of a company that would both create wages and address barriers. A few months later, one of Alexis’ dear friends, Ray, called to ask Alexis to meet him at the hospital. Ray had been homeless most of his life and was now in his mid-sixties; he and Alexis had met years prior while she was volunteering at a local transitional home. In a conversation that would become one of their last, Ray announced to Alexis that he had a duffle bag of money that he wanted her to have after he passed. Corbin and Alexis decided to name the company “Unlocked” to symbolize unlocking wages and opportunities for future employees and, of course, unlocking the storage unit. The pair went full-time with Unlocked upon graduation in 2018.  In the past year, Unlocked has grown considerably. With humble beginnings, we began working on park benches before later upgrading to a storage closet at a partnering nonprofit, Community Care Fellowship. Most recently, we began leasing our own workshop and office near East Nashville. In that time, we’ve worked with five women, sold thousands of pieces of jewelry, and formed partnerships with incredible nonprofits. We can’t say enough about how grateful we are for the ways that the community has wrapped its arms around us, providing encouragement, support, and guidance.   FoundersCorbin Hooker Corbin is the Co-Founder and Co-President of a Unlocked. He graduated Vanderbilt University in 2018 with a triple major in political science, economics, and history with a minor in corporate strategy. He is committed to the service of others and is focused on leading projects that move us towards a more just society and a more equitable world. In addition to building social enterprises, Corbin plans to eventually expand his capacity to create institutional change through public office.Alexis CookAlexis is a passionate individual with a drive to create a more equitable world through increased opportunity and empowerment. The Co-Founder and Co-President of Unlocked, Alexis was an Ingram Scholar at Vanderbilt University, where she graduated in 2018 with a bachelor’s in Human and Organizational Development and a minor in Economics. Prior to studying at Vanderbilt, Alexis spent a year working at five different non-profit internships in five different countries, learning more about poverty through the eyes of those experiencing it. Alexis is focused on using her leadership to elevate the voices of marginalized people, creating pathways for sustainable change. VisionBeginning with the women that we hire to fulfill your Indiegogo pre-orders, our Makers will go through a 6-month transitional program that combines employment and holistic resources in a cohesive and streamlined experience. Working with nonprofits, we provide services that help Makers build a stable foundation for their lives, with employment at Unlocked as the center of their transition. We recruit Makers through one of our nonprofit partners, Community Care Fellowship (CCF). After officially hiring a woman to work at Unlocked, we work with CCF and other nonprofit partners to help her move into a private transitional housing unit before she begins working at Unlocked, affording her both stability and privacy. Makers can live in their transitional unit until they have moved into their own permanent residence, which they identify with the help of their housing case managers, or they can choose to stay long-term in their transitional unit by transferring the lease into their own name. During their time at Unlocked, Makers contribute to rent in proportion to the wages they earn crafting jewelry, allowing them to scale their responsibility monthly as they stabilize and take on more hours at Unlocked.Unlocked also has partnerships with mental health counselors and career counselors who have agreed to meet weekly with Makers at our office at no cost to the women, allowing Makers to receive personalized care without transportation or budgeting difficulties. We also provide weekly financial training courses at the office, combining group activities with personal goals and cash prizes incentives each month.Integrating all the Unlocked’s components, from housing to employment to counseling, our social programming is divided into six “phases” with tangible goals for each, some predetermined and some personal. After completing the goals of each of the six phases, which should each last one month, a Maker will either “graduate” to the next phase or be asked to repeat the phase if she has not completed the goals she set for herself (examples of goals include things like timeliness, savings, and meetings with counselors). In this way, our programming is measurable for both Unlocked Makers and staff, and it is flexible based on the priorities of each Maker and the rate of their personal progression through the programming. For those that “repeat” a phase, they will simply stay with Unlocked programming and employment longer than the 6-month timeline. Community PartnersOur community partners are essential for the holistic support our Makers need. They are the reason we were able to begin building a comprehensive social program so quickly, and they are the key to our success in empowering our Makers beyond employment. We are incredibly grateful for their continued support of this company and mission.Community Care FellowshipThe CCF serves as a daytime shelter that provides hot meals, warm showers, laundry/hygiene facilities, counseling, and social services referrals for people experiencing homelessness. Beyond providing these core services, they have programs such as career counseling and pre-K education to help break down the cycles of poverty.Unlocked and CCF have worked together to develop a system that provides Unlocked Makers with access to career counselors, housing specialists, and a transitional housing unit for the duration of their employment at Unlocked.Urban Housing Solutions (by extension)Through a “master lease” partnership, Urban Housing Solutions leases affordable housing units to CCF, which they can then sublease or sign over permanently to Unlocked Makers or other participants in their career counseling program.Laura Edwards, Career Counselor Laura Edwards is the volunteer career counselor for Community Care Fellowship’s career counseling program. She serves as our “recruiter” by recommending best-fit candidates to apply and interview with Unlocked, and she offers continued career counseling sessions to Unlocked Makers.  Unlocked currently hires exclusively through CCF’s career counseling program to streamline the recruitment process.Dr. Rena Hall, Career CounselorThe CEO of Together We Can consultants, Dr. Hall has an impressive background in nonprofits and executive management, fortified by her 27 years of experience in the education sector. She began working with Unlocked as a career counselor to meet weekly with Makers and develop our 6-month curriculum, based on self-image, personal relationships, self-advocacy, and skills like interviewing and resume building. Her talents are of tremendous benefit to Unlocked Makers as they build confidence and professional direction.Community Financial ResourcesCommunity Financial Resources is a financial services nonprofit that focuses on empowering low-income individuals. To ensure the best fit for our Makers, CFR did a “deep dive” on Unlocked and created a personalized 8-week curriculum of financial training that includes savings, budgeting, and goal-setting. We host the sessions weekly, fostering a sense of support and community in the group-based activities and lessons.Through a partnership with US Bank, Community Financial Resources also offers Unlocked Makers direct deposit payroll cards called Focus Cards, allowing Makers to receive their wages without going to a bank or paying a cashing fee. With their Focus Cards, each Maker also has a separate personal savings account and can set up automatic savings. Unlocked Makers also use CFR's $goals$ app, which incentivizes productive habits by allowing Makers to “log” their financial actions, and the Maker with the most approved actions at the end of the month wins a cash bonus.  Funding GoalThis transition to the next iteration of Unlocked is absolutely critical to our ability to employ and empower more women. For months, we have been building up to this to this moment by developing the skills and buying the preliminary equipment needed to make very small batches of these products. Funding Use With the funds raised by this campaign, we will buy the equipment necessary to be able to produce this jewelry faster, more reliably, and at scale.  You can make a difference
Please pre-order a perk or make a contribution with the pink “back it” button
Please share this page with someone you think might love it
 We will send you frequent updates about the progress of this campaign and of your purchase, so that you'll always be the first to know about new designs, new hires, and expected the delivery date of your products.With our current machinery, we are already able to make our new jewelry in small batches, so even if we experience unexpected obstacles along the way,  you will be sure to get your purchases. THANK YOU for contributing to this campaign and for sharing our story with your friends and family. We can’t begin to express our gratitude for all those that have supported us up to this point and beyond. We truly believe this is about so much more than jewelry. It’s about what the community- you and me- can do when we come together to make a better world for people and the planet.

story:
I've always loved steak. There is absolutely nothing better than a perfectly cooked, hot off of the grill, beautiful steak, paired with the perfectly chilled beer. But let's be honest. We don't always cook steaks perfectly, and with steaks costing upwards of $40-$50 apiece at a good restaurant, it just costs too much to go out, especially if you have a family.

So, I started looking for ways to cook the perfect steak, to cook the perfect steak every time. I found a method called Sous Vide. Using precise temperature control, the finest restaurants cook the steak, regardless of size, to a perfect medium rare (or any other doneness you desire), and then brown up the outside and bring it to your table.

The only problem. Souse Vide machines cost hundreds to thousands of dollars. And, they only do one thing.

I knew I could do better, so I did my research. The Alton is the result. Not only does it make cooking the perfect steak easy, it also makes chilling a beer to the perfect temperature effortless.

The Alton gives me the ability to turn a $10 slow cooker into a Sous Vide machine worth hundreds. I can cook 1 steak or 4. What's more, I've used a 5 gallon slow cooker to cook 2lb New York Strips, 10-12 of them. That's right, 24lbs of steak all cooking at once. With the Alton, they are all done at the same time, and are perfectly cooked edge to edge, not even a hint of overdoneness. The Alton controls the temperature of any cooking to within a tenth of a degree F. I toss the steaks on the grill for 30-60 seconds to brown the outside and serve immediately, without the need to rest the meat. Quite simply they are better than any steak I've ever had at any restaurant.

But the Alton is all about multi-tasking. Named for our favorite chef, the Alton is an all in one temperature controller. I've used it to help perfectly melt chocolate (those of you who have done it know how hard it can be). It also works great for melting cheese.

What's more, you can use the Alton not only to heat, but to cool. That's right, just plug in any kitchen device that heats or cools and the Alton will precisely control the temperatures. Let's talk beer.

The Alton is perfect solution for precisely controlling that minifridge you've been using as kegerator. The Alton is one of the most important multi-tasking tools in my kitchen, and I'm sure it will be in yours. The money I've saved in steaks alone vs eating out has been unbelievable. The 24 lbs of NY Strips I mentioned earlier I paid $75 dollars for. The equivalent at a fine steakhouse would have been well over $500, and over $800 at some.

However, if we really want to talk multi-tasking, the Alton can also be used for Fondue, for water baths, for foot warmers (gross but true), for melting plastics, for mold-making, for electric smokers, and on and on. The applications are limitless.

Cooking should not be hard. The Alton makes it easy, and more affordable. What's more, unlike those expensive dedicated machines, it is not limited to just one function.

The Alton is the Ultimate Kitchen Multitasker.

story:
About Pipe Lighter:

We will be conducting two phases in order to make this idea into a reality. In the lower two segments I will explain to you our plan to make this happen!

The funds we're raising with this campaign will be used for scaling up our prototype unit to a fully functional unit and then proceeding on to production.

Phase I:

 We have already completed Phase I working on the concept and overall design. We are using the latest technology, 3D printing to assist us in this phase. We are working with a product develop firm located here in Fort Lauderdale Florida. The firm has already us with; concept iterations created by sketch form and vector form. This process was extensive as we wanted to ensure all variables were explored. During the second part of Phase I we will be working with the same firm to kick off 3D CAD work. During this stage of development we will be able to see our idea come to life. The firm is also assisting us with technical drawings (blueprints) to produce our product. This portion of development is expected to take approx. 12 weeks.

Phase II:

 Phase II will consist of production—paying for tooling, materials, and assembly in large quantities. While there are always hiccups in the process of taking a product from prototype to manufacturing in large quantities. We are currently working with our product development firm to obtain a manufacturer. They have been working with multiple reputable manufacturers for years now. This phase is expected to approx. 6 months

 

 

About Me:

My name is Jeramy Roberts I am 27 years old and have spent the majority of my life in Florida. From an early age I have always had an imagination, one that always seems to focus in on one key element. That key element is making things simpler. Taking a task that once seemed to be a nuisance and creating a solution. Pipe Lighter is one of many concepts and ideas that I have captured throughout the years. This particular idea revolves around making a flame accessible where ever and whenever you need it. I am currently working with a team of very experienced individuals who are helping me bring this idea to life!

story:
한국어

 

 

             

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

MISSION

WELT is a healthcare tech company that aims to make people healthier. With our wealth of expertise in the healthcare tech industry, we strive to create products that are at the forefront of innovation while also matching our previously held quality standards.

 

TEAM

A spin-off company of Samsung Electronics, WELT’s team sought to bring about a fundamental change to the wearables market born from a simple idea, health data from the waist.

 

WELT IN THE NEWS

 

Risks and challenges

With WELT we have taken every step we can to ensure that we can deliver on everything that we have shown on our campaign page. Not only have we developed the sensors but we have also chosen the belt designs. Yet, with any new technology or fashion, unseen circumstances can arise during the mass production stage. We will do our absolute best to ensure that WELT not only performs but also looks as we have presented it.

story:
Watches made during the golden age of horology back in the 1960s emphasized a lot more on craftsmanship and finishing details; compared to modern day timepieces. Therefore, the vintage watch price of a well recognized brand, i.e. Rolex, Heuer, Patek Philippe, Omega, Brietling, etc, can far exceed modern new models. Do you know why?

Vintage watches were made in small batches that required immense amount of highly skilled labor and craftsmanship. With a focus by mass market brands on volume and margins, the design and quality aspects are no longer top priorities for most watches. It is inevitable that many small but significant details have been neglected.

Working in collaboration with appointed factories that are supplying top Swiss watch labels, we are challenging them to maintain their quality standards when creating the Urban. It is time to give the ‘big boys’ a shake up.

Besides the 5 fixed designs, the 'Build Your Own' Urban Chronograph will be offered via Undone's watch customizer, where users can interact and build their own with choices of case colors, hands, dials and straps. Best of all, you can further personalize it by adding your name, initials and logo too! Visit our customizer and experience building yours now! 

Customize yours now!

Multi-layered Watch Case / Stepped Bezel / Vintage Domed K1 Crystal

The Undone Signature 'U' Crown

The Undone Urban Chronograph comes in a highly detailed bespoke watch case that retains all signature vintage watch features, such as the super domed watch crystal, convex dial, stepped bezel, stepped round chronograph pushers, big crown and straight lugs. While maintaining the retro look, the new Urban Chronograph has certainly incorporated our modern touch with subtle improvements, with the below FOUR key upgrades:

  • Modern upgrade to domed K1 hardened mineral glass from domed acrylic for maximum durability and scratch resistance 
  • All Urban leather straps feature a vintage single thread finish, with a modern twist of using quick release spring bars for a tool-less strap changing experience
  • Powered by a VK61 hybrid movement by Seiko Instrument Inc., featuring a mechanicalflyback sweeping chronograph and a reliable quartz timing module, reducing the cost of ownership to almost ZERO, compared to high servicing costs for traditional vintage timepieces.
  • Self-innovated dial and caseback printing technology, offering best-in-class personalization capabilities.   

You can experience by building your own Undone Urban Chronograph in our watch customizer on www.undone.watch! Choose from case coatings, dials, casebacks, hands, straps and your own personalization for both front and back, be it a name, initials, logo and many more! Apart from the Vintage line, you can also choose from our Classic and Modern dial collections too!

*Prototype Urban only to demonstrate front and back personalisation possibilities. 

The 'Killy'

The 'Speedy'

The 'Navi'

 The 'Newman'

The 'Auta'

  • Case Size: 40mm diameter excluding crown, 13mm thick
  • Case Material: 316L stainless steel 
  • Case Finish: Brushed and Polished 
  • Caseback: see-through exhibition glass or solid engraved
  • Coating: black pvd, silver, yellow gold, rose gold
  • Bezel: stepped 
  • Crystal: domed K1 hardened with enhanced scratch resistance 
  • Water Resistance: 30 Meters / 3ATM
  • Movement: Seiko SII VK61 Hybrid, quartz timing module, mechanical flyback chronograph 
  • Functions: Small seconds hand, 60 minutes timer, mechnical flyback reset, telemeter, tachymeter
  • Straps: Genuine leather strap with vintage finishing    
  • lug width: 20mm
  • lug to lug: 47mm

 

 

FAQ

 

Do you have an official website? 

Website: www.undone.watch 

Customizer: https://www.undone.watch/series/customizer

What does 'Design Your Own Urban' entitles to? Can I choose the fixed design dials?

You can build an Urban with any parts combination that is offered via the customizer (http://bit.ly/2kpPLHs), INCLUDING THE KILLY, SPEEDY, NAVI, AUTA AND NEWMAN from the VINTAGE COLLECTION, plus other dials from the MODERN and CLASSIC range. For example, if you want the Killy, you simply need to choose a silver case, Killy dial, blue classic hands and vintage grey  leather strap in the customizer.

 

Why 'Build Your Own'?

1. You can choose from THREE dial collections: Vintage (fixed design offerings), Classic and Modern. Fixed design only included part of the Vintage dial collection. 

2. You can include personalization on both the dial and caseback

3. Most importantly, you can choose your own watch straps too!

 

Can I choose another watch strap instead of the default for my Urban Chronograph (Fixed Design)? 

NO, all fixed design comes as it is and you can only indicate your choice of either a SOLID or GLASS caseback with NO PERSONALIZATION. If you want to change the strap or add personalization to your product, you need to get the 'Build Your Own' perks. 

 

Can I purchase extra watch straps for my Undone Urban?

Yes, you can purchase your extra straps on our official website at a special discount with a coupon code which every backer entitles. Each strap will be US$27 after applying the discount code. We will send out the coupon to all backers after campaign ends. 

 

How do I build my watch after campaign ends? (For 'Build Your Own Backers')

1. You will receive an email confirmation after the campaign ends, together with a UNIQUE COUPON CODE.

2. You will receive a link to build your Urban Chronograph after it is being upgraded within a week after project completion.

3. By checking out with your UNIQUE COUPON CODE, we will be able to obtain your personal details and shipping address

 

Can I change my mind and upgrade later to 'Build Your Own' from 'Fixed Designs'?

Fixed designs comes with either an exhibition or solid caseback of your choice. Customization and personalization on fixed designs will not be offered. They are priced lower because they are fixed with much less operational cost incurred. However, if any backers decided to change their mind after the campaign to upgrade to the 'Build Your Own', we will definitely grant that!

 

Do you offer warranty for the Undone Urban?

We offer 12 months manufacturer's warranty from date of purchase repair or replace the watch movement if it has a manufacturing defect. This warranty does not cover damage resulting from accidents or misuse.

 

Where are your watches made?

All Undone timepieces are made in-house within our own facilities in our Hong Kong workshop. You can find out more about our facilities and expertise on www.classicwatchrepair.com

 

Is the Urban Chronograph water resistant?

Yes, it is water resistant to 30 meters or 3ATM.

 

What is Urban's case diameter? Lug Width (Strap size), and Lug to Lug length?

Case Diameter is 40mm excluding crown. Lug width is 20mm, and Lug tip to lug tip length is 47mm

 

Are mechanical watches better than quartz watches?

The better one gives you more than 24 hours a day :)

 

Is Undone on Social Media?

BIG TIME YES! Instagram is our main channel!

#UndoneWatches #UndoneUrban #UndoneAqua

Instagram (@UndoneWatches) : www.instagram.com/UndoneWatches

Facebook: (@UndoneWatches) : www.facebook.com/UndoneWatches

It is time to give the ‘big boys’ a shake up.Besides the 5 fixed designs, the 'Build Your Own' Urban Chronograph will be offered via Undone's watch customizer, where users can interact and build their own with choices of case colors, hands, dials and straps. Best of all, you can further personalize it by adding your name, initials and logo too! Visit our customizer and experience building yours now! Customize yours now!Multi-layered Watch Case / Stepped Bezel / Vintage Domed K1 CrystalThe Undone Signature 'U' CrownThe Undone Urban Chronograph comes in a highly detailed bespoke watch case that retains all signature vintage watch features, such as the super domed watch crystal, convex dial, stepped bezel, stepped round chronograph pushers, big crown and straight lugs. While maintaining the retro look, the new Urban Chronograph has certainly incorporated our modern touch with subtle improvements, with the below FOUR key upgrades:
Modern upgrade to domed K1 hardened mineral glass from domed acrylic for maximum durability and scratch resistance 
All Urban leather straps feature a vintage single thread finish, with a modern twist of using quick release spring bars for a tool-less strap changing experience
Powered by a VK61 hybrid movement by Seiko Instrument Inc., featuring a mechanicalflyback sweeping chronograph and a reliable quartz timing module, reducing the cost of ownership to almost ZERO, compared to high servicing costs for traditional vintage timepieces.
Self-innovated dial and caseback printing technology, offering best-in-class personalization capabilities.   
You can experience by building your own Undone Urban Chronograph in our watch customizer on www.undone.watch! Choose from case coatings, dials, casebacks, hands, straps and your own personalization for both front and back, be it a name, initials, logo and many more! Apart from the Vintage line, you can also choose from our Classic and Modern dial collections too!*Prototype Urban only to demonstrate front and back personalisation possibilities. The 'Killy'The 'Speedy'The 'Navi' The 'Newman'The 'Auta'
Case Size: 40mm diameter excluding crown, 13mm thick
Case Material: 316L stainless steel 
Case Finish: Brushed and Polished 
Caseback: see-through exhibition glass or solid engraved
Coating: black pvd, silver, yellow gold, rose gold
Bezel: stepped 
Crystal: domed K1 hardened with enhanced scratch resistance 
Water Resistance: 30 Meters / 3ATM
Movement: Seiko SII VK61 Hybrid, quartz timing module, mechanical flyback chronograph 
Functions: Small seconds hand, 60 minutes timer, mechnical flyback reset, telemeter, tachymeter
Straps: Genuine leather strap with vintage finishing    
lug width: 20mm
lug to lug: 47mm
  FAQ Do you have an official website? Website: www.undone.watch Customizer: https://www.undone.watch/series/customizerWhat does 'Design Your Own Urban' entitles to? Can I choose the fixed design dials?You can build an Urban with any parts combination that is offered via the customizer (http://bit.ly/2kpPLHs), INCLUDING THE KILLY, SPEEDY, NAVI, AUTA AND NEWMAN from the VINTAGE COLLECTION, plus other dials from the MODERN and CLASSIC range. For example, if you want the Killy, you simply need to choose a silver case, Killy dial, blue classic hands and vintage grey  leather strap in the customizer. Why 'Build Your Own'?1. You can choose from THREE dial collections: Vintage (fixed design offerings), Classic and Modern. Fixed design only included part of the Vintage dial collection. 2. You can include personalization on both the dial and caseback3. Most importantly, you can choose your own watch straps too! Can I choose another watch strap instead of the default for my Urban Chronograph (Fixed Design)? NO, all fixed design comes as it is and you can only indicate your choice of either a SOLID or GLASS caseback with NO PERSONALIZATION. If you want to change the strap or add personalization to your product, you need to get the 'Build Your Own' perks.  Can I purchase extra watch straps for my Undone Urban?Yes, you can purchase your extra straps on our official website at a special discount with a coupon code which every backer entitles. Each strap will be US$27 after applying the discount code. We will send out the coupon to all backers after campaign ends.  How do I build my watch after campaign ends? (For 'Build Your Own Backers')1. You will receive an email confirmation after the campaign ends, together with a UNIQUE COUPON CODE.2. You will receive a link to build your Urban Chronograph after it is being upgraded within a week after project completion.3. By checking out with your UNIQUE COUPON CODE, we will be able to obtain your personal details and shipping address Can I change my mind and upgrade later to 'Build Your Own' from 'Fixed Designs'?Fixed designs comes with either an exhibition or solid caseback of your choice. Customization and personalization on fixed designs will not be offered. They are priced lower because they are fixed with much less operational cost incurred. However, if any backers decided to change their mind after the campaign to upgrade to the 'Build Your Own', we will definitely grant that! Do you offer warranty for the Undone Urban?We offer 12 months manufacturer's warranty from date of purchase repair or replace the watch movement if it has a manufacturing defect. This warranty does not cover damage resulting from accidents or misuse. Where are your watches made?All Undone timepieces are made in-house within our own facilities in our Hong Kong workshop. You can find out more about our facilities and expertise on www.classicwatchrepair.com Is the Urban Chronograph water resistant?Yes, it is water resistant to 30 meters or 3ATM. What is Urban's case diameter? Lug Width (Strap size), and Lug to Lug length?Case Diameter is 40mm excluding crown. Lug width is 20mm, and Lug tip to lug tip length is 47mm Are mechanical watches better than quartz watches?The better one gives you more than 24 hours a day :) Is Undone on Social Media?BIG TIME YES! Instagram is our main channel!#UndoneWatches #UndoneUrban #UndoneAquaInstagram (@UndoneWatches) : www.instagram.com/UndoneWatchesFacebook: (@UndoneWatches) : www.facebook.com/UndoneWatches

story:
Perfect Fit, Performance Fabric.

We always make trade-offs when we buy shirts. Maybe we love the fabric, but hate the fit. Or we love the fit, but don't like the collar or cuff. 

Well, at Woodies we don't like compromises. 

We promise a perfect fit, and our new performance fabric will have you looking sharp, moving easily and staying cool and fresh. 

*Now available in Women's sizing as well!

Meet The Ultimate Performance shirt. 

  

  • Perfect Fit: We use advanced sizing algorithms to calculate all your measurements in seconds, no tape measure required. 
  • Iron Free: The ultimate performance shirt is iron free and looks pressed out of your suitcase or the dryer. 
  • 2 Way Stretch: No more constraint. Enjoy a fuller range of motion and comfort. 
  • Moisture Wicking: Our fabric pulls sweat away from your body and keeps you cool. 
  • Antibacterial: Smell good, for longer. Launder less, save money and the environment!  

 

 

We've partnered with a world class mill for this fabric and are using patented technology and finishes to ensure amazing performance and durability without compromising a soft hand and feel. 

Our performance fabric is a 75% cotton, 22% polyester and 3% lycra blend. 

We're pleased to introduce our initial run of fabrics.

 

 

Design Customizations

You'll be able to choose whichever collar and cuff you'd like, with or without a pocket. 

Sizing

In addition to choosing your fabric and design, you will be able to personalize your sizes and fit. 

We use advanced sizing algorithms to calculate measurements based off as little as your height, weight and average shirt size. 

Women's Sizing 

We're pleased to offer women's sizing for the ultimate performance shirt. 

We guarantee a perfect fit. If there are any adjustments that need to be made, we’ll take care of them.

Read more about our guarantee here. 

  

 

 

  The more shirts you buy, the more you save.   

 

 

              

 

  

 

 

Our Mill.

We've partnered with a mill synonymous with quality. Their time tested processes produce outstanding fabric. 

We're working with several patented textile technologies to ensure that your shirts look good and feel soft. 

Our Tailors.

Unless you geek out to clothes (like we do), you might not know what CAD is. CAD allows tailors to create patterns on their computer, and patterns are printed by machine. This allows for super accurate measurements and consistent sizing, order after order. 

Imagine perfect-fitting shirts with every order, year after year. Sounds great, right? Welcome to Woodies!

 

We started Woodies with a simple vision: To give guys perfect fitting shirts at a price within reach. With that vision we launched our first campaign.

We've bootstrapped since the beginning and have grown sustainably, holding fast to outstanding quality and amazing customer service (check the reviews). 

 

Up to this point, most of our fabrics have been "ready made," meaning we pick from a selection of pre-made fabrics.

Currently, we have nothing like this Performance fabric!

We've developed this new Performance Fabric from start to finish. It is being made exclusively for us, and because of this we need to manufacture thousands of meters (vs. 25-100m). 

We need your help to kickstart the production of this performance fabric!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The majority of work for this project has already been done. Your support is the big piece missing from our puzzle!

We've developed and sourced our sample fabric and have our mill in place. We have an incredible manufacturer (that we've worked with before), and we've done all of the shirt patterning. 

The mill with whom we've partnered has high minimums. We need your support to buy our initial run of fabric and to get this new product into your hands!

March  Kickstarter launch 

April  Kickstarter complete – production begins! 

May  Fabric is milled - est. turnaround 45 days

June  Orders are taken. Shirt production starts 

August  Shirts begin to be mailed out

story:
Hi there!

I am Agata and together with my friend Ann we are moulding flowers out of clay. Why we started to do this? The answer is simple - we love the nature and want to wear something cute but extraordinary.

Because when you have the flowers circlet on your head you make perfect and natural image. This is what every women wants to be - individual, attractive, yet natural.

For the successful campaing we need 1500 USD to raise. This costs will go to our internet project - development of the site, and materials.

We aim to gather some handmaders into one site and create a little eco-world of interesting things.  This will make care of nature popular.

We started to think about this project as long as we’ve watched how the humanity treats the nature; we’ve forgotten where we live.

Haydy is created not only for fashion. It is the sign of nature and when you wear it you show that you think and care about the environment. 

We now are proposing to you different collections. Just let us know what you like.  The prices for each accessory from our collections are equal. Fro example, the collection  "POPPY SEED".

While choosing you just need to text from what collection you would like to buy the beautiful accessory.

Every detail is totally handmade - it takes a lot of time and inspiration to gather small clay balls into only one berry, wheat or flower.

Haydy is lightweight and its’ design is very comfortable for wearing. The clay we are using is non-toxic and made of natural materials.

Every flower circlet is individually designed. Nature is extremely versatile and it allows us to combine different plants, berries and plants.

With your help we will create a flash mob for the charming environment.

If you like Haydy but still don't want to contribute, please share with your friends,  we would be really happy for the help!

story:
Our annual charity fashion show, known as Relief on the Runway™, showcases our latest collections while raising funds to help aid refugees on an international level. We aim to inspire like minded individuals to donate to a wonderful cause while also enjoying themselves at our event, and so far we have had the support of Islamic Relief USA, as well as local and international designers. Nahda Designs hosted the first annual charity event that took place in Fullerton, CA on December 3, 2011 and also helped IRUSA in hosting their first ever charity fashion show that took place in New York, NY on April 28th, 2012 titled, “Relief on the Runway: Attire to Inspire.”

“Relief on the Runway: Attire to Inspire” and Nahda Designs were mentioned in several online blogs & magazines, from Aquila Style to Muslim Matters. The show was also featured in an article by www.cnbc.com.

To register or to purchase your tickets to our 2nd annual Relief on the Runway™ charity fashion show, please click here.

We are always in need of volunteers, if you are interested do send us an email:info@nahdadesigns.com

story:
• For FDM users : It'll enable you to create more complicated things in short time.
  • For SLA/DLP users : It'll help you reduce costs for printing mid-high quality large objects.
  • For material developers : It might be the best solution for your R&D.
  • For 3D printing instructors : Teach using a resin 3D printer without the expensive cost issues.

IMPORTANT NOTICE to Potential Contributors

Due to the increase of BOM, we'll not be able to provide MORPHEUS delta (a Kickstarter edition) for potential contributors at this price any more. Please note that...

We've featured on

 

3DPrint.com,  3Ders.org, Fabbaloo, 3DPI, and more. Please check the Updates for more article from various countries.

We want to talk about Personal 3D Printer.

According to the market research, 9 of 10 users are using an FDM (fused deposition modeling) / FFF (fused filament fabrication) type 3D printer. TEAM OWL WORKS has also been using some twenty different FDM 3D printers for our work since 2013. FDM has many benefits as a personal 3D printer such as...

  • well-established eco-system
  • good community with many users
  • low-priced machines

Most of all, it is CHEAP (both the machine & its operation costs) !

THANKS, We can afford it !

However, it has some limitations on making things of high quality (or fine resolution) due to its physical & mechanical nature. For example, it's VERY difficult (or impossible) to print a famous Eiffel Tower miniature around 110-mm-height as designed. If you're googling, you will find many results showing how difficult it is. Even some great FDM 3D printers' results are not satisfactory at all. Another drawback is..speed. Printing speed of FDM machines are too slow. When you're trying to make a big thing or many of the same things, you will be frustrated with its printing speed.  

   

We don't want to blame FDM 3D printer but do want to talk about ANOTHER option for personal 3D printer, because the creative work should not be blocked by the limitation of FDM 3D printers.

Need something different !  

Let's consider a resin 3D printer. We have SLA (Stereo Lithography Apparatus) and DLP (Digital Light Processing) technologies. They show a fine quality (far beyond FDM), because they employ light to form things from liquid photopolymer (resin). However they also have drawbacks; small build-volume and not-so-fast. Even worse, they are too expensive for common users to afford it. We know a couple of brands can provide relatively low-priced machine, but the operation cost (including resin, VAT and other consumables) is still expensive and the printing performance is not as good as we expect from such high-priced machine3.

We need something different from SLA & DLP as well as FDM; it should be far better than FDM in printing performance, and better than SLA and DLP in some aspects like price, build-volume and so on.  

LIPS & MORPHEUS.  

In fact, we have a solution. Look back in 2015, we introduced a new kind of resin 3D printing technology, called LIPS (Light Induced Planar Solidification). If you look at a schematic diagram how it works, you may think it's very similar to DLP (or SLA) technology. However it is different from other resin 3D printing technologies.

   

The most striking feature of LIPS technology is 'a planar light source & digital photo mask' (a LIPS engine, we called) which makes a digitally sliced image from the data into a physical layer of a printed object. It can expose the digital image to the photopolymer (resin) without any distortion caused by light intensity over the whole plane. Also, it is not expensive !

With this technology, we successfully provided a large build-volume resin 3D printer to the world at an affordable price...the MORPHEUS. If you did not hear about us, please check our former Kickstarter campaign.  

   

The MORPHEUS is okay for business users but still expensive for individuals. That's the reason why we started a new project, called E7.

Project E7 toward a New MORPHEUS.  

When we started the Project E7 early this year, the goal of the Project was simple & clear, 'make another MORPHEUS at FDM price', and we have spent almost 5,000 hours for R&D to realize our concept. Based on LIPS technology, we adopted various open-source technologies & knowledge like Arduino, Raspberry Pi and so on, to reduce the cost and development period. So.. we could successfully demonstrated its functional prototypes in just a few short months.

    

  • Check the time-lapse of printing '8 rooks at once' by Mark 3 version.

 

We demonstrated the MK2 version (2nd functional prototype) in public last September.  

We designed & named the final product very thoughtfully, after we confirmed all the function of E7 product. We really wanted to inspire a whole new world of 3D printing through our new product.   

#

And...finally...

we're proudly introducing...

MORPHEUS delta, a revolutionary personal resin 3D printer.

# Please check the video for the design and printed things that you'll get.

 

It has three outstanding features;  

  • Excellent Performance (over price).
  • Affordable Price & Low Operation Cost (for individuals).
  • Unique Philosophy (for creative works).

# We've developed it far better than others in the market.

 

# We know the total cost of operation is the most important thing for personal-use.  

 

# We designed it based on the philosophy.   

 

As a result, MORPHEUS delta will be the first product that is creating a new category; Low Cost, High Quality.  

Please take a look at the product position of the MORPHEUS delta. It's in between FDM and SLA/DLP machines, but some key aspects are beyond the other 3D printing technologies in the market.  

   

What you can do with the MORPHEUS delta.  

 # Miniature Sculptures.  

    

# Ornaments & Parts.

    

# Accessories.

# Things for your creative works. : A tiny tree for a diorama  

# And more.  

  • For FDM users : It'll enable you to create more complicated things in short time.
  • For SLA/DLP users : It'll help you reduce costs for printing mid-high quality large objects.
  • For material developers : It might be the best solution for your R&D.
  • For 3D printing instructors : Teach using a resin 3D printer without the expensive cost issues.

MORPHEUS delta vs. Others.  

We summarized key aspects for comparison purpose, and we have visualized a build-volume for each 3D printer as well.

 

   

 

    

Please check the build-area (or platform size) of the MORPHEUS delta, compared with that of other DLP 3D printers in the market now.

   

Printing Speed & Productivity.  

When we talk about printing speeds, there are two approaches to asses.

  • First is the direct measurement of the growing rate when it prints an  object (or a thing) :in other workds, the printing speed.
  • The other is to calculate (or measure) the total time to get certain number of objects made : that is, productivity (or throughput).

We took both approaches.

We've also calculated how long it would take to make one hundred 1-inch cubes using different 3D printers.  

  • Per FDM, we set the layer thickness, infill & nozzle speed as 0.2 mm, 25% and 80 mm/sec, respectively.
  • Per DLP, we set the printing speed at 6.2 sec/ 100 um (average value; we've collected the data from the market and reflects our experimental data from Kudo 3D's Titan & DIY DLP)
  • We ignored the processing time per batch such as detaching the printed objects & reloading, any post processing and so on.

The results show that the throughput of the MORPHEUS delta is higher than both FDM (6X) & DLP (4X).

   

General Information.  

 

# Printing Software. (Complementary)

  • TRINITY is a dedicated printing software (hosting, controlling, supporting & slicing) for MORPHEUS 3D printers including the MK4+ and the delta. It supports Mac & Windows installed PC
  • We will provide it to all MORPHEUS users.

# Stand-alone Printing through nanoDLP

  • nanoDLP is a Raspberry Pi based host & control software.
  • It supports various OS including Mac, Linux, Windows and more.
  • We'll provide nanoDLP installed Raspberry Pi 3 with all the setting for the MORPHEUS delta to the backers (Optional : additional charge may apply) .
  • For more information, please click the picture below to visit www.nanoDLP.com
  •   

   

# Resin Materials (UV curable photopolymers).

  • We're providing acrylic resin for General Purpose (GP). 4 colors are available now.
  • We are testing a clear-type, castable and elastic resin but it'll take a couple of months from now on.
  • We suggest other makers' resin after testing; we're open for collaboration because we want to provide as many options for MORPHEUS users as we can.

   

   

What we're preparing for our backers. 

# We'd like to give you (backers) benefits as many as we can, because you're brave supporters on the revolutionary product, and this is one of them. We visualize the price-benefit for backers.

 

For Indiegogo contributors,

# Basic Pack  

 

# Ultimate starter kit

 

# post treatment kit (common for all contributors with MORPHEUS delta)

   

# Timeline.

  • We're attending SoCal Maker Convention @ Los Angeles FAIRPLEX on 5th, November. Please come and see the Mark3 version of MORPHEUS delta.

 

   

We need your support !  

# We started our journey with Kickstarter last year.

  • We're a group of makers who had innovative ideas.
  • Our innovative technology created the largest build-volume desktop resin 3D printer, the MORPHEUS, thanks to our innovative & brave backers.
  • Currently, we've shipped over 70 MORPHEUS units to 14 countries and have been improving it for mass production.
  •  

# We do not make 3D printers just to earn money, but need a fund to help us make a revolutionary 3D printer for individuals. That's why we're on Kickstarter & Indiegogo.

# The MORPHEUS delta is our 2nd product, but it's the first one for personal 3D printing.  

  • We're doing a couple of projects now as described below.
  • We have a couple of patents on our technology & product.

When you're trying to make a big thing or many of the same things, you will be frustrated with its printing speed.   3 Eiffel Towers printed by 3 different FDM 3D printers. Courtesy of Computer World    We don't want to blame FDM 3D printer but do want to talk about ANOTHER option for personal 3D printer, because the creative work should not be blocked by the limitation of FDM 3D printers.Need something different !  Let's consider a resin 3D printer. We have SLA (Stereo Lithography Apparatus) and DLP (Digital Light Processing) technologies. They show a fine quality (far beyond FDM), because they employ light to form things from liquid photopolymer (resin). However they also have drawbacks; small build-volume and not-so-fast. Even worse, they are too expensive for common users to afford it. We know a couple of brands can provide relatively low-priced machine, but the operation cost (including resin, VAT and other consumables) is still expensive and the printing performance is not as good as we expect from such high-priced machine3.We need something different from SLA & DLP as well as FDM; it should be far better than FDM in printing performance, and better than SLA and DLP in some aspects like price, build-volume and so on.  LIPS & MORPHEUS.  In fact, we have a solution. Look back in 2015, we introduced a new kind of resin 3D printing technology, called LIPS (Light Induced Planar Solidification). If you look at a schematic diagram how it works, you may think it's very similar to DLP (or SLA) technology. However it is different from other resin 3D printing technologies. Introduction to LIPS technology.    The most striking feature of LIPS technology is 'a planar light source & digital photo mask' (a LIPS engine, we called) which makes a digitally sliced image from the data into a physical layer of a printed object. It can expose the digital image to the photopolymer (resin) without any distortion caused by light intensity over the whole plane. Also, it is not expensive !3D Printing Technology : FDM, SLA, DLP and LIPSWith this technology, we successfully provided a large build-volume resin 3D printer to the world at an affordable price...the MORPHEUS. If you did not hear about us, please check our former Kickstarter campaign.   MORPHEUS 3D printer, Kickstarter campaign 2015.    The MORPHEUS is okay for business users but still expensive for individuals. That's the reason why we started a new project, called E7.Project E7 toward a New MORPHEUS.  When we started the Project E7 early this year, the goal of the Project was simple & clear, 'make another MORPHEUS at FDM price', and we have spent almost 5,000 hours for R&D to realize our concept. Based on LIPS technology, we adopted various open-source technologies & knowledge like Arduino, Raspberry Pi and so on, to reduce the cost and development period. So.. we could successfully demonstrated its functional prototypes in just a few short months.Project E7, evolution of prototypes.    Check the time-lapse of printing '8 rooks at once' by Mark 3 version. We demonstrated the MK2 version (2nd functional prototype) in public last September.  Public demonstration @ 3DPIA 2016 in Daejeon, South KoreaWe designed & named the final product very thoughtfully, after we confirmed all the function of E7 product. We really wanted to inspire a whole new world of 3D printing through our new product.   #
And...finally... 
we're proudly introducing...
MORPHEUS delta, a revolutionary personal resin 3D printer.
# Please check the video for the design and printed things that you'll get. It has three outstanding features;  
Excellent Performance (over price).
Affordable Price & Low Operation Cost (for individuals).
Unique Philosophy (for creative works).
# We've developed it far better than others in the market. # We know the total cost of operation is the most important thing for personal-use.   # We designed it based on the philosophy.     As a result, MORPHEUS delta will be the first product that is creating a new category; Low Cost, High Quality.  MORPHEUS delta creates a new category; Low Cost. High Quality.Please take a look at the product position of the MORPHEUS delta. It's in between FDM and SLA/DLP machines, but some key aspects are beyond the other 3D printing technologies in the market.     What you can do with the MORPHEUS delta.   # Miniature Sculptures.      # Ornaments & Parts.    # Accessories.# Things for your creative works. : A tiny tree for a diorama  # And more.  

For FDM users : It'll enable you to create more complicated things in short time.

For SLA/DLP users : It'll help you reduce costs for printing mid-high quality large objects.

For material developers : It might be the best solution for your R&D.

For 3D printing instructors : Teach using a resin 3D printer without the expensive cost issues.

MORPHEUS delta vs. Others.  We summarized key aspects for comparison purpose, and we have visualized a build-volume for each 3D printer as well.         Please check the build-area (or platform size) of the MORPHEUS delta, compared with that of other DLP 3D printers in the market now.   Printing Speed & Productivity.  When we talk about printing speeds, there are two approaches to asses.
First is the direct measurement of the growing rate when it prints an  object (or a thing) :in other workds, the printing speed.
The other is to calculate (or measure) the total time to get certain number of objects made : that is, productivity (or throughput).
We took both approaches.We've also calculated how long it would take to make one hundred 1-inch cubes using different 3D printers.  
Per FDM, we set the layer thickness, infill & nozzle speed as 0.2 mm, 25% and 80 mm/sec, respectively.
Per DLP, we set the printing speed at 6.2 sec/ 100 um (average value; we've collected the data from the market and reflects our experimental data from Kudo 3D's Titan & DIY DLP)
We ignored the processing time per batch such as detaching the printed objects & reloading, any post processing and so on.
The results show that the throughput of the MORPHEUS delta is higher than both FDM (6X) & DLP (4X).   General Information.   # Printing Software. (Complementary)

TRINITY is a dedicated printing software (hosting, controlling, supporting & slicing) for MORPHEUS 3D printers including the MK4+ and the delta. It supports Mac & Windows installed PC

We will provide it to all MORPHEUS users.
# Stand-alone Printing through nanoDLP

nanoDLP is a Raspberry Pi based host & control software.
It supports various OS including Mac, Linux, Windows and more.
We'll provide nanoDLP installed Raspberry Pi 3 with all the setting for the MORPHEUS delta to the backers (Optional : additional charge may apply) .
For more information, please click the picture below to visit www.nanoDLP.com

  
    # Resin Materials (UV curable photopolymers).
We're providing acrylic resin for General Purpose (GP). 4 colors are available now.
We are testing a clear-type, castable and elastic resin but it'll take a couple of months from now on.
We suggest other makers' resin after testing; we're open for collaboration because we want to provide as many options for MORPHEUS users as we can.
      What we're preparing for our backers. # We'd like to give you (backers) benefits as many as we can, because you're brave supporters on the revolutionary product, and this is one of them. We visualize the price-benefit for backers. For Indiegogo contributors,# Basic Pack   # Ultimate starter kit # post treatment kit (common for all contributors with MORPHEUS delta)   # Timeline.We're attending SoCal Maker Convention @ Los Angeles FAIRPLEX on 5th, November. Please come and see the Mark3 version of MORPHEUS delta.    We need your support !  # We started our journey with Kickstarter last year.
We're a group of makers who had innovative ideas.
Our innovative technology created the largest build-volume desktop resin 3D printer, the MORPHEUS, thanks to our innovative & brave backers.
Currently, we've shipped over 70 MORPHEUS units to 14 countries and have been improving it for mass production.
Installation Tour for the MORPHEUS backers. # We do not make 3D printers just to earn money, but need a fund to help us make a revolutionary 3D printer for individuals. That's why we're on Kickstarter & Indiegogo.# The MORPHEUS delta is our 2nd product, but it's the first one for personal 3D printing.  
We're doing a couple of projects now as described below.
We have a couple of patents on our technology & product.

story:
The Jacket you'll need EVERY TIME you travel or go camping!

 

Keep your valuables close and never lose anything again

Forget about stressful airport security controls. Simply take off your jacket and go through the scanner!

 

The jacket that can replace your suitcase

Versatyl combines form with function. It has 14 zips and weighs just 590 grams. The pockets will store everything from pens to iPads. The jacket has a "carry all" pocket at the back - which means the jacket itself folds into that pocket and can be carried around like a sling pouch. The same pocket doubles as a massive storage space for those extra large items.

The jacket is made of premium durable materials that keep you warm, but prevent you from sweating.

The Inside of the VERSATYL has another 11 features to store your valuables and make sure your earphone wires never get tangled again.

The outside of the jacket has a reflector strip for safety, and a carry all pocket with a satchel inside. Getting too warm? No problem! Just take the satchel out and use it to carry the jacket.

Stylish and functional

Keeps your hands nice and warm

Available in 4 styles for men and women

 

 

MEDIA COVERAGE

 

 

CUSTOMER REVIEWS

 

CHOOSE YOUR COLOUR

 

 

MEASUREMENT GUIDE

DELIVERY SCHEDULE

About Versatyl

The VERSATYL is designed by Emirate Fashions Pvt Ltd - a garment manufacturing firm based out of the startup capital of India - Bengaluru (AKA Bangalore). The idea for this came when Saneen Javali (who was an engineer at IBM & now one of the Directors and Chief Designer at Emirate Fashions) was looking for something unique to make at a breakthrough price. Most travel jackets he noticed were overpriced and this spurred him to design the VERSATYL. The vision is to make it the de-facto standard in travel jackets. Be it on an aircraft or a boat , on a bike, trekking the country side or for everyday use, the VERSATYL is what you want.

  • Risks and challenges

    PRODUCTION RELATED:

    We are a garment production firm & have a trained set of workers & designers. We are aiming to start shipping out Jackets from Early August 2017. We don't expect delays as we have already done a crowdfunding campaign and shipped out jackets as per schedule. Acts of god w.r.t inclement weather may be spoilers. For International shipping we are using DHL, FedEx, India Speed post or equivalent courier partners to get the product shipped out.

     

  • INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING:

    We offer worldwide shipping to our International Backers. International shipments may be subject to import duties and customs fees, which are levied once your package reaches the destination, and are the responsibility of the Backer. 

 

  • FAQs

    How is the VERSATYL priced so low?

    We run a tight ship & have an efficient structure. We have automated machines with high labour productivity. Further. crowdfunding means our INVENTORY & WORKING CAPITAL requirements are almost ZERO as we get funds in advance. That translates into very low costs for us. Rather than try & make big profits we would rather build a big brand. We decided we would pass on most of the benefits of this lower price to you - our Backer. We still make a decent profit at these prices! 

    About us & why we are doing this?

    Emirate Fashions Pvt Ltd has a long history in clothing manufacturing and has been making garments for a few of the reputed brands in India. The VERSATYL is the result of massive demand that we've seen from observing travellers, bikers, cyclists & the outdoor person. Rather than come up with another Jacket, we decided to give "people on the move" a piece of clothing that gave them the freedom to carry all their essentials around on their person! After our two Successful campaign on fuelAdream, A premier Indian Crowd funding platform, Now We're launching this campaign on indiegogo.com to make it easier to reach out to customers globally!

    What are our labour practices?

    We pay our workers as per the Indian governments daily wage act. All the tailors & artisans who work in our factory are above the age of 21. We are an equal opportunity employer.

    Are there any international custom fees?

    The cost of the Versatyl includes international shipping. However, any duty/taxes/local levies etc. if applicable are not factored for and will be the responsibility of the funder. You will need to pay this when you receive the Jacket. 

    Is the Jacket waterproof?

    The jacket is water resistant & not waterproof. If exposed to long durations of heavy rainfall, water might begin to seep in through the seams.

    What are the care/cleaning guidelines?

    The care and cleaning maintenance of the jacket are fairly basic. It can be washed on any machine wash setting. Since its water resistant most things will swipe right off the jacket as well! Do not IRON it though.

    What is your policy on returns?

    We do not have a return policy. Since we are crowdfunding it and doing this at a break-even price we cannot afford a return policy. Our advice on size is to ideally pick a size that is slightly bigger than what you would usually buy. That is cause when you stuff the Jacket with a number of items you will need some extra space to have a perfect fit.

    Should I order the Jacket in my size or is "a size bigger" the correct fit for me?

    Jackets are usually worn on one or two layers of clothing. In addition the VERSATYL can pack quite a lot of travel stuff making it bulk up a bit. The last thing you want is a super tight fit. Ordering a size bigger is what we would recommend. The final call is yours.

story:
A New Breed of Watch Designs - Bold and Distinctive - Shock and Water Resistant with 3 Year Battery Life and 2 Year Warranty

BullToro is redefining rugged fashion with bold and distinctive watches. Backed by 4 patents, the powerful look telegraphs the rugged strength of its intelligent engineering. Built of high quality, durable materials, each part is crafted to provide long product life.  We plan to offer 3-hand analog and crown operated digital watches. Priced between $295 to $395, our watches have unique “fit and comfort” features with oversized cases, tilted dials and displays, oversized angled crowns, raised ridges on casebacks, vents on cases and bracelets and electroluminescent backlights. All watches are water and shock resistant and use stainless steel cases with mineral glass lens, a fiberglass reinforced polycarbonate core and stainless steel bracelets or durable polyurethane straps. All watches have a 3-year battery life and are backed by a 2 year warranty. Our watches are geared to appeal to younger, hip urbanites and urban professionals, male and female, primarily ages 18-44 and who like to shop on the Internet.

Smart Design Solutions to Enhance Fit and Comfort on Your Wrist

The BullToro Watch brand is built around the premise of large-sized innovative designs that not only standout against repetitive watch styling, but are based on smart, solution-based design and engineering to enhance consumer comfort and fit. Guided by consumer feedback, we imparted several unique consumer benefits into our designs: an enhanced grip/angled crown (utility patent) to help reset time and other functions without removing the watch from the wrist; a  tilted watch face, angled back toward the wearer to enhance readability; a series of comfort vents in the watch head and bracelets which help with air circulation and cooling between the watch and wrist; and lastly, raised bumps on the caseback (utility patent) which helps to elevate the watch and also keep the wrist cool.  

BullToro will introduce the Industry's First Home Trial Program via our Website: www.bulltoro.com 

Consumers try watches on at home and pay only for the watches they keep. Company pays shipping both ways.

BullToro Target Market

Our watches are geared to appeal to younger, upper income urbanites and urban professionals who live in countries around the globe with well developed economies. We will also be targeting individuals with a strong propensity to shop via the Internet as opposed to shopping in stores. We believe that there are nearly 100 million consumers in the United States, who fall into this market segment. Our future plans call for global expansion in similar markets with a target population of around 1
billion consumers.  

State of the Art Internet Logistics and Customer Operations:

Our company will employ "State of the Art” cloud technology, totally integrating Customer Orders, Order Processing, Shipping, Customer Billing, Tax Reporting and Dashboard statistical tracking. Only human involvement is packaging the box and giving it to the UPS driver. Our Social Networking includes integration with Facebook, Twitter and Pinterest. The BullToro website electric energy needs are provided by Green Power (Wind Turbines) technology.

Our Management Team

BullToro has a very seasoned, professional and well-rounded team with over 100 years of high level management experience in watches and other industries. Our
management has in-house experience in general management, marketing and sales, product planning/development, Industrial design, I.T. and logistics, legal, human
resources and finance and budgeting. We also have an ample network of outside
resources and the ability and experience to effectively manage and oversee contract
services.

Risk and Challenges:

Forecasting and inventory management will be very challenging, but our greatest challenge will be getting the word out into the market place, making consumers aware of BullToro Watches and building our brand in the future.

Our Campaign Goal and Your Support:

We have been working on BullToro Watches for the past three years and we have come a long way in developing product and market plans. We are seeking your support to raise $325,000 so that we can finish product and market development and launch a national and international campaign to build awareness of our brand in the marketplace. We hope that you agree that we have a new and exciting design and are willing to help support us in our future efforts.
