story:
A foldable bike helmet that adjusts to your head shape and fits into your bag.

 

Our Indiegogo campaign has come to an end

 

After a successful 40-day campaign, which showed us that urban cyclists and the media alike value our product, we have ended our crowdfunding campaign. We’re extremely proud and grateful for over 300 backers around the world supporting our vision. We’re now working hard to get our 1st production of LID helmets onto the heads of our backers. For everyone else interested in getting their hands on a LID helmet, you can sign up to our mailing list and be the 1st to know when we’re ready to start shipping: www.lidhelmet.com.    

 

 

 

We’re launching LID Helmets to address a common complaint amongst urban, commuter cyclists – what to do with your bike helmet when you’re not wearing it? Some riders lock it to their bike, some dangle it from their bag. However, ‘helmet hassle’ can be so bad that many riders don’t bother wearing one, or even worse, pass on cycling altogether. LID wants to change this by introducing an eco-friendly helmet which folds to slip into your bag and is so stylish, that no rider will ever have an excuse not to wear a helmet again.

 

 

 

We know that when it comes to helmets, style or convenience is nothing unless you deliver safety too. For this reason, we have spent two-years developing LID and putting it through rigorous testing to guarantee a safe product. The LID helmet is officially safety certified and has already achieved the official safety testing certification to European (EN1078) and North American (CPSC) standards.

 

 

LID helmet compacts down and fits your bag. No more hassle of carrying around a bulky helmet!

 

 

Fits in your bag. We know helmets are a hassle, so we've designed ours to make life easier and safer. Our unique helmet design cascades, allowing the helmet to compact into a size and shape which easily slips into backpacks, satchels, or tote handbags.

Fits your head. Further helping with the fit, we’ve included a 4-notch adjustment system and Velcro band, which allows for additional fit-tailoring. Our chin-strap padding feature also prevents any irritating strap-burn.

Comfortable. LID's multi-piece design automatically adjusts itself to the rider's head shape, providing a truly snug fit. The adjustable fit system further allows the rider to tailor the fit of the helmet within the size range.

Keeps you cool. LID’s multi-piece design channels airflow to the rider’s scalp, preventing over-heating. Other one-piece or folding, urban designed helmets are often found to be ‘sweat buckets’ – not LID’s!

Fits your style. LID's clean lines, urban profile and bold colours provide ‘safety in colour’, making LID a helmet you’ll want to wear everywhere. We'll have 5 matte-finish colour options available.

Clip-on light. As we’re talking about safety, we also integrated into our design a rear-anchor point for a clip-on, USB rechargeable, safety light, making you the rider more visible when on the road.

 

At LID, we have chosen to manufacturer our helmets from recycled expanded polystyrene - the main component for producing safety helmets. Although this is a more costly manufacturing process, working towards a sustainable future is an ethos at the core of the LID brand. The polystyrene is initially used in packaging delicate auto parts by a leading US auto manufacturer. The packaging is then collected, compressed and reformulated into pellets which can be expanded to the required density for making our safety helmets. The impact absorption properties of the recycled EPS match those of the primary market option.

We want to be at the center of facilitating more commuters to ride bikes in cities. We’re concerned about the air quality in our cities. Spiralling populations across the globe are causing serious issues in large cities. Limited space means a rise in vehicle congestion, pollution and a strain on public transport systems. Additionally, obesity is rapidly catching tobacco-use as the Number 1 cause of preventable death. Besides walking, cycling is the most cost-effective and effective offset to these serious issues.

So if you share our vision, get a perk and support us!

 

 

All helmets are designed to adjust

to fit a range of head sizes.

 

 

To make sure you get the right size and

instructions on how to fit and adjust the helmet properly,

please watch our Fit Guide video.

 

We’re different to most product crowdfunding projects – we’ve already done the hard work and paid for it ourselves. We’ve taken LID from a vision and prototype, through two-years of product development, testing countless prototypes and have achieved official safety testing certification. We did all of this because we wanted you, our Indiegogo backers, to feel confident that you’re backing a ‘real’ product and unlike other projects you might have backed in the past, you won’t get frustrated at waiting through a bunch of product development delays to get your hands on the goods! Once we close our Indiegogo campaign, we’ll place our order with our manufacturer to produce them. Factoring in shipping times, you’ll have your LID Helmet by early-May 2018.

More than anything we are looking for market validation and to connect with our customers. We believe LID is the best helmet for urban riders and we want to hear what you think. That being said, LID is a completely self-funded start-up and we need a little bit of your help to get us to the finish line! The funds received from Indiegogo will go towards the tooling costs, to ramp up production, introduce more sizes and to develop a kids range. We want to hear your feedback so please comment on our Indiegogo page or contact us at indiegogo@lidhelmet.com.

  

Sam wanted to create a helmet which could help get more commuters out of vehicles and onto bikes and protect their heads at the same time. ‘Safety with convenience’ is motto under which LID Helmets was developed.  Sam has always loved the outdoors and has commuted by bike in London for 10 years. Having spent 10 years in the investment banking industry, working on merger & acquisition transactions, he picked up a few things about business along the way, but what drives him is doing things differently and making a change. As side-projects, he’s pursued some wacky ideas, including converting old British red telephone boxes into cigar humidors and distributing to high-end boutique hotels. 

LID is Sam’s ‘lightbulb’ moment, so in mid-2015 he decided to leave the corporate world and take a leap of faith and develop an eco-friendly, foldable, commuter bike helmet. He’s been running with the idea with everything he has ever since! Sam has consulted with some of the best minds in product design, specializing in safety products. There hasn’t been a stone left unturned in bringing LID Helmets to Indiegogo.  We hope to be a small part of a larger solution and movement to transition our cities towards a more sustainable, zero-emission future. Staying true to this mission, we’ve chosen to produce our helmets from recycled EPS (the main component in helmets, which absorbs the impact force), despite the higher manufacturing cost of doing so.   

The first stage of the production process has already begun for LID. Our helmets are manufactured in China at a highly-rated production facility. We have already produced the first batch of safety approved samples to share with the media and potential retailers. After the Indiegogo campaign closes, we will collate the orders and begin the fulfillment process for a May delivery.

For us, it was really important to create a campaign that is as risk-free to the backers as possible. We have spent a lot of time and money on the product development and safety certifications so we could offer you a ready high-quality product - not a prototype! Our product is ready to go and all we need to do is make the order from the factory. This will cut down the delivery time exponentially compared to most crowdfunding campaigns that might take a year or more to deliver.  Our manufacturing is lined-up and ready to go, so we really don’t see any risks & challenges!

For press inquiries: hello@lidhelmet.com

For Backer support: indiegogo@lidhelmet.com

Q: It’s foldable, but is it safe?

A: Our foldable helmet, LID, is designed to remove some of the hassles of carrying a bike helmet, but what isn't removed is the safety integrity you’d expect from a traditional helmet. Our helmets have achieved safety certification for European (EN1078) and North American (CPSC) testing standards.

There is often a misconception that safety helmets must be a one-piece design in order to absorb an impact and protect the skull. This isn't the case. In fact, many motorcycle helmets are made from strips of EPS (the impact absorbing material which sits closest to the head) at the protective core, covered by a thin, one-piece outer shell.

Each helmet segment in LID's multi-piece design has its own, independent, ability to absorb impact, thereby protecting the rider's skull.

Q: If you’re this far along, why do you need Indiegogo?

A: We’re launching LID in a M – L size (55-58cm / 21 5/8" - 22 7/8 " / Hat Size: 6 3/4 - 7 ¼), which captures the average head sizes for both males (55 cm / 21 ¾ in) and females (57cm / 22 ½ in). However, some riders will require a smaller size than this and some will need a larger size. The use of proceeds from our Indiegogo campaign will be used to cover the cost of the tooling for these sizes, which isn’t cheap! Therefore, when we progress to normal retail distribution, we’ll have a full-size range to offer riders across the world.

And what about the kids??

We also want to introduce a kid’s range too. A successful campaign will help us do it.

Q: I know it’s safe, but what if I live outside the regions you’ve achieved safety certification?

A: Unless you live in Australia / New Zealand, the safety certification that we’ve achieved will mean we can ship you a LID helmet. 

Q: We see so many cool ideas on crowdfunding platforms that over-promise and under-deliver on their shipment date, why are you different?

A: Unlike a lot of crowdfunding projects, we have chosen to take our product through the development phase first before launching. We did this because unlike a lot of other lifestyle products, helmets are all about the safety integrity. We know that it would have been asking a lot to show you a prototype and trust us that we’d not only get a lengthy product development process and pass the strenuous impact safety tests. So, we’ve taken away all of that uncertainty and done all of the hard work before sharing our product and ambitions with you.

Now, all that’s left to do is receive your backing, then place the order with our manufacturer.

Q: How are LID’s helmets manufactured?

A: We spent a lot of time researching and finding the right suppliers and manufacturers. After consulting with a University with a globally-leading sports engineering department, we were introduced to our manufacturer, who produce helmets for almost all of the top helmet brands in the world (cycle, ski, motorcycle and horse riding).

We use a full-wrap in-mold process which combines the EPS inner core of the helmet (which absorbs impact) with the outer polycarbonate shell. This produces the highest quality of finishes.

Unlike other helmet brands, we’ve chosen to produce our helmets from recycled EPS. Rather than filling the world’s landfills further, we are working with a leading auto manufacturer in the USA to collect their packaging materials used in transporting delicate auto parts. The polystyrene is compressed and reformulated into pellets that can be expanded to the desired density, creating EPS. This eco-friendly EPS has been strenuously tested against virgin EPS and delivers the same level of safety required by testing standards. It's more costly to produce this way, but we think it’s worth it.

Q: Why are you making the helmet available in only one size?

A: Tooling costs are expensive, so that’s why we need the support of the Indiegogo community – to help us cover the costs to introduce other size options. Our M-L launch size will satisfy most riders, but we know some people will need a smaller helmet and others will need a larger offering. After a successful campaign, we’ll have those options available before moving onto standard retail distribution.

Q: How much does a LID Helmet weigh?

A: 410 grams, which is light-weight in comparison to many other urban design bike helmets on the market.  

Q: How much does shipping cost?

A: Shipping is included in the price you'll pay for any of the perks you choose.

Q: What kind of warranty do you offer?

A: LID Helmets warrants that our helmets will be free of any manufacturing defects in material and workmanship when it is delivered to you. This warranty is limited to one year from the time of delivery to you. This warranty does not apply in the event of incorrect size selection, abuse, negligence, carelessness, or if the product is used in any way other than is intended. 

Q: Can I get a refund?

A: Please refer to IndieGoGo's policy here. If you have any questions regarding refunds, please contact returns@lidhelmet.com.

story:
Made By a History Nerd, For Other History Nerds

​For as long as I can remember, I've had an obsession with 18th Century America, Colonial American, and Revolutionary War period. Ever since childhood, the sound of fife and drum playing in the distance had the same effect of a moth to a flame, and the sight of someone wearing a tricorn hat caused me stare with wide-eyed wonder. Even today, I wish I could yell "Huzzah!" in the general public without disapproving looks from strangers. 

These are the ideals Liberty & Co. was created upon. What better way to show your love of American history than to wear it for everyone to see?

Liberty & Co. t-shirts are a combination of timeless classics, and fresh, original designs. Simply put, Liberty & Co. shirts are what I'd want to wear!  These designs are meant to honor the patriots and events that formed our great country.

But most importantly, I want to do my small part by donating 10% of all post-launch proceeds to the Museum of the American Revolution in Philadelphia (please read more about it below!)

Warmest Regards,

– – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – – –

The 10-Shirt Lineup

We have many more ideas planned as post-launch additions, but these are the designs that will be in our original production run. Choose 1, or as many as you like. Or purchase one of our money-saving bundles, including the full 10-shirt collection for ONLY $150 (regularly $280).

  1. Liberty Bell
  2. The Flag of George Washington's Headquarters
  3. Paul Revere & Son - Bell and Foundry
  4. Join, or Die
  5. Fort Bennington Flag
  6. 1775 Militia
  7. Benjamin Franklin Print Shop & Bindery
  8. John Adams Law Practice
  9. The Bloody Massacre
  10. Liberty Flag (Moultrie Flag)

Makes a Great Gift!

Looking for the perfect gift for yourself or the history buff(s) in the family? Not exactly sure which shirt to give? We're offering discounted gift codes in $20, $50, $75, and $100 denominations, starting at only $15! These electronic discount codes will be available and active on our online retail website when our initial production run is complete. All gift codes purchased through the campaign will be good until December 31st, 2019. 

Make a Difference with Every Purchase You Make

Liberty & Co. is most passionate about preserving American Colonial history. We want to do our small part in supporting that endeavor by educating generations to come. 10% of all post-launch proceeds will be donated to the Museum of the American Revolution in Philadelphia, PA. 

Why the MoAR in Philadelphia? If you haven't had the pleasure of visiting, the MoAR is the quintessential resource of the American Revolutionary era. Quite simply, there's no better or more comprehensive educational experience encapsulating the social issues, politics,  and tribulations of the times.

Help us spread the word! Just set up an Indiegogo account, and use your personalized link to share with your friends via Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or email! Follow the step-by-step instructions here.

So start sharing, and good luck!

Referral Contest Prizes 

The Top 4 referrers will win Liberty & Co. Gift Cards for use on any product! Rankings will be based on the total number of individual referrals, not the monetary amount of sales generated. Prizes will be distributed along with the regular campaign shipments (late August/early September). 

 

 

Not your Average T-Shirt

Liberty & Co. is obsessed with attention to detail. Your shirts aren't going to arrive wrapped in a sterile plastic bag – when you open your package, we want it to be more of an experience. Purchasing a Liberty & Co. t-shirt is quite literally an investment toward the preservation of Colonial American History

Our shirts come neatly packaged, adorned with fun extras about the history or theme of the item you've purchased. 

Most importantly, you'll be contributing to an important cause.

 

Frequent Inquiries

  • Are the orders guaranteed? Yes! We're running a flexible campaign, so all funds will be used for the initial shirt printing cost, regardless of whether the maximum goal is reached. 
  • Can I create a custom bundle? You sure can! Just email us, letting us know which shirts you'd like, and we'll generate a code for a special order. 
  • Do you have womens' or kids' styles/sizes? Not quite yet, but we plan to offer alternative shirt styles in the near future! 
  • What about other products, like hoodies? We do have plans to roll out other items in the future, such as hoodies and mugs. Be sure to follow us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter for updates! 
  • When will my shirts arrive? All orders will begin shipping by late August. 
  • Will there be more designs in the future? That's a BIG yes! There are many more designs that are in the pipeline for production. The 10 featured in the launch campaign are just the beginning.

 

Challenges and Obstacles

Ultimately, Liberty & Co. is an historical t-shirt business – and businesses need funds to launch, grow, and operate. 

So, here's the nitty gritty:

  • We'd like to launch with 10 different T-Shirt designs, with more designs already planned for release in the very near future. 
  • 100% of pre-launch funds will be used for initial printing runs and packaging.
  • Upon company launch 10% of all proceeds will be donated annually to the MoAR in Philadelphia. 
  1. Production - After much detailed consideration, I have chosen printers and vendors who have a very high reputation in the fashion industry. Since Liberty & Co. does not personally print the shirt stock, there is a small chance of being met with unforeseen production delays. However, post-launch, my top priority will be to ensure your items reach your door within the original deadline. 
  2. Appearance - The images seen in this campaign are mockups only. While we have carefully designed these mockups to resemble the final product as closely as possible. However, while the design of the graphics will appear the same, please be aware that the final result (such as subtle color variances) may be very slightly different than the mockup images.

Liberty Flag (Moultrie Flag)




Makes a Great Gift!
Looking for the perfect gift for yourself or the history buff(s) in the family? Not exactly sure which shirt to give? We're offering discounted gift codes in $20, $50, $75, and $100 denominations, starting at only $15! These electronic discount codes will be available and active on our online retail website when our initial production run is complete. All gift codes purchased through the campaign will be good until December 31st, 2019. 


Make a Difference with Every Purchase You Make
Liberty & Co. is most passionate about preserving American Colonial history. We want to do our small part in supporting that endeavor by educating generations to come. 10% of all post-launch proceeds will be donated to the Museum of the American Revolution in Philadelphia, PA. 
Why the MoAR in Philadelphia? If you haven't had the pleasure of visiting, the MoAR is the quintessential resource of the American Revolutionary era. Quite simply, there's no better or more comprehensive educational experience encapsulating the social issues, politics,  and tribulations of the times.

Help us spread the word! Just set up an Indiegogo account, and use your personalized link to share with your friends via Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or email! Follow the step-by-step instructions here.
So start sharing, and good luck!
Referral Contest Prizes 
The Top 4 referrers will win Liberty & Co. Gift Cards for use on any product! Rankings will be based on the total number of individual referrals, not the monetary amount of sales generated. Prizes will be distributed along with the regular campaign shipments (late August/early September). 
 
 
Not your Average T-Shirt
Liberty & Co. is obsessed with attention to detail. Your shirts aren't going to arrive wrapped in a sterile plastic bag – when you open your package, we want it to be more of an experience. Purchasing a Liberty & Co. t-shirt is quite literally an investment toward the preservation of Colonial American History
Our shirts come neatly packaged, adorned with fun extras about the history or theme of the item you've purchased. 
Most importantly, you'll be contributing to an important cause.

 
Frequent Inquiries


Are the orders guaranteed? Yes! We're running a flexible campaign, so all funds will be used for the initial shirt printing cost, regardless of whether the maximum goal is reached. 

Can I create a custom bundle? You sure can! Just email us, letting us know which shirts you'd like, and we'll generate a code for a special order. 

Do you have womens' or kids' styles/sizes? Not quite yet, but we plan to offer alternative shirt styles in the near future! 

What about other products, like hoodies? We do have plans to roll out other items in the future, such as hoodies and mugs. Be sure to follow us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter for updates! 

When will my shirts arrive? All orders will begin shipping by late August. 

Will there be more designs in the future? That's a BIG yes! There are many more designs that are in the pipeline for production. The 10 featured in the launch campaign are just the beginning.

 
Challenges and Obstacles
Ultimately, Liberty & Co. is an historical t-shirt business – and businesses need funds to launch, grow, and operate. 
So, here's the nitty gritty:

We'd like to launch with 10 different T-Shirt designs, with more designs already planned for release in the very near future. 
100% of pre-launch funds will be used for initial printing runs and packaging.
Upon company launch 10% of all proceeds will be donated annually to the MoAR in Philadelphia. 


Production - After much detailed consideration, I have chosen printers and vendors who have a very high reputation in the fashion industry. Since Liberty & Co. does not personally print the shirt stock, there is a small chance of being met with unforeseen production delays. However, post-launch, my top priority will be to ensure your items reach your door within the original deadline. 
Appearance - The images seen in this campaign are mockups only. While we have carefully designed these mockups to resemble the final product as closely as possible. However, while the design of the graphics will appear the same, please be aware that the final result (such as subtle color variances) may be very slightly different than the mockup images.

story:
Hello my name is Sean Flores Founder of Armored Eagle Apparel.
As an ex-Navy corpsman, having served 8 yrs at various commands attached to the US Marine Corps I would like to bring your attention to what we at Armored Eagle are trying to accomplish. Our mission is to provide financial resources to active and former military personnel through the revenues generated from the sales of Armored Eagle Apparel.


As many of you already know, military spending has been cut quite a bit over the last few years, over the next nine years over $500 billion is expected to be cut from our defense budget, on top of the already $1 trillion in defense cuts since 2010. The difference between this drawdown and any other in recent history is that it is taking place while tens of thousands of US forces are still in harm’s way. Inactive service members are no longer receiving the proper financial aid they need and are having a tough time adapting back into civilian life.


It is a hard fact to face, but our brave men and women who have served and whom are still serving this greatcountry are struggling daily to make the transition back to a normal life.


Here at Armored Eagle Apparel we are hard at work creating a company that can help military service members, active or inactive, with financial aid for things like counseling, prosthetic limbs and PTSD research and help.

This is where you can help. With a donation to our campaing you will be helping to build a company that is dedicated to helping our service members. With perks like military grade paracord bracelets, t-shirts, and stickers you can be a part of the Armored Eagle family and our on going effort to make life for are service members better.

Please help those who selflessly lay their lives on the line daily.

 

Thank you for your donation and time and OORAH!!

story:
Support DIKI FERGUSON start-up her In-House Studio

We Believe that Marketing is the power of Knowledge and Fashion are Trends we Dare to Wear
 

With your help this will allow me to address the needs of my business "DIKI FERGUSON LLC". DIKI FERGUSON is a Ready-To-Wear (RTW) lifestyle collection for both male and female from the ages of 18-37. Our influential styles of fashion will zeal our audiences with astonishment silhouette that will leave you in a trance.  The mission for the season is to start up a business by doing something I love to do and create more jobs for others.

It will be an honor and opportunity with your support to help make my dreams come true as well as others by creating more jobs. I wish I had more to offer, but due to limited space and my current situation its very hard for me to provide more than what I can offer. You won't regret it, because my dedication to fashion is beyond talent. 

My mission is to gradually dress and grow my business an be a true leader that inspire. To build my business with believers to motivated and nurture them. A great Author once said "A person with a new idea is a crank until the ideal succeeds.-Mark Twain 

As a great leader I will soon meet up with a Business Consultant and attend workshop to secure my business as it explore the beginning of a new birth within the fashion and business market. 

Sneak Peak of Ju.Pearl Dirty Laundry by DIKI FERGUSON LLC S/S 14


 DIKI FERGUSON In-House Studio

The Master Plan

This money would be use towards the following:

To purchase In-House Studio,Furniture, Computers, 2 Industry Sewing Machine, 1 Serger Machine,Dress Form Mannequins, Racks, Table, Iron, Pattern paper, Oak tag, Sewing Notions, Photo shop and Illustrator programs, stationary,and etc...

Thank you so much and I knew you were a "Believer"

If you can dream it, you can do it- Walt Disney

P.S 

I surround myself with believers


To address the risk and challenges would prefer to strategy. Our strategy is the core of the business( Focus). Focus and identity our business determined how different we are from others. Also, we know how to recognize the S.W.O.T and use this tools as an opportunity by doing what needs to be done.

Sale forecast is very important within our business to predict how well our business is worth. Every business need a plan and DIKI FERGUSON have a milestone plan to put them into concrete measure.

story:
Heirloom scarves, handmade virtuously by master weavers. Born from a desire to create change. Grassroots luxury for a sentient world.

To support us, click the SHARE tools. Feeling the love makes a big difference!    

Why is APOCCAS a changemaker?   

Celebrating the untainted beauty and making of hand woven, luxurious scarves are at the very heart of APOCCAS.  We don’t just make a better scarf - we make scarves better.  For the discerning consumer, luxury cannot be fashioned at the expense of human dignity; instead it should be a beacon for compassion and sustainability.  Our creations embody this philosophy.

We believe in empowering rural communities.  We want economic independence for all and work directly with organic silk farmers and cotton growers, expert spinners, traditional dyers and artisan weavers in rural Thailand.  In short, we are missionaries of trade, not aid - we live by helping others help themselves.

We invite you to join us, to be a champion of positive change …

{All film & image credits: Marisa Marchitelli @ marisaportfolio}

What’s the proposition?

… the way we champion our matron artisans who live tucked away in spectacular rural landscapes reminiscent of Ancient Siam.  APOCCAS is determined to revive the spirit of heirloom master weaving, to harness the energy of all things handmade.  Uncovering age-old skills passed down from generation to generation, we have made it our mission to improve the livelihood of Thai artisan women by showcasing their creations to a global audience.

Owning an APOCCAS scarf is saying: “I love quality, craftsmanship and values that respect the wellbeing of others and the environment”.  Wearing our contemporary designs of traditional patterns messages out to your world: “today I make a difference”. 

What do people and the Press say about us?

DestinAsian notes:

“Scarved for Life: … Du Sold’s brand of grassroots luxury is epitomised by her neck warmers.”

Financial Times - How To Spend It says:

“Worthwhile weaving: Scarves, wraps and throws that champion Thai craftsmanship” and “Ripping good yarn”

Wallpaper*’s Melina Keays, Entertaining Director, remarks:

“With their exquisite details of texture and design, not to mention the integrity of their materials and craftsmanship, these hand-woven textiles are a pleasure to use, and a pleasure to own.”

Where does your money go?

Our most ambitious project to date is to take APOCCAS to the next level. Your hard-earned dollars, pounds or rupees will go straight to pay for the making of our New Season collection of scarves and bracelets.  All of the funds raised on Indiegogo will fairly remunerate the women’s groups we’ve partnered with, including our Buddhist nun weavers and a NGO in the North of Thailand which grows silk for us and botanical-dyes it.

{Above: New Collection | PROSPERITY & POWER BRACELETS. DIVINE throw. SUBLIME, BASIC, ONE-FOR-THE-BOYS & CLASSIC scarves.}

What will you get with your perk?

Please take a look at the right column for details on our perks.

We’ve carefully compiled our reward combinations to anticipate your personal preferences.  You may find that our perks make excellent gifts, too!  If you don't see a reward combination that tickles your fancy, just drop us a line with your request at contact@apoccas.com and we will add it immediately.

SUNFLOWER LOVE: 3x gift cards + envelopes with our thanks

{Above: domestically farmed Mulberry trees are ‘food’ for Thailand’s silk industry: both for the Mulberry silkworms and the tens of thousands of people it employs}

POWER BRACELET: choose one

PROSPERITY BRACELET: choose one below

LUXE BRACELET: choose one below

THE BASIC SCARF: choose one below

THE CLASSIC SCARF: choose one below

ONE FOR THE BOYS: choose one below

THE CORE+ Duet: choose a set below

THE BRACELET TRILOGY: choose one from each row below = 3 bracelets total

THE SILKY: choose one below

THE SILKY+ Duet: choose a set below

THE CLASSIC+ QUARTET: choose two sets below = 4 pieces total

THE SILKY+ QUARTET: choose two sets below = 4 pieces total

THE SUBLIME: choose from gold, green or indigo below. 100% Gold Peacock silk

THE DIVINE: say 'yes I do' to our sofa throw below in silver-cream with either coconut brown or (as below) in indigo blue. 100% Gold Peacock silk

TRUE CHAMPION: The APOCCAS revolution

{Spearhead the way to revive Eri silk in northern Thailand - let's make it happen}

Stretch goals

Wondering if there’s room to invest your time and money even once we’ve reached our goal?  Think no further.  This campaign introduces nine of our collection styles and lets you own them now. 

In case our funding goal is exceeded we are prepared.  We have tucked into our starting blocks to gear up production for another six scarf collections and three throw designs for sitting around a bonfire or beautifying the home.  Your contribution will pay ‘fairly’ and directly for the making and marketing of these treasures that you can admire below.  From the cotton or silk farmer to the master weaver.

{Above: Additional Collection: ZIG & ZAG, HONY & MARI throws, UPCY, LOOS, KORA, GONG & 1/1 UNIQUE scarves}

Why Indiegogo?

We’re changemakers, new to the game, and we like fresh ways of thinking.  We feel the love in our matron-run village communities but we’re equally after public validation and this means you.  Crowdfunding is an ingenious way to help us in our efforts to get both word and product out to the world but it is ‘all or nothing’ and that is a concern.  50% of humanity is female and the talents and traditions of these women deserve recognition.  At APOCCAS, we’re just the catalysts: our mission is to uncover and streamline their skills into heirloom designs.  Indiegogo facilitates: it provides a platform for us to showcase what we believe in and for you to endorse empowerment for our artisans.

Your support can be more than financial

Empowering people is gratifying for everyone.  Thank you for absorbing the essence of our initiative.  If you’re ready to back us – magnificent!  If you’re not feeling money-generous but do buy into our dream, there’s room to spread our word with your family, networks and friends.  Open doors to other changemakers if you can.  The world is ready to be a better place.

Risks & challenges

As with anything handmade, our biggest challenge is time.  Most of our yarns are spun, reeled, dyed and woven not by machines, but by human hands.  Delays may occur in light of the complex processes during manufacture although we set realistic production and delivery dates. Unexpected village ceremonies or heavier than usual downpours during Thailand’s rainy season, floods and quarterly rice harvest chores may disrupt the best of goodwill further but we’re all about communicating and problem solving and will post regular updates throughout.

story:
MY STORY

My name is Aku-Sika Barrett. I was born and raised in Ghana. As a child I had a passion for textile, fashion, and traveling. I always craved uniqueness and individualism. The last of 5 children,  I  tried to set myself apart from my older sisters, by adopting my own unique style.

My career started as a Stenographer Secretary, then I went to American Airlines Academy to pursue a course in Travel and Tourism.  Unfortunately, I had to put my career on hold to accompany my husband on his foreign assignments.  When we relocated to Cairo in 1992,  I had so much time on my hands, until I discovered the art of painting on silk;  I pursued it with a passion, and later opened my own design studio in Jakarta Indonesia and later in Doha Qatar to teach others.  Being able to create my own designs on silk made it easy for me to express my unique sense of style; giving birth to a business idea.

In 2004, when we moved to Portugal, I started my company, producing hand painted silk accessories like scarves and ties.  My dream was to turn my beautiful paintings into Couture garments, and shoes. I realized those dreams when I employed a Couturière and also received my first shoe sample from the manufactures in Spain.    Since then, I have had unique shoes made for me in Italy and in Peru.

My desire to know how to draw and learn about fashion design led me to the prestigious fashion school in Milan (Istituto Marangoni).  

People adored my hand painted silk clothing wherever I went, but when they wanted some, I could only grin and shrug, because I couldn't duplicate.  I always found it difficult parting with the pieces because I got so attached to them.  

I am now ready to launch  a high-end  Ready To Wear collection from my painted silk, so that I can satisfy prospective clients, and start my own Silk Emporium.  I have spent the last couple of years researching digital printing, testing fabrics and the market. I have produced my prototypes, and now, it is time to go into production, but I will need your help.

To succeed, I have to do something different, hence this project.  This campaign therefore, is to raise sufficient funds to produce, launch and market the collection and help sustain the business.   


MY GOAL

I am seeking at least $45,000.  This amount will be used to print the silks for production of garments and accessories, and as the prodution of the clothes will take place in-house, this amount will also guarantee the salaries of at least a tailor and a machinist for 6 months, employ the services of a sales/marketing personnel.  I have worked alone promoting the brand as best as I could.  Now, it is time to employ the services of professionals


PERKS

Your contribution will not be for nothing, no matter how small.  I have some fun and exciting perks, as well as some business opportunities. 

  • Unique 'Seasons Greeting' card, made from my hand painted silk, and personally mounted.  It's attractive and makes a nice gift as well.
  • Exclusive Crystal body tattoos made with Swarovski crystals.
  • the distinguished man's fine accessories like Cummerbunds, ties, and ascots.  These will be hand made in Italy from my new printed silks.  
  • Limited Edition slim Black Silk Tie embellished with my Crystallized Adinkra® symbol
  • delightful and elegant large Silk Organza stoles made from my new prints.
  • I am delighted to offer an autographed copy of my recently published Memoir - "the butterfly that became a kite". I will include an acknowledgement of your contribution in the autograph. 
  • I will add new perks as I dream them up.
  • For the retailer, this is your opportunity to stock up and be the first to retail my exclusive and luxurious silks.  You will be listed on my official website as being a retail partner.  Good investment opportunity.

The surprise factor is very exciting, and your contribution will be well worth it.  You will be acknowledged on my Facebook page, and your  name will be listed on my website, unless you want to be anonymous.  Should you wish to be anonymous, then each morning when the sun rises, imagine me giving you a Thank You hug, for without your support, this project will not be successful.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

I have already contacted other accessories manufacturers in Italy to do the production of the men's accessories and the Organza scarves.  The Fabric printers are waiting for my order.  Even though all the various manufacturers have quick turn around times,  the holiday season might cause slight delays depending on the quantities claimed.  I will endeavor to meet the deadline, and will always keep you updated.

WHAT IF......

.....I am not fortunate enough to meet my goal, I will move to 'Plan C' which is to focus on accessories only.  No matter what I receive, there's always a part of the business that needs funds.  There's always raw silk and dyes to buy.

BUT IF....

On a positive note, if I exceed the amount I seek, it will make a huge impact, as it will enable me put Plan A into action, which is to set up the Atelier in a proper location, employ additional tailors, afford advertising, and embark on the journey that will turn Aku-Sika, the brand, into a "love brand" - 

In conclusion, I hope you feel inspired to contribute generously. (Even though no amount is too small, no amount is too much either)

DON'T WORRY IF YOU CAN'T HELP FINANCIALLY 

If you're unable to contribute financially, you can still help by spreading the word.  Tell your friends and family about my campaign, and encourage them to tell their friends and families. Indiegogo has wonderful tools that makes sharing easy, so please go ahead and share.
story_txt:
MY STORY

My name is Aku-Sika Barrett. I was born and raised in Ghana. As a child I had a passion for textile, fashion, and traveling. I always craved uniqueness and individualism. The last of 5 children,  I  tried to set myself apart from my older sisters, by adopting my own unique style.
My career started as a Stenographer Secretary, then I went to American Airlines Academy to pursue a course in Travel and Tourism.  Unfortunately, I had to put my career on hold to accompany my husband on his foreign assignments.  When we relocated to Cairo in 1992,  I had so much time on my hands, until I discovered the art of painting on silk;  I pursued it with a passion, and later opened my own design studio in Jakarta Indonesia and later in Doha Qatar to teach others.  Being able to create my own designs on silk made it easy for me to express my unique sense of style; giving birth to a business idea.
In 2004, when we moved to Portugal, I started my company, producing hand painted silk accessories like scarves and ties.  My dream was to turn my beautiful paintings into Couture garments, and shoes. I realized those dreams when I employed a Couturière and also received my first shoe sample from the manufactures in Spain.    Since then, I have had unique shoes made for me in Italy and in Peru.
My desire to know how to draw and learn about fashion design led me to the prestigious fashion school in Milan (Istituto Marangoni).  
People adored my hand painted silk clothing wherever I went, but when they wanted some, I could only grin and shrug, because I couldn't duplicate.  I always found it difficult parting with the pieces because I got so attached to them.  
I am now ready to launch  a high-end  Ready To Wear collection from my painted silk, so that I can satisfy prospective clients, and start my own Silk Emporium.  I have spent the last couple of years researching digital printing, testing fabrics and the market. I have produced my prototypes, and now, it is time to go into production, but I will need your help.
To succeed, I have to do something different, hence this project.  This campaign therefore, is to raise sufficient funds to produce, launch and market the collection and help sustain the business.   

MY GOAL
I am seeking at least $45,000.  This amount will be used to print the silks for production of garments and accessories, and as the prodution of the clothes will take place in-house, this amount will also guarantee the salaries of at least a tailor and a machinist for 6 months, employ the services of a sales/marketing personnel.  I have worked alone promoting the brand as best as I could.  Now, it is time to employ the services of professionals

PERKS
Your contribution will not be for nothing, no matter how small.  I have some fun and exciting perks, as well as some business opportunities. 


Unique 'Seasons Greeting' card, made from my hand painted silk, and personally mounted.  It's attractive and makes a nice gift as well.
Exclusive Crystal body tattoos made with Swarovski crystals.
the distinguished man's fine accessories like Cummerbunds, ties, and ascots.  These will be hand made in Italy from my new printed silks.  
Limited Edition slim Black Silk Tie embellished with my Crystallized Adinkra® symbol

delightful and elegant large Silk Organza stoles made from my new prints.
I am delighted to offer an autographed copy of my recently published Memoir - "the butterfly that became a kite". I will include an acknowledgement of your contribution in the autograph. 
I will add new perks as I dream them up.
For the retailer, this is your opportunity to stock up and be the first to retail my exclusive and luxurious silks.  You will be listed on my official website as being a retail partner.  Good investment opportunity.


The surprise factor is very exciting, and your contribution will be well worth it.  You will be acknowledged on my Facebook page, and your  name will be listed on my website, unless you want to be anonymous.  Should you wish to be anonymous, then each morning when the sun rises, imagine me giving you a Thank You hug, for without your support, this project will not be successful.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES
I have already contacted other accessories manufacturers in Italy to do the production of the men's accessories and the Organza scarves.  The Fabric printers are waiting for my order.  Even though all the various manufacturers have quick turn around times,  the holiday season might cause slight delays depending on the quantities claimed.  I will endeavor to meet the deadline, and will always keep you updated.
WHAT IF......
.....I am not fortunate enough to meet my goal, I will move to 'Plan C' which is to focus on accessories only.  No matter what I receive, there's always a part of the business that needs funds.  There's always raw silk and dyes to buy.
BUT IF....
On a positive note, if I exceed the amount I seek, it will make a huge impact, as it will enable me put Plan A into action, which is to set up the Atelier in a proper location, employ additional tailors, afford advertising, and embark on the journey that will turn Aku-Sika, the brand, into a "love brand" - 
In conclusion, I hope you feel inspired to contribute generously. (Even though no amount is too small, no amount is too much either)
DON'T WORRY IF YOU CAN'T HELP FINANCIALLY 
If you're unable to contribute financially, you can still help by spreading the word.  Tell your friends and family about my campaign, and encourage them to tell their friends and families. Indiegogo has wonderful tools that makes sharing easy, so please go ahead and share.

story:
OUR DREAM

dreamdateNYC, as a concept, was developed after a number of brainstorming sessions with founders Phillip Seymour and Benjamin Martin.  The idea that teens are, by nature, very romantic and filled with idealistic images of love and life seemed to fit the ideals and images of our own goals for our product…one where they could dream about a real or imagined “lip-gloss” kiss.

                           

dreamdateNYC is a lip-gloss applicator that will appeal to teens…and anyone else who dares to dream!  Its soft, life-like applicator helps tap into the “dream date” that every teen visualizes at some time during their formative years.  As each teen applies the lip-gloss, they can conjure up the date of their dreams—and protect their lips with a high-quality product, as well.

      

WHAT WE NEED

We ask you to join us in establishing this dream by becoming part of our movement as we progress into our next phase.  Our plan is to seek contributions to create the molds and begin manufacturing of this never before seen product.

dreamdateNYC will be the first and only product ever to use soft lips as the actual applicator!  We have been awarded a design patent from the USPTO and have a patent pending for utility.

We are looking to raise $15,000 to go towards the creation of the molds for production.

WHAT YOU GET

All contributors will be kept up-to-date through a blog found our website, www.dreamdatenyc.com, that will note the progress of the campaign.

Our rewards include limited editions of dreamdateNYC, customized lips t-shirts with rhinestones or studs, a photo shoot in New York City with a well-known fashion photographer, invitations to attend our dreamdateNYC Launch Party in New York City, and the opportunity to have a dreamdateNYC lip mold of your very own lips.  You will be free to kiss everyone!

                                                          THE IMPACT

We are very excited that dreamdateNYC will not only provide a unique product to a teen’s daily life, but also provide resources to assist an extended family of teens in need of help.  Here’s how:

Even though we are a cosmetics company, we believe that beauty goes beyond the surface.  Helping teens has always held a special place in our lives.  Therefore, part of our profits will go to THE DOOR, a magnificent organization that provides comprehensive youth development services in a diverse and caring environment.  http://www.door.org/

Additionally, we plan to develop a cosmetic awareness symposium at THE DOOR with a portion of proceeds of dreamdateNYC.

OUR TEAM

We have a team of proven, dedicated professionals behind our campaign.  A product manager with more than 10 years of experience in developing new products for top consumer companies, a business developer, a well respected press agent, artists and photographers.  With your help we will work diligently to assure success for both the company and the teens that will benefit at THE DOOR.

We strongly believe that our team’s experience not only in managing large projects but also in keeping our backers engaged and informed throughout the process, will enable us to bring dreamdateNYC to life.

Thank you for your participation and welcome to the dreamdateNYC community!




Video Produced by Klickpicks.com

story:
LEHEL - Felted wool "Pea Coat" with natural warming and waterproofing properties normal retail price $885 - indiegogo price $490

WESTEND - Japanese nylon waterproof and breathable bomber jacket
normal retail price $615 - indiegogo price $340

SENDLING - Felted wool blaser with natural warming and waterproofing properties
normal retail price $815 - indiegogo price $450

more images of our jackets can be seen on our Gallery


onoo clothing is the answer if you want to protect yourself against wind, rain and stormy weather while on the move in the city during winter and still look modern and smart. It is a collection of mens jackets which are minimalistic, functional and stylish but do not look like outdoor sports jackets.

These jackets are available in autumn 2015 after 3 years of development. We need your support to start our first production series. Join us in implementing our plans.


The new brand "onoo - intelligent urban clothing" incorporates 3 mens jacket styles for delivery in autumn 2015.

The short coat "Lehel" and jacket "Sendling" use natural and technical materials with a tailored fit. Maximum freedom of movement is combined with a wind and water resistant Loden fabric which has a Teflon coating for extra protection. New high quality rubberized buttons in horn optics are novel and compliment the water-repellent zips in leather look. The blouson/bomber jacket "Westend", our sporty jacket version, also has these features. The outer material is however made from a technically advanced waterproof and breathable nylon fabric.

Tailored to the needs of mobile urban people featuring functional features which optimize these Jackets and make them unique garments in form and function.  

The jackets are intelligent because they are designed in a minimalistic urban style suited to the modern man of today but are created to protect you from bad winter conditions without looking like functional outdoor garments, they are suited to wear while riding your bike, scooter or on foot.

The first limited edition collection of our onoo jackets are  "Designed in Germany and hand made in Italy".

What is the project goal and who is the project for?

Our goal is to establish qualitative and appealing fashion with function properties and to establish onoo as a new brand within the next 3-5 years. In addition, the collections will be continuously developed and updated and expanded.

We are targeting mobile city dwellers whether they are on a bike, scooter or in the subway on the way, to the office, a customer meeting or dinner with friends.

Our target group are people from different creative industries, from the management sector, marketing individuals, journalists and writers, entrepreneurs and people like you who are looking for an alternative smart niche product with innovative design features.

Why are we a luxury priced product?

One of our main goals at onoo design is to create a garment that stands up to it's quality expectations and to use traditional fabrics  from local factories in Europe wherever possible.  To achieve this standard of excellence in our product we have to  often pay a high price for the production, which then makes the retail price higher. onoo is a luxury product because it is unique in it's design, it is limited on the market and you can trust our quality seal.
We at onoo decided  to make a product that is "Made in Italy" because we believe in the factory that produces onoo and trust their quality for our luxury brand. We trust the workmanship and fit and the fact that it is not a mass produced product, the quantities are limited and we do not need to travel far to visit them or recieve our goods. We know them personally and are priviledged to work with craftsmen and craftswomen who like our product and because they have worked on our project since the beginning and treat onoo like their own "baby".

Several studies have confirmed over the last few years a new trend in the transport behavior of commuters towards environmentally friendly modes of transport. Current sales figures of design bicycles or e-bikes back this up. With our jackets we meet a need that apparently goes hand in hand with this development.

onoo jackets are for people who are outside in rain and bad weather and commute to their work or meet with friends and need to be protected from the elements with our intelligent urban clothing which is smart but has hidden functional properties.

Wherever we present onoo – and when the jackets are tried on, we get consistently a positive response to the materials used, the modern fit, quality and finish and above all to the underlying idea to offer fashion with functionality. The jury of the  ISPO BRAND NEW AWARD were so convinced with our jackets that they awarded us with the overall prize for the "Best new brand in 2015/2016".

Support onoo when

You are looking for a real alternative to the usual outdoor jackets on the market. onoo is intelligent and stylish but also has funtional properties!
  • When you have the same need for aesthetics and functionality, as we do!
  • You also know how to appreciate a maximum comfort and fit when on your bike, scooter, longboard or in the subway
  • when you like to tell your friends about your new intelligently designed jacket
  • You are one of the first to have one of the very few pieces of a limited new collection.
  • You would like to support a product which is crafted and not mass produced .
  • Want to reduce the amount of motorized traffic in our towns
  • You are happy that onoo is trying something different!

What shall we do with your money?

With the funds recieved we naturally want to get closer to our goal to start producing onoo. This sum represents only a small part but with your support - be it spreading the word or with a pre-order of our products - we can manage to reach the minimum order quantity of this limited edition menswear collection and thus to introduce the onoo brand globally!

  •  -   December 2014 - April 2015  -  Sales start
  •  -  February 2015  -  Sport Fashion fair "ISPO" in Munich
  •  -  March 2015  -  Trend urban bike fair "berlinerfahrradschau" in Berlin
  •  -  June - July 2015 -  Production in Italy
  •  -  August 2015  -  worldwide delivery of our onoo jackets to you and retail


Who are onoo?

Christian, Hassan, Jennifer and Charles represent the brand onoo.

We are all based in Munich in Germany. Hassan and Christian and Jennifer are owners of the design agency Lichtung.Kreation and are passionate graphic designers. Charles runs and works at the fashion design office Coxconcept!

We all work together on creating a strong global urban menswear brand.        

Q: Can I change my jacket size if I have ordered the wrong one?
A: Yes, we shall send you a different size, if you return your jacket in the original
package with the original labels attatched and not worn!.

Q: Which sizes can I order?
A: We will produce the sizes S, M, L and XL. The jackets are slim fit, Italian style, so if you are not sure order a bigger size!, but don't worry we shall contact you by email after the campaign to make sure you get the right size.

Q: Why do EU contributers need to pay VAT
A: As a company registered in the EU we are required by law to charge VAT to EU contributors. However, if you are ordering on behalf of an European company with a valid VAT ID, you don't need to add VAT to your perk. Simply provide us with your VAT ID when we will ask you to do so by mail.

Q: I live in the EU and forgot to add VAT to my payment

A: Don´t worry – you’re not the only one!
Once the campaign has ended, we will contact each contributor about outstanding costs. We will also give you instructions on how to pay.

Q: I forgot to add the shipping costs?
A: Please use the perks button at the right of the video.

The shipping charge to the EU is $25.

The shipping charge to the US and the rest of the world is $45.


          more images of our jackets can be seen on our Gallery

Sendling is apparently the oldest subourb of Munich. It is a lively mix of diversity today and is characterized by a variety of places to relax in. Work and leisure exists side by side and our jacket/blaser is designed to fit into this type of environment.

Sendling is a felted wool blaser with natural warming and waterproofing properties
normal retail price $815 - indiegogo price $450 - 45% discount
•

Westend today has a modern and cool flair, even though it used to be a working-class neighbourhood. This bomber jacket is the sportiest version in the collection, it is modern and versatile like the district itself.

WESTEND is a bomber jacket made of Japanese nylon which is waterproof and breathable.
normal retail price $615 - indiegogo price $340 - 45% discount

•

Similar to the Munich suburb of Lehel, our coat is very smart and luxurious. Made of "Loden wool", a textile technique dating back to the 10th century. The factory which manufactures our onoo fabric, has been producing this fabric for over 200 years.

LEHEL is a felted wool "Pea Coat" with natural warming and waterproofing properties

normal retail price $885 - indiegogo price $490 - 45% discount

•

Take advantage of our festive offer when you order one of our perks(except the shipping costs contributions - this is not a giveaway - you only recieve it if you order one of our perks) . We email you about your colour on delivery in 2015.

    •    free merino wool/polyacrl mix winter beanie christmas present    •     

This offer applies for perk contributions up till the 31st December 2014

•

You pay now $150 and this awards you to a discount of $350 when you order on our website - Offer applies for a direct order or on our website from August 2015

perk price $150

•

we will send you a THANK YOU "Trädischn" postcard with a personal message from the onoo Team! & mention you on our WEBSITE.
perk price $5
•

we would like to invite you with this perk to our end party after crowdfunding is finished. This will take place sometime in February / March 2015

perk price $90

•

we would like to invite you with this perk to a visit to one of Munich's famous beer gardens, and we shall make you a typical brotzeit lunch with a maas beer and meet the onoo guys and gals. This will take place sometime in July 2015

perk price $250

•

Some people just can't contribute, but you can help us in many ways..
  • spread the word about onoo on your social media and any design related blogs
  • use the share link tools from indiegogo and embed this campaign link whenever you can
  • refer our product to your favourite menswear shop and help spread the word
  • are you a commercial company and can offer us corporate advise?. If so please do contact us and offer us your expertise!

story:
Remember when you were a kid? You went to the shoe store to pick out new shoes. You put your foot on that cool metal foot-measurer, you rested your foot on the sales person's knee, they cinched up your laces and then you ran around the store to see how they felt. You wiggled around in front of the mirror and caught a glimpse of yourself in new shoes. Pretty cool. 

Yep, I remember.

Where did all the shoe stores go!?
We're swimming with kids! Why don't we have a dedicated kids shoe store? 

The ones with people who really knew what they were talking about. They knew that "this brand runs big", and "this brand runs wide". They helped you get the right fit and understood that children's feet are growing feet. 

It's important- ya know? Getting the right fit for growing feet! Did you know that the bones in children's feet are still malleable? Family Physician Mark Cucuzzella says, "It’s vital that kid’s shoes allow enough room for natural growth, until the foot bones mature. This doesn’t happen until ages 18-19 for girls and 20-21 for boys."

We will bring back the experience, the knowledge, the brick-and-mortar.
We will bring back the actual shoe store. 

Oh! and how about a play area for siblings?
We're parents too, ya know. Our littlest will happily climb up and jump off of anything she can scale. (*please note little Miss Wiggles, pictured below.) We know why it can be hard to take kids out shopping. One kid runs for the elevator while the other dances with the mannequins. We get it!

We'll have a play area full of enticing things for kids to play with so parents can focus on...well...shoes!

This is our family.

Our kids wear shoes. 

We like cool shoes. We like unique shoes. We like cute shoes. 

We like to buy shoes in local stores.  

We like to support the community.
We think community is what makes the world go 'round.

We like to buy shoes that are made to support our childrens' growing feet.
We like sales people who get kids.
We like sales people who know what they're talking about.

We like children's shoe stores with a great selection. 

These are shoes being offered by the brands we love this season...


               

We love Pediped, Stride Rite, Plae, Tsukihoshi, Keen, See Kai Run, Livie and Luca and even more. All of these brands pay special attention to producing shoes that are good for feet. They have podiatrists on staff that counsel the designers in keeping a roomy toe-box for those growin' toes, appropriate flex in the right places, and all the little details we care about. Kids spend a lot of time in shoes these days. It turns out, if toes get squished, it hinders proper development. Most shoes that come from giant corporate stores (we'll-keep-them-nameless!) are poorly made. They fall apart quickly and have little or no support for our childrens' growing feet. We want to love our kiddos from the ground up. We'll carry sizes 3-Y4.

 ...psst! Love a shoe brand that we haven't thought of yet? Please let us know (and then help us make it happen by shooting us a little donation!) 

TaDaaa! GoldenBug Children's Shoes.

We've got special perks for kids, adults, and community-minded friends.
To select a perk, click on the perk you'd like near the top-right of the campaign page.

Laced up with Love
Big, teary-eyed thank-you's full of love and heartfelt gratitude. 


Hand-drawn GoldenBug coloring "book"

You'll receive an email containing 10 beautiful and unique coloring pages, featuring our "bug" theme. They're hand-drawn especially for us by local artist Morgan True. You're free to print them out and color as many times as you wish. (our daughter has already colored them many times over!) 

  

Wine from Oliver McCrum

2 bottles of Piero Mancini's Vermentino di Gallura, 2014. From the north-east corner of Sardinia this wine has "an aroma of peach, tangerine and herbs with bright acidity". 

OR 1 bottle of Piero Mancini's Vermentino di Gallura, 2014 and 1 bottle of Romano Dogliotti's "La Caudrina", Moscato d'Asti, 2014, with "exuberant Muscat aromas and flavors balanced by bubbles and a hint of citrus".

   

omwines.com

"Surprise Me" Gift Certificates

Oakland's locally-owned Restaurants and Cafes
We're all about supporting our community and are thrilled that so many have offered to support us! We'll blindly pull $50 in gift certificates from a bag for you to enjoy a "surprise" outing or two. Some of the options include: Farley's East, Grand Lake Kitchen, Beauty's Bagel Shop, Nido, A Cote, Tamarindo, Pacific Coast Brewing Co.

                     


25% off Your First Pair

You'll receive a gift certificate for 25% off your first pair of shoes.


Manifesta Salon

Gift certificate to Manifesta Salon + Aveda Soy Candle. This candle burns 50+ hours with the comforting, spicy aroma of certified organic ginger and ginger lily. 

  
manifestaoak.com

Making Oakland (and the world!) a Better Place

A Gift of Literacy
GoldenBug will donate two books to Super Stars Literacy, a local organization that "provides extended learning time intervention services to under-performing K-2nd grade students, helping them develop the literacy and social skills that are the foundation for future learning." 



Donate a pair of NEW Shoes to a Child who Needs Them

GoldenBug will donate a pair of brand new shoes to My New Red Shoes. This amazing local organization helps homeless and low-income children look and feel confident in school by providing them with new clothing and shoes.

Caffe 817

A Year of Coffee
Once a week, for a full year, OR twice a month, for a full year, you get one FREE medium coffee or $2.00 off your hot beverage from Caffe 817. 

By paying for your coffee in advance, you'll be helping GoldenBug Children's Shoes open up!

 

caffe817.com


Maple Street Denim Gift Card

You'll get $100 to spend at the ever fabulous Maple Street Denim.

www.msdoak.com


What? Free Shoes!

Your first pair of shoes is on us. 'Nuff said.


Adopt a Bug 

Let us name one of the many GoldenBugs on our walls after you, your kiddos, or anyone close to your heart. We'll paint the name in and snap a photo for you. Then you can search our walls for your name when you're in the shop.

Goldfinger Bartending Set from Umami Mart

Because sometimes you need to channel your inner James Bond and outsmart those rascals who leave obstacles in your path. (And also it's GOLD!)
The set includes: 1 Gold-Plated Cobbler Shaker; 1 Gold-Plated Jigger (1oz); 2 Coupe Glasses; 1 Queen Elizabeth Swizzle Stick; 2 Gold Circle Cocktail Pins

umamimart.com

More Free Shoes!

2 pairs of shoes, on us! Plus coloring pages created just for us by local artist Morgan True. 

The GoldenBug Necklace

Handcrafted by Kate Ellen, shop owner at Crown Nine Jewelry Boutique 

Solid 14k yellow gold bug pendant on oxidized sterling silver 16" chain.
Retail value $575

    

Kate has designed these sweet GoldenBugs especially for us. They're beautiful! If you'd like to see one in person, head over to Crown Nine to check it out.
www.crown-nine.com

Five for You, Five for Me

Five pairs of shoes, on us! Plus, hand-drawn coloring pages created just for us by local artist Morgan True. 


The Pollinator

This combination package includes a selection of perks listed above. You'll receive: GoldenBug coloring pages, Adopt a Bug, Gift of Literacy, and one free pair of shoes.


 The Master Gardener

This combination package includes many of the perks listed above. You'll receive: GoldenBug coloring pages, Adopt a Bug, Making Oakland a Better place with a Gift of Literacy, Shoe donation with My New Red Shoes, and two free pair of shoes.

Don't think you can contribute right now? You can still help! 
We'd be so grateful if you would:

  • Help us get the word out and make a lot of noise about our campaign.
  • Talk to friends and families with children.
  • Talk to co-workers, school-mates, neighbors, commuters, mommy-groups, neighborhood online groups...
  • Talk about loving the East Bay.
  • Talk about supporting small, independently owned business.
  • Talk about your care for the local economy. 
  • Your chatter = huge difference.
  • AND, please use the IndieGoGo social media share tools at the bottom of this page!

We live in Oakland. We have been small business owners in the historic Old Oakland district for 5 years. Our kids go to school in Oakland.

You might say...our hearts live in Oakland.

We care about our community and want to build something that our community will love. We want to add to Oakland's fabric of quality, independently-owned shops so that we may all have the option to spend our dollars locally.

We want to have fun events!... Storytelling sessions for the kiddos! How about music time? Collaborations with other local businesses like Create Shoppe. Bug-talks with with local entomolgists. Oh, and popcorn parties, definitely popcorn parties.

We want to donate new and used shoes to the children in our communities who need them. We want to work with local organizations like  Super Stars Literacy and  My New Red Shoes that directly impact our local children. 

We want to share all of this with you- will you help us on our way?

We need a boost from our community to kick us in the right direction.


 

No way. Uh-uh. Nope. 
We're raising the bulk of our funding through other avenues. And while we have imaginative, creative, and fun plans for the shop as a whole, the $25,000 we hope to raise with this campaign will be focused on building a great selection of unique, and fun shoes in our inventory. We hope our broad selection will warrant you spending your dollars locally, rather than online. We're looking forward to funding and even over-funding with your support.

 

  • Building out a great kid friendly space, paying local artists to make it beautiful, and creatively furnishing the store. Let's reiterate here- this store will be fun for kids and easy for parents. We're not talking about blinking lights, cheesy loud music and total chaos. We're talking about the kind of place you'd want to shop in. 
  • Hiring people who are great with kids and understand the importance of supporting a child's growing foot. This is really important to us. There are a lot of kids running around in shoes that don't fit properly. Too small, too big, cheaply made. All these scenarios can have lasting effects on children's bodies as they grow. We need to fit kids with good shoes that fit well.
  • Working with local non-profits. How better to grow our community than to support those who are still growing? For starters, we'll be working with Super Stars Literacy and My New Red Shoes in this campaign (see our cool PERKS!) and also in the future. 
  • Boring but important details. There are gazillions of behind-the-scenes details that keep a business successful and running smoothly. POS systems, bookkeeping, insurance, and store maintenance just to name a few.

And if we don't reach our funding goal? 

Yikes. 

We'll get nothing.


Raising funds through an IndieGoGo campaign means it's a community investment. We care about our community and hope you do too. We have strong ties to Oakland and the larger East Bay. Funding this portion of our store means that we will be able to bring the community in for fun events, and support our community through non-profits that we care about. Not to mention that many of our perks will give you a full return on your investment!
Your community effort = our community effort.
We all support each other.
Thank you for being part of the fun!


Our biggest challenge is getting the word out to all the East Bay families who want to buy shoes for their kids! In a real store. With real people. 

Sure, we can advertise and we can use social media. But word of mouth is ALWAYS the best. Will you tell all your friends? And families? And Oakland-lovers? And East Bay pride-ers? 

With any new business there is risk. It's part of the job. The important part is how well we as business owners mitigate that risk. We are already small business owners here in Oakland. And we are thriving. We understand that adjustments are sometimes necessary and so we are flexible. We'll listen to you and adjust as we go so this store becomes tailored to our customers.


We feel utterly grateful to the many people and businesses who have already contributed to GoldenBug Children's Shoes. 

Conor Rechtschaffner, videographer
Christen Soares of Field Paoli, store design
Crown Nine Jewelry Boutique
Umami Mart
Morgan True, artist
Ross Turner, logo design
Holly Corr and Olive McCrum of Oliver McCrum Wines
Farley's East
Grand Lake Kitchen
Nido
A Cote
Beauty's Bagel Shop
Tamarindo
Manifesta Salon
Marion and Rose's Workshop
Maple Street Denim
Chris Hanrahan of Endgame
Jaq Dalziel


And with that we would like to say...
