story:
The annual NUS Industrial Design 2015 show offers a complete overview of works by the Graduating Class, highlighted works by current students of the faculty from the past academic year, as well as latest projects by the Design Incubation Centre (DIC).  

The theme of this year's show is Momentum, and it offers a glimpse into the multifaceted world of design, whereby students take a critical role in investigating relationships between objects, users and environment. The culmination of these observations and investigations result in design outcomes achieved not only by products, but also through systems, services and interactions.

In addition, many of these projects were conducted with industry collaborators such as Ministry of Manpower and National University Hospital. The plethora of works in this year's show echoes the division's vision, to make life better through design.

This year in particular, in sync with the SG50 celebrations, we hope to extend our outreach to the masses through the show, to raise public awareness about the importance of Design, and how relevant it is to our daily lives. It is important that we acknowledge this in order for our Singapore Design Community to grow.

____________________________________________________________________________


In this year’s show, we have categorized our projects according to 3 main groups that we find most relevant to our Singaporean Lifestyle: 

1. Health & Wellness 

The projects that fall under this category mainly consist of projects that address medical issues that we hold close to our hearts such as dementia, diabetes, stress, etc. Collaboration with various centres that deal with such conditions, our students explore the possibilities of improving the lives of patients and their families through design.


2. Culture & Communication
Not all is lost. People say that Singapore is a young nation with pseudo-culture, but we beg to differ. It’s the people that make our country who we are and we’re the makers, the creators. By using culture and craft as a context to design, the projects aim to rethink the contemporary Singapore culture. With projects extending to redesign the traditional Batik process and Kopitiams, as well as those that develop new uses and techniques for existing materials for bag and furniture forms, the possibilities are limitless.


3. Interaction & Technology
Re-evaluating our lifestyle in Singapore, this category of projects serve as a way for us to envision the future. Ranging from progressive toys for children to green lifestyle products and improving communication amongst people, we aim to keep up with the ever-changing times through design, as we progress as a nation.

We hope to extend our outreach to the masses by demonstrating to everyone how they can benefit from design, both as solutions to problems and also as a driver for social and cultural change. Many of our Industrial Design projects have gained global recognition in international competitions and we think that through the NUS Industrial Design Show 2015, we can build a stronger Singapore Design Community. Through this endeavor, we hope to exemplify the Singaporean spirit of not letting our dreams be bound by our size. 


The following are some of the past works by the graduating class: 

+one Prosthetic Fingers 
The functional yet life-like prosthetic finger that is able to fit and support users in the handling of simple daily tasks. This project was featured in The New Paper and got shortlisted as Regional Finalist for the James Dyson Award 2013.


STITX

A sitck-on organizer for your belongings and gadgets necessary for work on-the-go bringing you convenience by sitting snugly at the back of your laptop, reducing the clutter of things on the already-tiny workspaces. This project was featured in ComplexTech, Culturepush and several other online media. The product is also retailing at  Keepers:  Singapore Designer Collective and Uyii. 

SPOT
SPOT is a multi-purpose light that can be hung, hand-held, or simply placed on a surface. It can function as a torch, desk lamp, ambience light, or wall light - use it however and whenever you like. This project won the Launch Pad Asia 2014 competition, and has been featured in Design Milk and Yanko Design.

Future Studio: Self- Deception
"Just a bit more wouldn't hurt...." Self-Deception is a series of objects that postulates possible scenarios of the future. In a world where objects are designed to tolerate our foibles, the series cleverly depicts how Deceit can potentially be the new object design philosophy of 2023.

静(Jing)
静 (Jing) is a set of candles that challenges the traditional definition of candles, without adding or subtracting from its bare components. The blurred outline of the wooden wicks adds a graphical interest to the translucent wax and also alters the way the candles burn. The hypnotic quality of the flames consuming the wax, enthrals the audience with its beauty, however fleeting. Ephemera.

____________________________________________________________________________


With this, we hope that our  passion has sparked your interest and that you'll pledge your support as we work really hard to bring the show to you. The money raised through this campaign will contribute to the set up and execution of our show. 

As a token of our appreciation for your support, we've also included some goodies for each category of contributions. If you have pledged your support for the categories with merchandise, we will contact you upon closure of our campaign. Rest assured that you'll be able to collect them during the duration of the show. 

The prints of the Limited Edition Shirt & Tote Bag Designs are as follows:

 

Please note that the prints are specific to merchandise (i.e., Shirt prints cannot be printed on Tote Bags, choice can only be made from the selection offered). 

 *The whole range of Merchandise will also be available at the event, while stocks last. Merchandise print courtesy of Litile Collective, an entrepreneurial duo from our graduating class. 

____________________________________________________________________________


 It has been a wonderful 4 years at NUSDID, and we've thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Currently we're just a little short of it to make this a reality... But we believe that  with our commitment and dedication to the show, combined with your contributions and support,  the NUS Industrial Design Show 2015 will be a success. We look forward to seeing you at the show!
story_txt:
The annual NUS Industrial Design 2015 show offers a complete overview of works by the Graduating Class, highlighted works by current students of the faculty from the past academic year, as well as latest projects by the Design Incubation Centre (DIC).  The theme of this year's show is Momentum, and it offers a glimpse into the multifaceted world of design, whereby students take a critical role in investigating relationships between objects, users and environment. The culmination of these observations and investigations result in design outcomes achieved not only by products, but also through systems, services and interactions.In addition, many of these projects were conducted with industry collaborators such as Ministry of Manpower and National University Hospital. The plethora of works in this year's show echoes the division's vision, to make life better through design.This year in particular, in sync with the SG50 celebrations, we hope to extend our outreach to the masses through the show, to raise public awareness about the importance of Design, and how relevant it is to our daily lives. It is important that we acknowledge this in order for our Singapore Design Community to grow.____________________________________________________________________________In this year’s show, we have categorized our projects according to 3 main groups that we find most relevant to our Singaporean Lifestyle: 1. Health & Wellness The projects that fall under this category mainly consist of projects that address medical issues that we hold close to our hearts such as dementia, diabetes, stress, etc. Collaboration with various centres that deal with such conditions, our students explore the possibilities of improving the lives of patients and their families through design.2. Culture & CommunicationNot all is lost. People say that Singapore is a young nation with pseudo-culture, but we beg to differ. It’s the people that make our country who we are and we’re the makers, the creators. By using culture and craft as a context to design, the projects aim to rethink the contemporary Singapore culture. With projects extending to redesign the traditional Batik process and Kopitiams, as well as those that develop new uses and techniques for existing materials for bag and furniture forms, the possibilities are limitless.3. Interaction & TechnologyRe-evaluating our lifestyle in Singapore, this category of projects serve as a way for us to envision the future. Ranging from progressive toys for children to green lifestyle products and improving communication amongst people, we aim to keep up with the ever-changing times through design, as we progress as a nation.We hope to extend our outreach to the masses by demonstrating to everyone how they can benefit from design, both as solutions to problems and also as a driver for social and cultural change. Many of our Industrial Design projects have gained global recognition in international competitions and we think that through the NUS Industrial Design Show 2015, we can build a stronger Singapore Design Community. Through this endeavor, we hope to exemplify the Singaporean spirit of not letting our dreams be bound by our size. The following are some of the past works by the graduating class: +one Prosthetic Fingers The functional yet life-like prosthetic finger that is able to fit and support users in the handling of simple daily tasks. This project was featured in The New Paper and got shortlisted as Regional Finalist for the James Dyson Award 2013.
STITXA sitck-on organizer for your belongings and gadgets necessary for work on-the-go bringing you convenience by sitting snugly at the back of your laptop, reducing the clutter of things on the already-tiny workspaces. This project was featured in ComplexTech, Culturepush and several other online media. The product is also retailing at  Keepers:  Singapore Designer Collective and Uyii. SPOTSPOT is a multi-purpose light that can be hung, hand-held, or simply placed on a surface. It can function as a torch, desk lamp, ambience light, or wall light - use it however and whenever you like. This project won the Launch Pad Asia 2014 competition, and has been featured in Design Milk and Yanko Design.Future Studio: Self- Deception"Just a bit more wouldn't hurt...." Self-Deception is a series of objects that postulates possible scenarios of the future. In a world where objects are designed to tolerate our foibles, the series cleverly depicts how Deceit can potentially be the new object design philosophy of 2023.




静(Jing)静 (Jing) is a set of candles that challenges the traditional definition of candles, without adding or subtracting from its bare components. The blurred outline of the wooden wicks adds a graphical interest to the translucent wax and also alters the way the candles burn. The hypnotic quality of the flames consuming the wax, enthrals the audience with its beauty, however fleeting. Ephemera.
____________________________________________________________________________


With this, we hope that our  passion has sparked your interest and that you'll pledge your support as we work really hard to bring the show to you. The money raised through this campaign will contribute to the set up and execution of our show. 
As a token of our appreciation for your support, we've also included some goodies for each category of contributions. If you have pledged your support for the categories with merchandise, we will contact you upon closure of our campaign. Rest assured that you'll be able to collect them during the duration of the show. 


The prints of the Limited Edition Shirt & Tote Bag Designs are as follows:
 

Please note that the prints are specific to merchandise (i.e., Shirt prints cannot be printed on Tote Bags, choice can only be made from the selection offered). 
 *The whole range of Merchandise will also be available at the event, while stocks last. Merchandise print courtesy of Litile Collective, an entrepreneurial duo from our graduating class. 
____________________________________________________________________________

 It has been a wonderful 4 years at NUSDID, and we've thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Currently we're just a little short of it to make this a reality... But we believe that  with our commitment and dedication to the show, combined with your contributions and support,  the NUS Industrial Design Show 2015 will be a success. We look forward to seeing you at the show!

story:
EASZZZ Product Review Video

 

 

EASZZZ eye caring LED night lamp, is a clean modern aesthetic design which is perfect suitable to your home. Let Easzzz light up your room. Don’t forget to have Easzzz to set the mood for a romantic night. Never worry about fumbling in the dark again. Wake up in the night, turn it on and Easzzz will light the way. Gentle, helpful lighting when you need it the most. EASZZZ is your ever-ready nighttime companion.

Review Video

The innovative flip sensor makes it unique and easiest night lamp,as well as  the handheld size lightweight and eco-friendly design make it a ideal companion to you.

The lovely night light can bring an enjoyable relaxing bed time experience.

First Batch Shipped on November 30th

Second Batch Shipped on December 10th

EASZZZ is constructed with high quality, durable, BPA-free soft silicone  materials, no harmful substances contained and not easy to break, making EASZZZ cuddly bundles of illumination. The Soft silicone lamp cover without complex buttons can give you a skin like comfortable hand feeling. The hidden touch sensor can be 100% safe for your baby to play and soft warm white light doesn't hurt the eyes.

EASZZZ is designed easy to use and safe to control, just press and hold on the lamp cover to achieve brightness as your desire.

Easy & Fun Touch Control

Stepless Dimming 

Innovative Flip Design

Tap to Turn Off

Simply touch the top of EASZZZ to change between lighting modes. Soft warm light is ideal for bed-side and atmosphere setting,while full power cool light is bright and can be used as many tasks.

The handheld size lightweight and eco-friendly design make it a ideal companion to you.

EASZZZ features concise and streamline design. The built-in 1000 mAh battery frees you from the outlet, can ensure you long time  continuous use. EASZZZ will automatically power off if there is no operation for 5 hours to avoid power consumption. Conveniently recharge with the USB-C cable.

 


For US fulfillment, rewards will first be sea freight from our Asia manufacturing facility to California warehouse and thereafter be shipped to US addresses via insured USPS Priority Mail or FedEx Ground. US based backers are expected to receive rewards within a week from shipping from California warehouse. For Rest of the World fulfillment, rewards will be air freight directly from our distribution center in Shenzhen, China. Backers are also expected to receive rewards between 7-20 days from shipping.

EASZZZ has gone into production.

 

EASZZZ was designed by Luck, an experienced designer from a Red Dot award-winning team, and a first time daddy. Luke often got awaken by his baby in the middle of the night. However, getting up from their cozy spot to baby was not the main concern. What frustrated him the most is that moment of flash blindness he got when turning on the bright lights in the room. For this, Luke came up with an idea to design a product that would help him and hopefully others in the future.

He wanted to create a night lamp that was different from the ones in the market, hence after many designing and prototyping process, EASZZZ night lamp was created. EASZZZ night lamp is made from a soft silicone material which mimics the touch of human skin. The smooth button-less design allows EASZZZ to balance on both its top and bottom like a roly-poly toy. The dimensions has also been tested multiple times to ensure it fits in your hand perfectly and still be able to provide the perfect amount of light needed.

An action we are all familiar with, flipping over your phone for light in the middle of the night. Luke incorporated this motion into the operation of EASZZZ so instead of flipping over your phone, you can flip EASZZZ over when you need a little light in the middle of the night.

story:
Hi there!  I'm Alissa Juvan, and I'm an actor and writer hailing from Vermont and now based in Los Angeles by way of the UK.  I've been writing and acting since I was about 5 years' old, with my first story titled "Annie and ET" after my two favorite movies at the time.  Since then, I've written many short films, stories, sketches and a novel, and "Kiddie Litter" lent itself perfectly to the webseries format.  Last year, I wrote and starred in a short parody of "Taken" which involved me rescuing my roommate's cat from evil catnappers.  Yes, I was the Liam Neeson character, and yes, I did THAT monologue.  I'm currently submitting that short to festivals. 

"Kiddie Litter" is a project that I am SO excited about.  As a woman who is ever-so-swiftly running out of time on my own biological clock, thinking about being parent is an exciting and scary thing.  I mean, who really knows how to raise a child?  So, one day while watching my cat, I was thinking how easy it would be if children were more like cats:  self-sufficient, independent and fuzzy (just kidding!).  And "Kiddie Litter" was born.

"Kiddie Litter" is funny.  It's about cats.  And lesbians.  And their cats...all on the internet.  And a boy who acts like a cat but is still very much human and so very confused.  It's a humourous and irreverent look at contemporary parenting and our innate need to raise our children differently to how our parents raised us.

By supporting this project, you will make the first season of "Kiddie Litter" happen, and you'll make a number of men, women and children very happy. We're all excited about this project, and we can't wait to get started!  But we need your help to make it a reality.  
 

                                                       Alissa Juvan is "Beth"                                      Barbara Kerford is "Joan"   


What you give makes this come to life...

We have an amazing cast and crew lined up, and we want to share this project with the world!  Cast and crew have either agreed to work for deferred pay or a very reduced rate, but as we value people's time, energy and talent, we want to be able to pay everyone something for being involved.  


                                           

Kate Volpe is "Principal Sullivan"                Natisha Anderson is "Ms. Goodrich"


The Budget

We are asking for $7700 to cover the full costs of production, post production, Indiegogo fees and reward fulfillment, and all that money is accounted for.  We are planning a three day shoot.

Production:  

Crew:  $1800 (Director, Cinematographer, 1st Assistant Director, Camera Assistant, Sound, PA, Set Teacher/Advocate, Makeup)

Cast:   $1400 (5 adult actors and 2 child actors)

Locations, Insurance and Permits:  $1200 

Craft Services:  $500

Post-Production and Reward Fulfillment

Editing/Sound Mixing/Music:  $2000 

Indiegogo Fee and Rewards:  $800 (4%-9% to Indiegogo, depending on what we raise, plus additional for reward fulfillment)

This is the budget we're aiming for so we are able to pay everyone a day rate that is around minimum wage, which I think is only fair to be able to offer.  We have chosen the flexible funding option so we can keep whatever we raise, and we will forge ahead with production with whatever we raise.  If we exceed our budget, hooray!  That's great news!  We would firstly build any additional funding into post-production so we can make the absolute highest quality product.  Anything over that, we might even be able to pay people at their professional day rates.  If we don't meet our budget, we will carry on with production, but cast would only receive deferred pay and we would have to cut back on post-production.

So, we really do need your help to make this the absolute best it can be.

     

                                      

             Trevor Davis is "Joe"                                     Jessica Gardner is "Betsy"

Cat that got the cream...the Perks

What do you get in return?  We have some nifty perks, if I do say so myself. You can watch a (long-ish) video of Barbara Kerford and I talking through each perk, if you're interested:  hey, you can tell we're enjoying ourselves!  Or, you can look to the right and read through our wide array of perks.  Most of the rewards are digital so we can keep the reward fulfillment costs lower, but that doesn't make them any less cool.  You also have choices at the $50, $100 and $150 levels, and of course, unless it's a limited perk, all lower-cost perks are included in higher-cost perks.  

That means, if you choose one of my personal favorites, the "What's New, Pussycat?" perk at the $100 level, in addition to the personalized song we will improvise just for you, you'll get a thank you in social media, a thank you in the credits, exclusive behind-the-scenes footage,  either a digital download of the cast photo or the ability to see the episodes before they officially air each week.  So much good stuff!

One of my other favorites is the "That Darn Cat" perk where you can send us videos of your cat to include in the official opening credits of "Kiddie Litter." So, not only are you helping us create this project, your cat even gets to be a part of it.  Win-Win-Win!

                                       \

           Jamie McRae is "Annie"                                       Logan Kishi is "Matty"

Thank You!

This is the first time I've tried to crowdfund for a project.  Usually, I put whatever little money I can scrape together towards my projects and ask everyone for favors.  I always do feed people, though.  That's non-negotiable.  Oh, and provide good coffee.  I will take my little Mokapot to set if I have to to make sure that people are properly caffeinated.  I've worked for non-profits and founded groups where we take on big projects with very little money and create amazing results.  I am confident that we have an amazing project on our hands; we just need a bit of money to do it.  This is the first project I've created that I want to build a community around because I'm confident there is an audience who would want to see this project come to life.  It's a project that, if I was looking on Indiegogo, I would be like, what the hell?  A couple who raises their son like a cat?  I'm so IN!


Spread the Word!

We know that there are loads of worthwhile projects out there and that we can't always donate to projects that we want to.  If you can't donate but you like the idea, please spread the word.  Share this Indiegogo page, Tweet it, Facebook it, Instagram it, help us get to make this project come to life!  


And a final P.S.  "Who's that cat?"  If you were wondering who that handsome cat was in the video montage at the beginning of our crowdfunding video, that is my baby, Hamish, who is now 12 years' young.

story:
What is SPOON Magazine?

SPOON™ is a fine-Art and fashion photography magazine originally created in 1996, first on the Internet and then printed for the first time the same year. After 7 issues, We left the company when the commercial protocol started to conflict with our creative goals... We recently owned back the SPOON magazine trademark and right away, the new first edition was born in early 2014.

SPOON New edition | 02

The upcoming issue will be kept completely ad-free, because we feel this is the best way to keep our publication really independent and therefore give full freedom to our contributors.

Please, check out this fantastic line-up of artists curated from around the world for the 02 edition:

Lars Botten, Thomas Brun, Yolanda Darda, Bruno Fournier, Patrice Fuma Courtis, Emmanuel Gimeno, Steve Hiett, Hugh Holland, Gleb Kosorukov, Andrew Lyman, Franey Miller, Michel Momy, Stephen Rose, Alex Ross Perry, Alice Schillaci, Slava Tsukerman, Nigel Van Wieck

Or visit our site for previous contents

Pre-order and Support

Making a magazine is always an act of love and dependance upon of the support of others. Our aim with SPOON magazine is to make something you will want to own and keep, a collector's item you'll cherish.
However, we're not just appealing to your charitable side, but to your self-interest, too. By contributing to this campaign, you're supporting the printing of SPOON by pre-ordering your copy at a reduced price.

  12 Euros ensures you'll be one of the first people to hold SPOON in your hands, shipping costs included. (The magazine will cost 12 euros in shops, plus shipping costs when ordered online.)
  25 Euros will get you a copy of SPOON plus one copy of SPOON | 01 shipping costs included.
Make sure to check all our other perks, that will allow you to get fantastic offers like the ones below.

€150 SPOON 02 + 1 Oversized low-fi B&W poster

€70 SPOON 02 + 2spoons T-shirt

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks or challenges involved, we've done this before (quite a lot of times actually). With your help, we will do it again.

We'll make sure we go into production as soon as possible. However, if deadlines are not met, we will still produce the magazine, and some perks will be shipped later than expected.

What is the money for ?

Printing and shipping only. All contributors are graciously joining forces to maintain the brand new SPOON vector alive!

Depending on the amount of money collected we will raise the number of copies. If we reach 100% of our goal, we will also be able to chose a paper that will increase dramatically the printing result for our contributors and readers pleasure.

Got questions ?

You want to distribute, collaborate, have decent proposals : feel free to Contact Us

Other Ways You Can Help:

Spread the word: Share this campaign on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and Tumblr. Tag your support using the hashtag #SpoonMagazine

Again, thank you very much

Karine Chane Yin + Patrice Fuma Courtis
Founders of SPOON™ Magazine

Pre-order and Support



Making a magazine is always an act of love and dependance upon of the support of others. Our aim with SPOON magazine is to make something you will want to own and keep, a collector's item you'll cherish.However, we're not just appealing to your charitable side, but to your self-interest, too. By contributing to this campaign, you're supporting the printing of SPOON by pre-ordering your copy at a reduced price.   12 Euros ensures you'll be one of the first people to hold SPOON in your hands, shipping costs included. (The magazine will cost 12 euros in shops, plus shipping costs when ordered online.)   25 Euros will get you a copy of SPOON plus one copy of SPOON | 01 shipping costs included. Make sure to check all our other perks, that will allow you to get fantastic offers like the ones below.
€150 SPOON 02 + 1 Oversized low-fi B&W poster
€70 SPOON 02 + 2spoons T-shirt


Risks & Challenges

 There are no risks or challenges involved, we've done this before (quite a lot of times actually). With your help, we will do it again.
We'll make sure we go into production as soon as possible. 
However, if deadlines are not met, we will still produce the magazine, 
and some perks will be shipped later than expected.




What is the money for ?
Printing and shipping only. All contributors are graciously joining forces to maintain the brand new SPOON vector alive!Depending on the amount of money collected we will raise the number of copies. If we reach 100% of our goal, we will also be able to chose a paper that will increase dramatically the printing result for our contributors and readers pleasure.
Got questions ?
You want to distribute, collaborate, have decent proposals : feel free to Contact Us
Other Ways You Can Help:
Spread the word: Share this campaign on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and Tumblr. 
Tag your support using the hashtag #SpoonMagazine

Again, thank you very much
Karine Chane Yin + Patrice Fuma CourtisFounders of SPOON™ Magazine

story:
During Spring this year, some group members were in a car accident during a return trip to our Youth With A Mission (YWAM) missons base here in Skien, Norway. Everyone was alright besides a few with minor injuries, but the van they were in was lost to the wreck.


With an expanding and ever-active team of staff and students, we're now needing a new van to replace the one we lost, as we continue our missions work. Also, we want to provide safety for everyone in its replacement, with anti-lock brakes and airbags.


Come take part with us and add a tire, add a door, add a windshield! Watch the pieces of our Hiace come together as we reach toward the goal! With every donation we'll update the main image to show the parts we've gotten according to the progress bar. So enter whatever amount you'd like to donate, and it will contribute to the pieces!

With every donation we'll update the main image to show the parts we've gotten according to the progress bar. So enter whatever amount you'd like to donate, and it will contribute to the pieces!

story:
Who the hell are these kids? And isn’t LCB what you take at a club to make you dance better?

 Who we are: 21 year old Lucy Lott grew up in a small town in western New York while 23 year old Brett Seamans, the son of a Navy Seabee, traveled all over the east coast growing up. We met at the Rochester Institute of Technology while studying photography. We started a small collaborative project, LCB, which developed into a full partnership. We have been working together for over a year and a half shooting fashion/editorial work and found out that we are stronger as a team than we ever could be apart. We botg live and breathe photography and it is our only true passion. For us, it’s not just a career, but a lifestyle. 

 

LCB started out just as a name under which the two of us could gather our collaborative photography efforts. We always loved cinematography and Lucy has always been inspired by design and fine arts. As we worked day in and day out together, we started to incorporate each other’s strengths into our creations. We realized that our interests in other areas could be integrated into our work, making it more unique and setting us apart from other photographers.  Now, we are doing more with video, but we’ve also started to introduce 2D and 3D elements into both our still and moving images. These concepts are pushing us beyond our photographic work and taking us to a whole new level by allowing us to offer an in-house approach to clients.  In turn, this makes us more competitive and helps produce a stronger overall product. 

Why do these kids want my money?

This campaign isn’t to “Get us to NYC for a week” or “Help us make a video once and you’ll never hear from us again”. Much like our work, this campaign is a hybrid. We need to be in NYC in order to live up to our capabilities and standard by producing high quality work. We do not want to accept “almost good enough.”  New York City is the center of fashion industry and we need be immersed in its constantly changing world to fully experience the shifts and to keep up with the trends – as well as set some of our own!  We will never stop learning and improving our skills.  We will consistently produce new and groundbreaking work until we are no longer able….or until 2012…damn Mayans. 

And why NYC – do these kids love bagels that much?

NYC is where we need to be to take our work and our business to the next level. The city is home to some of the top agencies, models, stylists, designers, magazines, studios, locations and more. Being isolated in a smaller city puts limitations on our work because we are lacking the resources and key components that are crucial in maintaining cutting edge and innovative creations. Relocating to New York will provide us the opportunity to work with high-end agencies and creative teams, thereby enhancing the quality of our work. We will also be able to build relationships and start accumulating a clientele. 

 

Where’s my money going?

While we have worked hard to save money here in Rochester, it requires significant resources to make a solid go in NYC.  The equipment that we need to purchase in order to do our work is extremely costly, but also a necessity.  We need new lenses, computers (as ours cannot handle or keep up with the video or 3D work we are producing) and some studio equipment. We require video equipment including; audio gear, rigs, a new camera and lighting kit. Additionally, some of the funds will go toward promotion, marketing, advertising and a portfolio book to send to agencies and potential clients. Lastly, your funds would go towards what we need to cover the cost of shoots such as; studio rental fees, set design and materials and any other production fees.

We are full of creativity and passion and we may never again get the chance to pursue our dream with such youth and integrity. By contributing to this project, you are helping us achieve our lifelong dream of fashion photography in the most exciting city on the planet!

 Questions?

If you have any questions about us, questions we may not have covered yet, or have a way to help us out in other ways please feel free to e-mail us at questions@lcbstudios.com! 

Thank you for all of your support! Hopefully you’re just as excited as we are as we embark on this adventure! Any amount you can contribute will make a difference and help us get that much closer to our dream. Please spread the word and help us connect with more amazing people like you!

story:
About the campaign…

Rosario is a New York-based womenswear brand founded by Aristotle Rosario.  Aristotle was born and raised in the Dominican Republic and moved to New York in 1998 to complete his design training at Parsons The New School of Design after studying for two years at Altos de Chavón in the Dominican Republic.

His debut, 2013 pre-fall collection was inspired by Martha Graham’s Cave of the Heart and features impeccably constructed day-to-evening pieces, utilizing the techniques of men’s tailoring while incorporating feminine details for an effortless and timeless wardrobe.

The initial line is almost complete and we’ll soon begin publicizing and selling the new collection, which is why we need your support.

 

What we need…

Because we’ve invested all of our initial capital into purchasing luxurious fabrics and working with the best sample makers in New York City, we’re looking to raise $8,000 in order to further publicize and build the Rosario brand.

Your donation will afford us the ability to produce the 2013 pre-fall look book (a critical marketing component), which includes hiring a model, lighting technician and make-up/hair professional; hire a publicist and marketing consultant to build our brand, website and media relations; as well as develop and print marketing and investor materials, including digital and print copies of the look book, publicity videos, press kits and website development.

 

What your contribution means to us…

We know times are tough and we will be forever grateful for any support you can provide us. It’s been our dream to build a collection of the highest quality that is chic while still being accessible. We are so close to realizing this amazing dream, and with your help we’ll be able to ensure that Rosario becomes the internationally renowned brand that we know it can be.

And don’t worry if you can’t contribute financially, sharing this on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or whatever other social media platform is in vogue today is a major help! Thanks in advance for your support and please follow us on Twitter @RosarioNewYork or visit our website http://www.AristotleRosario.com to stay up to date on all our happenings!

story:
Summary

This is a campaign to get Drew on his favorite shirt company's clothing. In order for the company to make this possible they needed a minimum order of 100 shirts. This campaign will be run by Hunter Carroll & Jay Bubbel. 

Any questions or concerns can be addressed by contacting us at: shirt4drew@yahoo.com

What We Need & What You Get

If you want a shirt please select from the "Perk" list. If you would like to just donate to help reach the goal please click the "Back It" button.

All shirts(with a custom design of Drew) will be $28.00 each. This price includes the shirt and transaction fees. Additional shipping will be added to orders outside of the Tehachapi area. 

Various quantities and shipping requirements will be available in the "Perk" section of the page. If more than listed quantities are needed, please separate contributions.  

After Contributing 

Once the goal has been met we will place the shirt order with Johnny Cupcakes and provide updates with expected delivery dates. We will also be contacting contributors by email to confirm shirt sizes. 
Any questions or concerns can be addressed by contacting us at: shirt4drew@yahoo.com

story:
Introducing the EVOLUTION BRA. The world's most comfortable, versatile and technologically advanced bra. 

The Evolution Bra is back and it is better than ever! With over 70,000 bras shipped to-date we are thrilled to be back in stock. These are going to sell out fast and so we are limiting the number of perks available. Place your order and keep an eye out for our survey email. We ship Indiegogo orders weekly. 

Available Colors:

Leah is a 34D and wears our size 4

Sarah is a 38D and wears our size 5

Kris is a 34B and wears our size 2

Our Story

We’ve reinvented the bra, and designed it with the active woman in mind. With eight wearable options in one, the evolution bra was designed to adapt to the rigors of your busiest days, seamlessly transitioning between work, play, and whatever else you’re up to. Using the latest in performance fabric technology and patented bonded construction that moulds to your unique shape, we have created the most comfortable bra that you will love to wear. The only problem? You might never want to take it off.

 

We wear tested the bra on over 200 women of all different ages and cup sizes to create the sizing chart below. We are also happy to provide online fit consultations to make sure you pick your perfect size. The evolution bra's patented design moulds to your unique shape making it better, wear after wear. To see the bra on women of all different sizes click here. 

(1 inch = A, 2 inch = B, 3 inch = C, 4 inch = D, 5 inch = DD, 6 inch = DDD/E)

Our Story: 

Knix Wear is an active intimates brand born from listening - to what women want, what they like and what they need - and that women everywhere were being underserved by their underwear. We wanted to create an intimate apparel brand that was designed by women for women.

 For us, the difference is in the details, that’s why we’ve scoured the globe to find the best possible fabrics and finishes, had hundreds of women wear test our products to get the fit just right and spent two years developing our proprietary technology.

Our Mission: 

Knix Wear merges performance, technology and design to knix the bad and make the good better. We are driven by the belief that active can be attractive, comfortable can be cute, and functional can be fashionable. Our mission is simple: to create the best active intimates on the planet that empowers you to do more of what you love.

 

 

Testing:

At this point we have shipped over 70,000 bras to women from all over the world. In April we paused production on the product to make a few small modifications that would improve the reversibility of the bra as well as to make changes to our size 1 (making the cup smaller) and size 3 (making the band bigger).

We began shipping in January and our bras have been put through rigours of daily life from women all over the world.  From yoga, pilates, hiking, treking, cycling, riding, surfing, swimming, sleeping and working this bra has been up to the task - keeping you fresh, dry, comfortable and confident. Every bra worn has led to product we present you with today that we feel confident you will love. 

 

 

Underwear:

We offer our award winning performance underwear online at www.knixwear.com, available in a variety of colours, fabrics and sizes (XS-2XL) and with your choice of gusset technology (leak proof or moisture wicking). To help prevent stock outs we are not selling underwear as part of this campaign. 

Special thanks:

Maderas Village and the amazing women that work there for hosting our photoshoot and to @loosecannon @nikkodetranquilli @nikkibrand and @reallykindofamazing for the photos

The 200+ women that leant us their time, feedback and their busts to help create this bra - we cannot thank you enough!

Attest Media for the video production 

 

Risks and challenges

Running out of stock:

Our biggest risk for this campaign is running out of stock which leads to unhappy customers and us letting you down. We don't want this to happen. We are only taking orders again because we have product shipments arriving every month. We are also limiting the number of perks of available to ensure that every person that orders, gets their shipment ASAP. 

Selecting your size/color:

Once you have selected and paid for your perk, you will receive a survey link from us that will allow you to make your final selections around size, color and confirm shipping information. Please respond to this survey as it is the only way we know what to send you. Surveys will be sent every Wednesday. 

Sizing:
The other biggest potential challenge comes down to sizing and ensuring our customers select the right size. Having shipped over 70,000 bras, we have seen that over 90% of the time the size is right, and about 10% of the time we need to process an exchange. If you are unhappy with your purchase for any reason, we want to make it right. Simply let us know what happened and we will happily exchange the bra for a different size, free of charge.

The truth about the bra is that it gets better with wear and moulds to your body. If you are unsure about sizing please contact us at indiegogo@knixwear.com include your two measurements and the bra size you typically wear along with the brand and we will be happy to help. 

Exchanges:

We really want you to be happy, and that includes getting you in the right size. We are working on getting you as much information as possible before you place your order.

In the case that we get the size wrong you will have 30 days to initiate an exchange. We will provide you with a prepaid shipping label so you can return your unworn bra (with the tags still on - and in its original packaging) and we will issue you a gift card that you can use to select an alternate size from our website. Exchanges are only offered for customers in the USA and Canada. 

Contact information:

If you want to get in touch with us please send us an email at: indiegogo@knixwear.com or call us at 1-866-696-4449

story:
Meet immi

We’re creating the first battery powered watch with inbuilt technology that allows you to track your menstrual cycle. It’s a simple, convenient, and stylish way to connect with your cycle, without being connected to an app. 

 

 

 

Knowing the time of day, and the time of the month

There are menstrual trackers on the market where you can track your cycle by inputting data into an app on your smartphone or smartwatch. What sets immi apart is that our watch is battery powered and it's not linked to an app or a smart device. This means that this first-of-its-kind watch:

  • Is independent from an app or a smart device
  • Isn’t bulky like a wearable, as it doesn’t house complicated tech in the device
  • Is discrete and stylish 
  • Doesn’t rely on the wearer to update an app regularly
  • Is socially conscious and helps women in low resource communities who cannot afford a smart device

 

 

 

More knowledge, more control

 

"Owning a watch is both a responsibility and a tool for girls living in extreme poverty. Since there are no clocks or calendars at home or at school, girls with watches can plan and be on time. An immi watch will provide critical information to track her menstrual cycle too, and empower her." 

 

The Girls Foundation of Tanzania, 2019

 

Young women in low-resource communities have few, if any, opportunities to track their menstrual cycle. It's important to track your menstrual cycle so you know when you're due on your period, when you're in your most fertile window, and to learn about your behaviours and moods during the different stages. 

It is estimated that millions of school-aged girls are forced to stay at home each month around the time they’re menstruating. This is because they don’t know exactly when their period will start and they can’t afford sanitary products so don’t want to bleed at school. As well as this, schools often lack adequate sanitation facilities so managing your period and attending class becomes a huge challenge.

To address this challenge, immi is filling the gap by creating a battery powered watch which allows users to track each day of their cycle and pairing this with sanitary products. 

  • In India, 23M girls drop out of school annually when they start menstruating
  • In Bangladesh, 41% of girls miss school every month because of menstruation
  • In the UK, over 100,000 girls miss school during their period

 

Our watch allows you to see vital information so you know when you are in your most fertile window, and when you are due on your next period. We are partnering with non-profit organisations who provide in-person female health education and menstrual hygiene to girls. By providing their beneficiaries with the watch as well, we can empower young women to track their cycle, be prepared and stay in school. 

     

     We're making period tracking fashionable, convenient,

    and accessible to anyone, anywhere. 

     

    See more on our website 

     

     

    A chance for change

     

    We have partnered with six (and counting!) non-profit organisations globally. When you ‘Buy a watch for her’, it will go straight to one of their beneficiaries. 

     

    Our partner organisations based in Hong Kong, the Philippines, Vietnam, Ghana, Tanzania and Colombia (and a 7th in the UK!), focus on menstrual health and hygiene. By pairing the watch with sanitary products and in-person education, we can measure the impact this has on school attendance, knowledge about their own bodies, control during different parts of their cycle, and reduced stigma and shame around menstruation. 

    We have three more non-profits based in Turkey, Nigeria and Bangladesh, who are queuing up to be on board for our pilot. If we exceed our target, we will have the ability to work with all of them, too!

    Thank you, in advance, we appreciate your support so much. If you're stuck for a Christmas gift and don't want to buy more 'stuff', then this may be the perfect present to buy on behalf of your family and friends!

    Find out more about our pilot partners through our website

     

    “Girls in my community are most often caught unawares when its that time of the month. Most of them even get pregnant before their next menses. This shouldn’t happen. A menstrual watch will help prevent them being caught unawares and also give them a sense of pride. Its really cool to wear a watch to school at their age.”

    - Evelyn Yeboah, Founder AWAT, Ghana

     

    The Perks

    You can donate however much you want, whether that's £5 or £500, and we've created a bunch of perks to say thank you for your donation. Check them out!

     

     

    Getting yours

     

    When we officially launch our commercial sales, a minimum of 10% from each sale will go towards our social impact activities

     

    We will begin commercial sales in 2020, where we will have a range of designs available for you to buy, including the digital (biodegradable) plastic version, and the stainless-steel analogue watch with leather straps. Grab a perk and get up to 50% off your first purchase!

    With the money from each commercial sale, we’ll be able to recruit more non-profit partners and provide them with the watch. You can feel confident that your purchase is helping to educate women globally and keep millions of girls in school. By embedding social impact into our business from the start, we're setting ourselves up for long-term sustainability.

    We plan to include a smart watch range in the future, but for the first year we’re focused on watches that don’t require connectivity. Whether you have a smart phone or not, our battery watch provides unparalleled affordability and convenience for those wanting to track their cycle.

     

     

     

    Our Progress

    So far, we've created Version 1 of our prototype (a big watch!) and tested the functionalities. Now we're making Version 2 (a normal sized watch…!) and doing some final tests before we go into production. By doing these first stages in-house, we are hugely saving on costs and are able to easily make the final necessary changes to the functionalities. 

    We've chosen some designs, but we're still working to make them slimmer, and add some finishing touches.

     

    Biodegradable Plastic digital version more suitable for humid climates:

     

     

    Our Story

     

    "I was on the plane listening to Madonna ‘Like a Prayer’ (obvs) when I realised that my cycle is just another measurement of time"

     

    I'm Sarah Cottee and I’m the founder and CEO of immi. I spent 6 years working in the Philanthropic sector in South East Asia. During this time, over and over again I saw the issue of women not knowing about their menstrual cycle. I kept thinking about a way to solve this, not only for these women, but for myself too. I don’t like to use many connected devices or be on my smart phone the whole time.

    We needed an alternative solution that allowed you to track your cycle yourself. A way that didn’t require electricity or internet access. I was on the plane listening to Madonna ‘Like a Prayer’ (obvs) when I realised that my cycle is just another measurement of time…could we integrate this functionality into a battery powered watch? Madonna’s voice really did take me there.

    The first 'tech-y' person I spoke to about this gave me some great advice, he told me, 'don't talk tech to a tech person', then proceeded to introduce me to the those I needed to speak to in order to make this happen. There's a multitude of people to thank for helping me get to this stage, most notably, Tania Wu - engineer extraordinaire. Melanie Hughes, Aimee Cheung and Anusha Sugunasabesan have also done insane amounts of work to make immi come to life. Everyone who has listened to me talk about periods for way too long is also a total legend. Thank you. And to my mum, of course. 

    We can rewind just a little bit further… The reason I knew more than just the basics about menstruation is because of my Grandma, Rosaleen Immelda (immi) Clearkin. Gaggs, as we called her, moved over to Liverpool, England, from Ireland at the age of 18 to train as a midwife. She was one of 12 children, and the only girl in her family who was allowed to continue her education past the age of 14. Later on in her career, in-between raising 5 children and working full time, she engaged in pioneering research at The University of Birmingham, finding out more about how to track menstruation and measure fertility. My mum and her sisters were guinea pigs in the research, with Gaggs taking their temperature and asking them about their cycle each day (great morning chats..!). She died just before I came up with this idea, so I asked my mum to download all of her knowledge to me, and that's how we got here. She’s been a constant source of inspiration driving this, and I miss her.

    Jessica (my older sister), Sarah (me) and Gaggs. Maybe this explains the risk taking behaviour, Gaggs was balancing me on top of ladders before I could walk..!

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Support your local organisations who are focused on menstrual health and hygiene.
    • Open the conversation with your friends (men included!) – it’s easy to ignore the things closest to us. By normalising it with those around you, you can feel more comfortable to normalise it when you're out in the world.
    • Talk to your younger brothers, sisters, cousins, friends’ sons and daughters about periods – education starts at home.
    • Sign up to our newsletter via our website to stay up to date with what we’re doing.

    Please pass this on to your friends and family. Thank you!

     

    Our Supporters

    We have SO many individuals behind the scenes who are supporting us and helping to make this happen, and some amazing networks and companies too. Thank you all so so much.
story_txt:
Meet immiWe’re creating the first battery powered watch with inbuilt technology that allows you to track your menstrual cycle. It’s a simple, convenient, and stylish way to connect with your cycle, without being connected to an app.    Knowing the time of day, and the time of the monthThere are menstrual trackers on the market where you can track your cycle by inputting data into an app on your smartphone or smartwatch. What sets immi apart is that our watch is battery powered and it's not linked to an app or a smart device. This means that this first-of-its-kind watch:
Is independent from an app or a smart device
Isn’t bulky like a wearable, as it doesn’t house complicated tech in the device
Is discrete and stylish 
Doesn’t rely on the wearer to update an app regularly
Is socially conscious and helps women in low resource communities who cannot afford a smart device
   More knowledge, more control "Owning a watch is both a responsibility and a tool for girls living in extreme poverty. Since there are no clocks or calendars at home or at school, girls with watches can plan and be on time. An immi watch will provide critical information to track her menstrual cycle too, and empower her."  The Girls Foundation of Tanzania, 2019 Young women in low-resource communities have few, if any, opportunities to track their menstrual cycle. It's important to track your menstrual cycle so you know when you're due on your period, when you're in your most fertile window, and to learn about your behaviours and moods during the different stages. It is estimated that millions of school-aged girls are forced to stay at home each month around the time they’re menstruating. This is because they don’t know exactly when their period will start and they can’t afford sanitary products so don’t want to bleed at school. As well as this, schools often lack adequate sanitation facilities so managing your period and attending class becomes a huge challenge.To address this challenge, immi is filling the gap by creating a battery powered watch which allows users to track each day of their cycle and pairing this with sanitary products. 
In India, 23M girls drop out of school annually when they start menstruating

In Bangladesh, 41% of girls miss school every month because of menstruation

In the UK, over 100,000 girls miss school during their period
 Our watch allows you to see vital information so you know when you are in your most fertile window, and when you are due on your next period. We are partnering with non-profit organisations who provide in-person female health education and menstrual hygiene to girls. By providing their beneficiaries with the watch as well, we can empower young women to track their cycle, be prepared and stay in school.   We're making period tracking fashionable, convenient, and accessible to anyone, anywhere.  See more on our website   A chance for change We have partnered with six (and counting!) non-profit organisations globally. When you ‘Buy a watch for her’, it will go straight to one of their beneficiaries.  Our partner organisations based in Hong Kong, the Philippines, Vietnam, Ghana, Tanzania and Colombia (and a 7th in the UK!), focus on menstrual health and hygiene. By pairing the watch with sanitary products and in-person education, we can measure the impact this has on school attendance, knowledge about their own bodies, control during different parts of their cycle, and reduced stigma and shame around menstruation. We have three more non-profits based in Turkey, Nigeria and Bangladesh, who are queuing up to be on board for our pilot. If we exceed our target, we will have the ability to work with all of them, too!Thank you, in advance, we appreciate your support so much. Its really cool to wear a watch to school at their age.”- Evelyn Yeboah, Founder AWAT, Ghana The PerksYou can donate however much you want, whether that's £5 or £500, and we've created a bunch of perks to say thank you for your donation. story:
Hi There! With a very successful campaign on another Crowdfunding platform in August, Aftersocks was backed by 4,122 backers. With our Indiegogo Indemand we would like to give everyone one more chance to support our product.

All Perks placed via Indiegogo Indemand will be shipped end of October.

 

 

 

Did you watch the video? If not, please do! You really don't wanna miss it!




 

Question: Who loves gorgeous High-heels? 

Answer: Almost every woman on the planet!

But isn’t it frustrating when fabulous footwear results in achy feet? Your night is either cut short, or you grin and bear the discomfort in the name of letting your hair down and living life to the fullest. After a night out painting the town red, you’re hobbling barefoot along the pavement, desperately waving down a taxi and needing a pedicure.

You could try not wearing those shoes again. You know the ones. The high heels that always give you blisters. But they look so good, so elegant and sophisticated. When you kick back and let loose with your friends, you want all the focus to be on looking your fine, glamorous self. That means looking your best and contending with shoes that may look fab, but leave your feet longing for the fluffy embrace of cozy slippers, or at least the cool, flat surface of the ground. So two thirds into the night you find yourself reluctantly slipping off your heels, resigning yourself to being your actual height and lighting up the dance floor with bare feet that will later pad from the taxi to your front door, while your shoes dangle from your fingertips.

Do you really want to be padding around with bare feet, worrying about leaving your pinkies vulnerable to the elements when all you want to worry about is which club to hit next? Are you willing to sacrifice your favorite footwear for the sake of soles that don’t burn and ache like you’ve been on a coast to coast walking challenge?

The answer is obvious: no way!

Wear the uncomfy shoes and then walk around barefoot, or wear something sensible… and boring. It has long been a dilemma that many have faced, but for which none have found a satisfactory solution… until now. Now you have the opportunity to solve this age-old problem with a groundbreaking new creation that will surely have your toes twinkling with delight.

Aftersocks™

Aftersocks is an elegant solution to a problem that most women face. A solution so simple that no one ever thought of it: Aftersocks that have been thoughtfully designed and crafted with an underside constructed from PVC and extra soft layers of cushioning that hug the contours of your feet.

Why “after”?

Because you slip them out and onto your feet after you’ve cast aside the shoes that got you into party mode at the beginning of the evening but are now bringing the party down. Slip on Aftersocks, and they may not only cushion your feet and help to relieve the soreness, but they will also prevent your feet from getting dirty and further harmed by the elements on the dance floor, along the pavement, in the taxi… you name it.

Aftersocks are created from premium quality cotton, nylon, elastic, and PVC. They’re hand washable, meaning that they are easy to care for and are sure to last and last. Great for the environment! 

Available in a range of colors, we have a style to match any dress, evening gown, or trouser suit. Choose from Smooth Black, Trendy Silver, and Pretty Gold designs to match any type of evening wear in your wardrobe.

Not only are they super versatile, but they are also super discreet. Pop them into your handbag, clutch, or even into your back pocket for complete peace of mind. 

Support our campaign and be one of the first to take their piggies to market and luxuriate in the elegant comfort offered by Aftersocks, the versatile best friend that every sophisticated lady needs close at hand, and foot!

You probably wonder, is it really that small? Is it really that strong? Well, you decide! We've put it to the test and you can watch the results here:

 

Aftersocks™ compared with other "solutions / fixes" 

Size Guide

We've created Three sizes for the Indiegogo Aftersocks. We know that most regular socks have one fit, but because our "aftersole" is not stretchable, make sure to pick the right size. If you are doubting between 38-39, go for the bigger one, size M. Same applies for the Large. Then you are sure that the aftersole will protect the bottom of your feet entirely.

 

The Final Product Specifications: 

  • Premium Fabrics 

High quality Nylon and Cotton have been used to have the best durability and wear-ability. 75% Cotton | 20% Nylon | 5%.  Elastic

  • Aftersole technology 

Our special aftersole makes the bottom of the sock stronger and gives extra protection. Made of 100% PVC

  • Extra soft cushioning 

Added on the inside of the sock for an extra soft experience

  • Stylish design 

Three different designs available that can match any fashion outfit.

*these celebrities are not directly affiliated with aftersocks* and this video is for non-commercial use only

About the creators: 

Hi there! We are Monika Trojanowska & Joel Bijlmer, the founders of Aftersocks™. Like most good stories, ours started after a wild night out. After leaving the club Monika’s feet were hurting and she wanted to take off her high-heels. 

Of course, this was not something new.. Unfortunately, this time Joel had just twisted his back in the gym and could not offer a back-ride to the taxi this time. On the streets of Miami you never know what’s on the ground, so Joel didn’t want Monika to take off her high-heels and walk bare-feet. Neither did she have any backup shoes, cause she only had a small purse with her.

How did we get home? Well.. painful.. so we needed a solution!

Guess what? The next day we started thinking of a product that we could develop to solve this well known problem. We figured out that it had to be Useful, Portable and Stylish at the same time. After 9 months of developing, going back and forth with different solutions and designs, we finally created Aftersocks.

“Save your feet after a night out” Take off your heels, slip on Aftersocks™.

Because this is a new product, we faced the problem that we have to introduce people to this new “category”. In order to do so, research found that the Indiegogo platform would be the best choice. With this Indiegogo we hope to show every woman that this is the product they’ve been looking for!

We need to reach our goal, so that we can let our backers try the Aftersocks v.1 for the most affordable price ever. So we would love to see your support and help us fix a problem that most woman face!

Much love, Monika & Joel

We would love you to spread the word about Aftersocks. Feel free to tell your friends, family and the rest of the world!

Download the Aftersocks images or videos from our dropbox and use your creativity:

Click here to open the Aftersocks Dropbox 

If you are an influencer, you could even make money by spreading the word! Sign-up with our partner Kickbooster and get 15% of every pledge when a new Backer pledges through your unique referral code / link.

Click here to open the Influencer Affiliate program 

For distributor or business related questions please e-mail Joel at Info@aftersocks.com or visit our website on www.aftersocks.com

 

This project's logistics plan has passed a thorough 7-point review and we certify that they have an efficient and reliable logistics plan to deliver this good from the factory to their customers 


Aftersocks is a Registered Trademark & Patent Pending

 

Risks and challenges

We have worked extremely hard to create this product, launch it on Indiegogo, find a manufacturing partner and do the fulfillment, but here are what we see as the risks:

MANUFACTURING: The manufacturer is lined up, and we have quality assurance people on site during production. We already did a test run of 400 products, and that all went smooth.

FULFILLMENT/SHIPPING: We never know, but we might get insanely busy and stuff happens that can’t be planned for: a supplier misses a deadline, customs clearance or a shipment gets lost. Those things could cause a delay. We work with our fulfillment partner directly in Hongkong that will ship your rewards worldwide with a tracking code. You will receive the tracking code as soon as the rewards are shipped.

OUR PROMISE TO YOU: We understand that no campaign comes without challenges. Despite our planning, there are circumstances that may be out of our control. We promise to communicate with transparency and work to resolve any issues in a timely manner.

Please keep an eye out for our survey in order for us to deliver our socks in a timely manner. We will be messaging you through Indiegogo and your email.

story:
Who Are We?

We are JP and Terry, a trained sculptor and fine artist, and a production expert and have been involved in design and production for many years. We are both Irish, Terry is based in Shanghai and is focused on materials, production and quality and JP in Dublin where he focuses on design.

Smyth & Browne was born in the summer of 2012 in Dublin. We decided to design our first collection in 2013 for S/S 2014 and design with simplicity, quality and accessibility in mind, clothes for every man. We aim to make clothes and accessories that will be wardrobe staples for years to come and to promote Irish design and culture, moving away from the typical stereotypes.

The Smyth and Browne names are our mother's maiden names and are used as an homage to them. Much of the design is inspired by Irish and ancient Celtic motifs and patterns, but updated for the modern age.


We are undeniably Irish in spirit: urbane, timeless and well-worn.  It’s our belief that simplicity, functionality and quality are what matters today. Each of our exclusive products have been designed and developed by the founders themselves, both born and bred Irishmen; a fact that lends itself to the strong masculine aesthetic seen throughout the range. 

Seamlessly blending chic thoughtfully-cut lines that draw from a blend of the history of former days and the breakneck modernity of today, we offer contemporary apparel and accessories for men that are leaders, not followers, men like you.

At Smyth & Browne we offer durable and luxurious tees, polos, high quality leather goods, bags and accessories. 

The Smyth & Browne man would expect nothing less, and doesn’t listen to those who follow the crowd, and neither do we.  

We're now working on the 2014 Winter collection that will feature flat caps and scarves, and gloves made in traditional mills in Ireland, using Irish wool and tweeds. We will also be introducing a line of jewellery using reclaimed metals and leathers. 

What We Need

Let Us Break it Down For You Folks. 

We want to expand the business and get to the next level so we can make even more exciting products and promote Irish design further. To do this we need  $20000 to help us.

A large portion of the pledges will go toward in-depth research and purchase of materials and fabrics, tweeds, wools, for our 2014 winter line from mills in Ireland.

Next, we will upgrade our space In Shanghai from an apartment to a real concept workspace where we can show our process and make samples. A space designers and craftsmen can work together. This will include an investment in worktables, the purchase of a pattern printer, digital printer and new sewing machines in both Shanghai and Ireland- we have to outsource a lot of processes at the moment that we want to move in house.

Finally, we'll be adding more craftsmen to the team to help us ensure quality.

& What You Get

We know nothing is for free and we want to reward you for helping us.

We have lots of great perks that we know you'll love, from lapel pins, tees and polos, to some of our gorgeous bags and hoodies. All, of course dependent on the amount you fantastic people pledge. We have many of the perks in stock now and will send them out after the project funding period is complete, please bear with us as we have to put a date, many we will send out earlier.

If we reach our funding goal this will go a long way to promoting Irish culture and design, away from the usual stereotypes, and also allow us to continue producing excellent, functional and of course great looking menswear and accessories.


Why You Should Back Us:

You believe clothing should fit any man, and no-one should be excluded due to their size

You believe simplicity, functionality and quality are what matters today

You support Irish design and the advancement of modern Irish culture

You want to see what Smyth & Browne will do next with modern Irish clothing and accessories (we've got some big plans)

You can help us even further and support us by sharing our story with your friends, family, colleagues and the world! 

Don't forget use the Indiegogo share tools! We also love to hear from you, send us an email (talktous@smythbrowne.com) and follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and Weibo – follow us, like us, love us!


And that’s all there is to it.

Go raibh maith agat (that's thanks in Irish!)

Terry & JP
story_txt:

story:
Combining a Product Design and an App to find the most convenient and comfortable way to find, carry and drink water

Closca Bottle has a stretchy silicone flap-strap with a magnetic closure that makes it completely wearable.

And with more than 56,000 refill stations worldwide, the Closca Water App helps you located the nearest place where you can top off your H20 for free.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The best "must have" on @instagram

 

 

Wear your bottle with you Everyday Style.

story:
[15.03.2019]
Aufgrund Eures beeindruckenden Feedbacks und des Erreichens der erweiterten Finanzierungsziele, können wir folgende Änderungen für alle Kampagnen Backer realisieren. Das Wechselband erhalten alle, die unser Projekt während des Finanzierungszeitraums unterstützt haben.

[15.03.2019]
Based on your impressive feedback and the achievement of the extended funding goals, we are able to realise the following changes for all the campaign backers. The free strap is for all who supported our project during the financing period.

 

 


 

Das Modell Naos ist unsere Interpretation einer klassischen Dresswatch - und durch die sternförmige Anordnung der Indizes dennoch etwas Besonderes. Wie kein anderes Modell verkörpert es die Grundprinzipien der Marke Sternglas. Höchster Anspruch ohne viel Schnickschnack. Ehrlich, sachlich und auf den Punkt.

The model Naos is our very own interpretation of a classic dress watch - and yet everything but ordinary with its star-shaped arrangement of the indices. Like no other model it exactly embodies our core principles. The highest standards without any unnecessary embellishments. Honest, functional and to the point.

 

 

Neben einem klassischen Weiß (Zeiger: schwarz) ist die NAOS Automatik auch in einem edlen Schwarz (Zeiger: silberfarben) erhältlich. Um Deinen Zeitmesser passend zu ergänzen, hast Du die Wahl zwischen einer Auswahl samtweicher Kalbslederbänder – made in Germany – oder einem feinmaschigen Metallarmband im Milanaise-Stil. Dank Schnellwechselsystem kannst Du Dein Armband zudem mühelos und ohne Werkzeug wechseln. Ganz wonach Dir gerade ist.

The NAOS Automatik is available with a dial in a classic white tone (hands: black) or a noble black (hands: silver). Furthermore, you can choose between a super soft calf leather strap - made in Germany - or a fine, stainless steel milanese strap. The little extra: We equipped all our straps with our quick-release mechanism, so you can exchange your straps hassle-free and whatever you feel like.

 


 

 

 


 


Das ist unsere Grundhaltung, ganz gemäß des eigentlichen Gedankens des Bauhaus, an dem wir uns somit nicht nur gestalterisch orientieren. Denn wir von Sternglas bilden einen Gegenpol zu den Global-Playern und jungen Designmarken. Wir halten nichts von editorialen Inzenierungen oder einer künstlichen Exklusivierung. Vielmehr verstehen wir uns als eine demokratische Marke und grenzen niemanden durch eine elitäre Haltung aus. 

This is our leading mindset, true to the Bauhaus philosophy. We as Sternglas state an opposite pole to the global players and design brands. We don't fancy an editorial staging, neither a created exclusiveness. We rather see ourselves as a democratic brand and do not exclude anyone with an elitist approach. 
 

 

 


 


 


 


Etwas mehr als zwei Jahre sind vergangen, seitdem wir unser erstes Modell über die Crowdfunding Plattform Kickstarter auf den Markt gebracht haben. Seitdem hat sich vieles bei uns getan. Unsere Modellpalette und vor allem unser engagiertes Team hat sich stark vergrößert.

Nun ist es an der Zeit ein neues Projekt über Crowdfunding zu realisieren. Nach Monaten der Planung und jeder Menge kleinteiliger Veränderungen – zum Teil wieder verworfen, zum Teil weiter verfeinert – nimmt die Naos Automatik Gestalt an! Hinter jedem neuen Modell stecken unzählige Stunden Planung und Kommunikation. Der gelungene erste Prototyp entschädigt für die Strapazen.

A little more than two years ago, we launched our first model via Kickstarter. A lot has happened since then! Both our model range as well as our committed team has grown.

Now, two years later, it's time to start a new project via a crowdfunding platform. After months of planning and a lot of small changes again and again, the Naos Automatik is starting to take its shape. Behind every new model are endless hours of planning and communicating. However, the successful prototype makes up for all the strains.
 

 

 


 

Wir stehen in regem Austausch mit unserer Community und bemühen uns stets, konstruktives Feedback mit einzubeziehen. Der häufige Wunsch nach einer Automatikversion der NAOS blieb uns nicht verborgen - und stößt bei uns auf fruchtbaren Boden.

We always engage in eager exchanges with our community and aim to include your constructive feedback. The frequent request for an Automatic version of the NAOS could not been missed.

 

 

Mit einem Gehäusedurchmesser von 38 mm und einer Höhe von 10 mm ist die NAOS Automatik zurückhaltend, durch das fein gewölbte Saphirglas und die zarten Nadelzeiger aber dennoch anspruchsvoll und exklusiv. Der fein abgestimmte Rhythmus von Linien, Ziffern und Formen verhindert jeglichen Konflikt und macht sie so zu Deinem idealen und universellen Begleiter im Job und Alltag. 

Subtle with a case diameter of 38 mm and a height of 10 mm, but still sophisticated and exclusive by the use of the finely domed sapphire glass. The delicate tuned rhythm of lines, numbers and shapes prevents any conflict due to its simplicity, making it your ideal and universal companion. 

 

 

Das Gehäuse besticht durch polierten 316L Edelstahl und einen sechsfach verschraubten Boden. Ein Sichtboden aus Saphirglas ermöglicht den Blick auf das Herzstück: Das besonders wartungsarme Automatik Uhrwerk Kaliber 821A des bewährten japanischen Traditionsherstellers Miyota. Angetrieben durch die natürliche Bewegung des Trägers ermöglicht es eine Gangreserve von bis zu 42 Stunden. Solide und funktional. Mehr Uhr braucht es nicht.

The case features fine and polished 316L stainless steel and a sixfold screwed sapphire glass case back. The core of it: the movement of the caliber 821A by the proven and traditional japanese manufacturer Miyota. Powered by your natural movements it has a power reserve of up to 42 hours. A solid and functional timepiece. 
 


 

 

 


 


 

Aktuelles:

https://www.watchuseek.com/bauhaus-inspired-ste...

https://www.startupvalley.news/de/sternglas-uhrenmarke-uhren-im-hochwertigen-design/

https://www.hamburg-magazin.de/schoener-shoppen/musik-technik/artikel/detail/sternglas-zeigt-wie-man-mit-kickstarter-projekte-verwirklichen-kann.html

 

 

 

 

 

+   Profitiere als Vorbesteller von attraktiven Early Bird Rabatten und Vorzugspreisen
+   Sichere Dir Dein Exemplar der ersten Serie
+   Bestimme letzte Anpassungen aktiv mit
+   Erhalte Sneak Peeks und exklusive Einblicke in die Produktentwicklung
+   Als Unterstützer erhältst Du ein "Überraschungsgeschenk"

+   Benefit from attractive Early Bird discounts and special prices
+   Be one of the first one’s to get your model of the first series
+   Contribute your ideas for final adjustments
+   Receive Sneak Peeks and get exclusive insights into the product development process
+   Get a "surprise gift"
 



 

Zur unserer Deutschen Website: sternglas.de
To our English website: sternglas.com
 


Risks & Challenges

Wir arbeiten nun seit knapp 10 Jahren in der Schmuck- und Uhrenindustrie und sind uns über die Risiken bewusst, die bei der Entwicklung eines Produktes dieser Komplexität auftreten können. Gleichzeitig haben wir allerdings Wege gefunden, diese Risiken zu minimieren. Wir arbeiten eng zusammen mit bewährten Uhrmachern und Spezialisten der Branche und sind mittlerweile sicher darin, eine hohe Nachfrage zeitgemäß zu bedienen.

Sollten dennoch unerwartet Komplikationen auftreten, lassen wir es Dich selbstverständlich umgehend wissen – sowohl während der Kampagne, als auch danach.

Bei weiteren Fragen melde Dich gerne uns, unter support@sternglas.de
 

We worked in the watch & jewelry industry for nearly 10 years now and are very concerned about the risks and the unforeseen issues that may occur in manufacturing such complex products. However, we have anticipated and planned for such risks and have built up a proven production and delivery plan over the years. We work together with a couple of industry specialists and watchmakers to make this project a success. We've spent years in designing a supply chain that works and are therefore very confident about our capacity to provide high-quality products on time.

If by chance anything unexpected happens, we promise to keep you informed, both during the campaign and afterwards.

In case you have any questions, feel free to contact us at support-en@sternglas.de
